loans.name: Birobiya

texts.en:
Birobiya is a cheerful woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1969. She is living in a small city nearby a reservoir with her family. She is married and has a son. She is a nurse at a diagnostic center. Her husband is an emigrant and works to support his family.

She has a son who studies abroad at Near East University. He graduated high school with excellence and entered university to be an economic specialist. He is a well-behaved and bright person. He promised to get a higher education and come back to his homeland to be useful in social change for Tajikistan. He wants to be a good economic specialist and help his residents. Birobiya is satisfied and happy to send her son to study abroad. She wishes to be proud of her son. That is why she is asking for financial support to pay for her son’s university education costs. She hopes to be funded and awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to pay her son’s university education costs.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a Kiva borrower. She operates a farm where she grows potatoes and cabbages, and where she also keeps cows. She has been involved in this business for 15 years.

Susan's business is located in a productive area. She will use her 50,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 44 years old and supports four school-going children. She is a small-scale farmer. She has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya of KES 25,000. She will use the loan to buy a dairy cow to boost her farming activity by applying farm yard manure which will improve productivity.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to eradicate poverty from her family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to boost her farming activity by applying farm yard manure which will improve productivity.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a married man with two children. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man. He has 2 children.

Peter operates a dairy farm where he keeps cows. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in an area with potential, and his primary customers are locals.

Peter describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy 2 calves.

Peter hopes that, in the future, he will expand his business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy 2 calves.

loans.name: Ofelya

texts.en:
Ofelya is mother of three sons. She currently lives with her husband in Sisian town in the Syuniq region. Her two elder sons are migrant workers and her third son serves in the army.

Ofelya is involved in a retail clothing business in her house. She is asking for this loan to purchase a new collection of autumn clothing for women, men and kids to sell in the season. Ofelya has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Please help this hardworking woman to fund her loan and support her small business.

loans.use: to pay for a new collection of autumn clothing for women, men and kids to sell in the season.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Ella es Luz Elena, una mujer sonriente, humilde y trabajadora, la cual se dedica al comercio de mercancía, principalmente ropa para dama, pero igualmente vende de hombre, su método de trabajo es básico, ella recorre las calles, almacenes mostrando su mercancía y apunta cada pedido, si tiene la prenda lo entrega inmediatamente y da plazos de pago, para que los clientes tenga fácil accesos a sus productos.

Este método de trabajo le ha servido para ganar buena clientela, pero el principal problema es recoger la cartera y ya como ella sale diario a vender en ocasiones se queda sin capital para abastecerse de ropa, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de ropa juvenil, en especial para mujer y otro tanto de hombre, con el dinero cubrirá unos pedidos que tiene pendientes, permitiéndose cumplir y fidelizar a dichos clientes.

Todos estos esfuerzos los hace por crecer como empresa, buscando mejorar la calidad de vida de sus seres amados.
texts.en:
This is Luz Elena, a smiling woman, humble and hard-working. She makes a living from selling merchandise, mainly clothing for women, but she also sells men’s clothing. Her work method is simple: she walks the streets and the markets showing her merchandise and noting each order. If she has the garment, she delivers it immediately and gives the terms of payment so that the customers have easy access to her products.

This method of work has helped her gain a good clientele, but the main problem is collecting the payments, and since she goes out every day to sell, she is occasionally left without capital to stock up on clothing. Therefore, she wants to request a loan to purchase clothing for youths, especially for women and as much for men. With the money, she will fill some orders that she has pending, allowing her to fulfill and gain the loyalty of those customers.

She makes all of these efforts to grow as a business, looking to improve the quality of life for her loved ones.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for youths, especially for women and as much for men, to cover an order that is pending.

loans.name: Safiya

texts.en: Safiya is a 52-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and one child. Her husband is the main income source of the family. She cooperates with him to fulfill their life needs.  In 2012 she opened a small room in her house as a bakery where she produces breads. Today she needs to get a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase baking machinery and other items. She states that this machine will help her increase her business productivity which will return higher profits. She insists that she will be a permanent customer to be able to always develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase baking machinery and other items.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is from the community of Dagohoy in Bohol, Philippines. She is 50 years old and has been farming rice, together with her husband, for 30 years now.

Leonila is in need of additional capital through a loan in order to buy a hand tractor. With this, she will not spend so much on rental expenses and services from others.

Leonila hopes to expand her business, and manage it well, so it will continue to earn her and her husband savings and income for their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy a hand tractor.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a dairy farm where she keeps cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feeds and renovate her cow shed. She hopes that in the future she will meet her financial needs. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds and renovate her cow shed.

loans.name: Aied

texts.en: Aied is a 25-year-old married man from Khan Younis city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, which has had an economic blockade imposed by the Israeli authorities since 2007. Aied has a medical laboratory. It is a good business and makes a good profit, and he has good experience. Aied took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools for his laboratory . With this loan, Aied can expand his laboratory and improve service. Aied appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new tools for his laboratory.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is a married man with eight children. He describes himself as active. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to pay school fees for his children. His business goal is to have five more motorcycles within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children to university level. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en: Fridah is a married woman with one child. She describes herself as God fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future she will have a wholesale business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Saeed

texts.en: Saeed is a 33-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, which has had an economic blockade imposed by the Israeli authorities since 2007. Saeed is a farmer who also has a lag farm around his house. It is a good business and makes a good profit. He has good experience. He sowed different types of vegetables according to the season. But plants always need attention and  fertilizer. Saeed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy plant food and fertilizer for his farm and a little grain. With this loan Saeed can improve the quality and quantity of agricultural crops this year. Saeed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy plant food and fertilizer for his farm and a little grain.

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en: Nisrine is a 40-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and her three children, who are still studying. Her husband is an employee in a company. He is the main income source in the family to be able to enhance their way of living. As for her, she works from home as a tailor. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees. In the future, she plans to request more Kiva loans and help her children continue their education.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Dolorosa

texts.en: Dolorosa is 53 years old and from San Miguel, Bohol. She farms rice and manages a small piggery for a living. Dolorosa has been in this business for seven years now. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and feed for her business since this is expensive. Dolorosa knows that once her farm inputs and feed are taken care of, she can focus on working on her farm and taking care of her hogs so her animals are healthy. Dolorosa hopes to grow old with her husband in comfort and prosperity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and feed

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony is a married man. He describes himself as reliable. He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. His business goal is to open a retail shop for selling tailoring materials within five years. He hopes that in the future he will employ more staff. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris is a single man. He describes himself as focused. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, flour, bread, soap, and other items. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His primary customers are locals.

Morris describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use his 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, flour, and other items.

Morris' business goal is to have a wholesale shop within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis, con 68 años de edad, es un hombre casado, padre de 8 hijos. 
Nació y se crió en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agrícolas al lado de su padre; gracias a ello, hoy en día tiene cultivos de plátano, cuya cosecha es vendida y de esta manera obtiene los recursos para llevar el alimento a su hogar. 

El prestatario es un hombre pujante, luchador, dedicado a su familia y a su trabajo, eso lo motiva para trabajar largas jornadas y tratar de salir adelante; día a día lucha para sobrepasar los obstáculos que se le presentan, ha pasado por situaciones económicas difíciles debido al bajo precio del plátano en el mercado, lo que afecta el precio de su producto. 

Luis solicita su crédito en la Corporación Interactuar para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas), con el fin de darle continuidad a su negocio y preparar sus cultivos para cosechar un producto de muy buena calidad.

Luis sueña con mejorar sus cultivos, ampliarlos para obtener de estos una buena renta mensual.
texts.en:
Luis, 68, is a married man, the father of 8 children.

He was born and raised in the countryside, where he learned agricultural tasks at his father's side. Thanks to that, today he grows plantains, whose harvest is sold and in this way he gets the resources to bring food to his home.

The borrower is a strong man, determined, and dedicated to his family and his work. This motivates him to work long days and try to get ahead. Day by day he fights to overcome the obstacles that come up. He has had difficult economic situations due to the low price of plantains in the market, which affects the price of his product.

Luis asks for his loan from Corporación Interactuar to invest it in the purchase of agricultural supplies (manure, fertilizers, pesticides) with the end of giving his business continuity and preparing his crops for a harvest of a very good-quality product.

Luis dreams of improving his crops, expanding them to get a good monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies (manure, fertilizer, pesticides).

loans.name: Dora Milena

texts.es:
Dora es una mujer soltera con 25 años de edad, que desde hace poco logro montar su propio negocio, un taller de confecciones a terceros, actividad que aprendió por medio de una clases a las cuales asistió. Con esto logro superar una fuerte situación económica que vivió luego de quedarse sin empleo por varios meses.

Actualmente presenta una dificultad, no cuenta con unas máquinas las cuales le permiten realizar su labor de una mejor manera, es por esto que solicita un préstamo, para la compra de una maquina fileteadora y otra semi-industrial.

Dora quiere continuar trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de comprar su vivienda propia, tener una buena estabilidad económica y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dora is 25 years old and single. Not long ago she managed to start her own business, a shop in which she sews for third parties. She learned this skill through classes she attended. Her business allowed her to overcome a tough economic situation she experienced after being unemployed for several months.

She is currently faced with a problem. She lacks the machines that would allow her to work more productively. For that reason she seeks a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine and a semi-industrial sewing machine.

Dora wants to continue working until she achieves her dreams of buying a home, having good economic stability and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and a semi-industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Nancy Del Socorro

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer muy emprendedora y creativa, desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente y tener su propio negocio de venta de ropa.

Actualmente puede materializar su sueño gracias su gran capacidad de trabajo, al apoyo que recibe de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que deseen que él salga adelante con su negocio.

De este negocio dependerán sus tres hijos.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar surtido de lencería y bordados para vender y así poder iniciar con este negocio.

Con un préstamo podrás a poyar a una mujer llena de vida y empuje para su familia!
texts.en:
Nancy is a very enterprising and creative woman who, for a long time, has wanted to be independent and have her own business selling clothing.

Currently, she can make her dream happen thanks to her great capacity for work and the support that she is getting from Corporación Interactuar and from the people who want her to get ahead with her business.

Her three children will depend on this business.

She asks for a loan to purchase an assortment of lingerie and embroidery to sell and, so, to be able to begin with this business.

With the loan you will be able to support a woman full of life and drive for her family!

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of lingerie and embroidery to sell and, so, to be able to begin with this business.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio es un incasable trabajador el cual labora los 7 días de la semana 12 horas por días, todo ello porque quiere cumplir su sueño de tener una vivienda propia para vivir tranquilamente junto con su pareja y sus dos hijos.

Julio se dedica al alquiler de lavadoras, un negocio  muy común en la zona de Sincelejo, donde estos artículos domésticos son de difícil acceso y mantenimiento para los hogares de la familia, debido a que no cuentan con el capital para adquirirlos.

Julio es un intermediario que ofrece el servicio y las lleva a domicilio hasta la vivienda, la principal dificultad es el trato que les puedan dar y que por el desplazamiento se puedan averiar con mayor facilidad y esto obliga a Julio a tener repuestos siempre a la mano o a reponer maquinaria con frecuencia.

Pensando en su familia, en mejorar las condiciones de vivienda, pagar la educación de sus hijos, su dotación estudiantil, Julio quiere solicitar un pequeño monto de dinero para la compra de 3 lavadoras con la cual aumentara su alcance, todo ello con el objetivo de cubrir la demanda que tiene actualmente, que con el tiempo se traducirá en un mayor beneficio económico para él.
texts.en:
Julio is a tireless worker who works 7 days a week, 12 hours per day, all of this because he wants to achieve his dream of having his own house in which to live peacefully with his partner and their two children.

Julio works renting washing machines, a very common business in the Sincelejo zone, where these domestic items are difficult to access and maintain for the family households because they don't have the capital to get them.

Julio is an intermediary who offers the service and delivers them to the homes, the primary difficulty is the treatment that they can give the machines and that by carrying them around, they can fall apart more easily and this requires Julio to always have spare parts at hand or to replace machines frequently.

Thinking of his family, in improving the conditions of the house, paying for his children's education and their student resources, Julio wants to ask for a small amount of money for the purchase of 3 washing machines with which he will increase his reach, all of this with the objective of covering the demand that he currently has which, with time, with translate to more of an economic benefit for him.

loans.use: to purchase three washing machines to improve his washing machine rental business's coverage.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Sandra Milena es una mujer que trabaja la estética capilar, manicure, pedicura, maquilla, sus características son: ser una persona organizada, honesta, pulida, agradable, que hace todo lo posible por  brindar un buen servicio a su cliente, ya que su principal objetivo es lograr que vuelva.

Sandra es Madre de 2 hijos de 15 y 5 años de edad, vive con su pareja, juntos están construyendo un hogar firme, comparten sueños como tener casa propia y pagar la educación de sus hijos y en el camino mejorar las condiciones de vida.

Sandra ha ganado terreno en el sector de manicura y pedicura, pero igual está muy capacitada para el arreglo de cabello, tinturas, rayos, cortes de pelo, etc., por tal razón desea solicitar un préstamo para la compra de químicos, tinturas, cepillos, hebillas y demás implementos para incentivar sus servicios capilares.
texts.en:
Sandra Milena is a woman who works in hair aesthetics, manicure, pedicure, and make up. Her characteristics are: being an organized person, honest, strong, and friendly, who does everything possible to offer good customer service, since her primary objective is to get them to come back.

Sandra is the mother of 2 children, ages 15 and 5. She lives with her partner and together they are building a strong home, they share dreams such as having their own house and paying for their children's education and, on the way, improving their living conditions.

Sandra has gained ground in the manicure and pedicure sector, but she is also very well-trained for styling hair, dying, highlighting, haircuts, etc., so she wants to ask for a loan to purchase chemicals, dyes, combs, clips, and other tools to encourage her hair care services.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, elements and accessories to encourage her hair services.

loans.name: Alba Cecilia

texts.es:
Una mujer trabajadora, humilde y llena de vida, así es alba, a sus 42 años de edad, se dedica a la cría de ganado. Un medio por el cual ha logrado salir adelante con sus dos hijos menores, los cuales los abandono su padre desde muy pequeños.
Como madre soltera sueña con poder brindarle a sus hijos lo mejor y poder apoyarlos económicamente en sus estudios.

Alba se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de cerdo y alimento para los mismos.
Con su aporte esta madre invertirá en un mejor futuro para su familia.
texts.en:
A hard-working woman, humble and full of life, this is Alba, who at 42 years old works raising livestock. It is a means for which she has managed to get ahead with her two minor children, who were abandoned by their father when they were very little.

As a single mother, she dreams of being able to offer her children the best and be able to support them economically in their education.

Alba is asking for a loan which she will invest in the purchase of pigs and feed for them.

With your contribution, this mother will invest in a better future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Alexander Jhon

texts.es:
Alexander, es un joven estudiante de SENATI que vive en la ciudad de Arequipa, ubicada en la hermosa sierra peruana.

Él estudia la carrera de Mecánica de Mantenimiento, la cual le interesa mucho, porque es una carrera muy amplia en el campo laboral, y podrá encontrar trabajo en soldadura, electricidad, tornería, etc. Alexander está seguro que su carrera le permitirá convertirse en un excelente profesional técnico, podrá apoyar a sus padres, quienes se sentirán muy orgullosos de tener un hijo que se logró profesionalmente.

Actualmente se encuentra estudiando el 1er. año de su carrera, aún le falta para culminar 2 años más. El tiempo que le dedica a sus estudios es de 18 horas a la semana. Cuando termine su carrera, él piensa trabajar en una empresa importante como es la Minera Cerro Verde, luego de obtener toda la experiencia de su trabajo, piensa formar su propia empresa de fabricación de partes mecánicas.

Alexander está solicitando el apoyo de KIVA para poder solventar sus gastos académicos. Este préstamos le permitirá ahorrar dinero para que en un futuro el pueda estudiar en la universidad, logrando grandes cambios en su vida profesional, porque le permitirá desenvolverse mejor como persona, haciendo lo que tanto le gusta.

El mayor sueño en su vida, a corto plazo es concluir sus estudios con las más altas calificaciones, ingresar y acabar sus estudios universitarios. Le gustaría ser un ingeniero para poder formar su propia empresa a largo plazo. El mayor obstáculo que tiene es la difícil situación económica por la que atraviesa su familia, que pone en riesgo su continuidad profesional.

Alexander se siente muy bien por el apoyo que KIVA le está brindando, porque es algo que lo va a beneficiar a él y a los que lo rodean. Él quiere expresarle a KIVA lo siguiente: "Gracias por todo el apoyo que me dan, no los defraudaré y le pondré más ganas a mis estudios".
texts.en:
Alexander, a young student at Senati [a vocational training and technical education school], lives in the city of Arequipa, which is located in the beautiful Peruvian Sierra. 

He is studying for a degree in Mechanical Maintenance, which he is very interested in because there are a wide range of opportunities in the workplace, and he will be able to find work in welding, electricity, lathing, etc. Alexander is certain that his degree will allow him to become an excellent technical professional, which will enable him to support his parents, who will feel very proud to have a son that will become a professional.

Currently, he is studying in the first year of his career, but still needs two more years to finish.  He spends eighteen hours a week on his studies.  When he earns his degree, he plans to work in an important company such as the “Minera Cerro Verde”.  Then, after obtaining all the experience from his job, he plans to start his own company manufacturing mechanical parts.

Alexander is requesting support form Kiva to be able to pay his tuition costs.  This loan will allow him to save money so that he can study at the university in the future, and achieve great changes in his professional life.  In this way, he will develop as a better person, doing what he loves so much.

The great dream of his life for the short term is to complete his studies with the highest grades, and then enroll and complete his university studies.  In the long term, he would like to become an engineer, and be able to form his own company.  The greatest obstacle he has is the difficult financial situation his family is facing, which is placing his professional continuity at risk.

Alexander feels very good about the support Kiva is offering, because it is something that benefits him as well as those around him.  He wishes to express the following to Kiva: “Thank you for all the support you give me, I will not let you down, and I will put the most effort into my studies”.

loans.use: to pay the tuition for his Mechanical Maintenance program, and thus successfully complete his degree.

loans.name: César Gregorio

texts.es:
Cesar es un hombre amable y paciente de 25 años de edad, el cual experimento hace 10 meses una de las mayores alegrías que podrá tener en su vida, se convirtió en padre y no de uno, sino de dos hermosos gemelos los cuales lo inspira a dar lo mejor de sí en cada día de trabajo para llevar el alimento y lo necesario para brindarle a su familia todo lo necesario para que vivan cómodamente.

Cesar quiere convetirse en  empresario independiente, dedicarse a la cría y levante de pollos, actividad que le enseño su tía y con la que quiere solventar todas las necesidades economicas que se le presenten a futuro.

Para crear su negocio, Cesar quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de pollos, alimento y vacunas, para tener una entrada de dinero importante para sostener su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar is a friendly and patient 25-year-old man. Ten months ago, he experienced one of the greatest joys that you can have in life: he became a father to not one, but two twin daughters. His daughters inspire him to give his best every day at work in order to provide food and what is necessary for his family so that they can live comfortably.

Cesar wants to become an independent business owner, engaged in breeding and raising chickens. He learned this occupation from his aunt and with it, he wants to meet all of the economic needs that may present themselves in the future.

In order to create his business, Cesar wants to request a loan for the purchase of chickens, food, and vaccines, to have the inflow of money important to sustain his family.

loans.use: to start a bird breeding business, in order to generate income to support his twin 10-month-old daughters.

loans.name: Carlos Alonso

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre soltero de 29 años de edad, soltero pero tiene dos muchachos que aprecia mucho y trabaja en post de ellos.

Su negocio es la cría de aves, lo que podemos apreciar en la foto son pollitos, en el momento está en proceso de crecimiento y necesitan vitaminas y cuido de engorde, por dicha razón quiere solicita run préstamo ya que no cuenta con el capital para realizarlo, también quiere comprar pollos, todo en grandes cantidades para tener un abastecimiento por un buen periodo de tiempo.

La razón del préstamo va de la mano en su plan de crecimiento y búsqueda de mejores oportunidades de negocios con inversionistas mayoristas.
texts.en:
Carlos is 29 years old. He is single but has two children whom he cherishes and for whose benefit he works. His business is the raising of birds, specifically chicks, as seen in the photo. They are currently in the process of growing and need vitamins and fattening additives.

For that reason he wants to seek a loan since he lacks the capital for this. He would also like to buy chicks in large quantities to have a supply for a long period of time. The purpose of the loan goes hand in hand with his plan of growth and his search for better business opportunities with wholesale investors.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Meliza Eugenia

texts.es:
Meliza, en su mente lo único que tiene presente es que para salir adelante hay que trabajar duramente y mantenerse siempre fuerte ante las adversidades que se puedan presentar.
Por esta razón, todos los días labora de una manera firme pero sin dejar a un lado su gran sonrisa y carisma que le han permitido ganarse un lugar desde hace 1 año cuando decidió iniciar su negocio de venta de mercancía en el municipio de Caucasia.

Pide un apoyo económico para la compra de surtido de calzado para aumentar su inventario.

Ella sabe que de la mano de interactuar y con el apoyo de los prestamistas de KIVA podrá tener un negocio muy bien acreditado y con la mejor estabilidad posible.
texts.en:
Meliza has in her mind only that, in order to get ahead, one has to work hard and always be strong in the face of adversities that can come up.

For this reason, every day she works in a firm way but without neglecting her big smile and charisma which have always allowed her to earn a spot from the first year when she decided begin her business selling merchandise in the municipality of Caucasia.

She asks for a loan to purchase an assortment of shoes to increase her inventory.

She knows that at the hand of Interactuar and with the support of the Kiva lenders, she will have a very well-known business with the best possible stability.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of shoes to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Saul Alberto

texts.es:
Saúl es un hombre soltero con 50 años de edad, dedicado a vender mercancía desde el municipio de Barbosa, con esto logros obtener los ingresos suficientes para cubrir sus necesidades.

Actualmente tiene una dificulta, tiene una deuda con unas personas las cuales son las que lo surten de mercancía, es por esto que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo, para pagarle a sus proveedores.

Su meta en continuar trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de tener su vivienda propia.
Ayude a este empresario para que pueda hacer de sus sueños una realidad, contribuya con un préstamo.
texts.en:
Saúl is a single 50 year old man. He works selling merchandise from the municipality of Barbosa. He has sufficient income from the profits to cover his needs.

At present he has a problem. He owes money to some people who supply him with merchandise. So he is requesting a loan to pay his suppliers.

His goal is to continue to work until he achieves his dream of owning a house.

Help this entrepreneur so he can make his dreams a reality. Contribute with a loan.

loans.use: to pay his suppliers.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh, 46, lives with her husband and five children in Saida, Lebanon; two of her children are still attending school. For many years her husband has supported the family by operating a small market, while Fatmeh is a housewife dedicated to caring for her house and family.


Fatmeh wants to help her children obtain their education. For that reason, she has applied for a 575 USD loan through Kiva's field partner vitas s.a.l to pay their school fees for the New Year. She would be overjoyed to see them graduate and achieve their Master’s degrees.

loans.use: to complete her children's school fees for the new year.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man. He has one child. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, flour, bread, soap, and other items.

He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, flour, and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP micro-finance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Nura

texts.en:
Nura, 32, is a young lady who hails from a small village of Sambalpur district. She has a small family comprised of her ill mother in law, her husband who works as a mason, and a four year old son.

Nura performs all the household chores and the income earned by her husband is used to meet all the household expenditures including the medicinal expenditures of her ill mother in law. Nura doesn't have access to a toilet in her home.

She is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum to build a new toilet in her home as her family is facing a lot of difficulties in going outside to attend to nature's call, especially her old ill mother in law.

Nura is eagerly awaiting your help and has full faith that you will understand her circumstances and extend your help.

loans.use: to build a new toilet

loans.name: Sveta

texts.en:
Sveta lives with her husband and is involved in agribusiness. She is a very nice and enthusiastic farmer with many goals for developing her farm.

Sveta's current farm is not big (only three piglets and a cow) but she works hard to save money and enlarge the livestock. Sveta asks lenders to support her with purchasing three pigs for her farm. This will help her to feed and grow them, and sell during the coming cold season for a good price.

As this is Sveta's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 600 borrowers like Sveta will get a chance to have their first loan and develop their business.

Sveta and her husband hope to receive lenders' support and build the farm of their dreams.

loans.use: to pay for three pigs

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man. He has eight children. He describes himself to be industrious.

He operates a retail shop where he sells flour, soap, rice, sugar, and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His primary customers are locals.

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, flour, and other items.

His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Chrispine

texts.en:
Chrispine is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be risk-taker.

He operates a retail shop where he sells flour, soap, rice, sugar, and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds.

He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, flour, and other items.

His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living standards. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Pankajini

texts.en:
Pankajini,42 is a charismatic, industrious, and humble lady. She hails from a small village of Sambalpur district. She lives with her husband who is a farmer and two sons who are grown up and work in a nearby garage.

Pankajini has a sewing business and processes her customers' orders within the required time. Everyone loves and respects her in the community due to her good behavior.

Pankajini does not have access to a toilet in her home. Therefore, she is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum to build a new toilet and provide her family with cleanliness and promote safety and hygiene in the community.

Pankajini aspires to open a boutique and display her dress materials in order to attract a larger segment of customers and increase her income in the future.

loans.use: to build a new toilet

loans.name: Sarojini

texts.en:
Sarojini, 42, is a simple, generous, and humble lady who hails from a small village of Sambalpur disttrict. She lives with her three grown up sons and her husband who is a truck driver.

Sarojini has always made her living through lot of financial hardships and has had access to limited resources. She does not have access to a toilet in her home and many a times she has suffered from infections due to open urination and defecation.

In order to maintain her health and hygiene, Sarojini is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR to build a new toilet and to install a commode, shower, and other necessary sanitary fittings in it.

Sarojini has a dream of purchasing a taxi and starting a transportation business in order to make her family financially strong.

loans.use: to build a new toilet and to install a commode, shower, and other necessary sanitary fittings in it.

loans.name: Khoudia's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé depuis novembre 2013,réuni des membres qui habitent le même village et ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Khoudia qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo,en position assise au premier plan et levant le bras,est la représentante du groupe,elle est âgée de 51 ans,est mariée et mére de 03 enfants dont 02 filles.

Son activité est le commerce de sucre,de café.Elle s'approvisionne au niveau des grossistes de la commune et parvient à revendre en suite dans son village.

Elle compte acheter 02 sacs de sucre à 30000f le sac,01 kg de café à 2000f et un mouton à 25000f.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et de constituer un fonds de roulement  pour acheter d'autres moutons.
texts.en:
This group, created in November 2013, is composed of members living in the same village, and their work involves small-scale commerce. Khoudia, found sitting in the foreground at the far right in the photo with an arm raised, is the group's representative. She is 51 years old and a married mother of three children, including two girls. She does commerce in sugar and coffee. She gets her supplies from wholesalers in town and manages to resell the merchandise in her village.

Khoudia intends to purchase 2 sacks of sugar for 30,000 francs per sack; a kilo of coffee at 2,000 francs; and a sheep for 25,000 francs. Her goal is to increase her savings and to build up working capital to buy more sheep.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, and one sheep.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita lives in Talibon, Bohol with her family. She is 53 years old.

She is engaged in multiple business for an income. She owns a rice mill business, and she also raises hogs and farms rice. These businesses have been thriving for nine years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy crude oil for her rice mill business and spare parts for the machine to upgrade it. This will allow her to make her business more profitable if she can speed up her productivity.

In the future, Anecita hopes to continue making expansion to increase business profitability.

loans.use: to buy crude oil for her rice mill business and spare parts for the machine.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en: Linet is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail shop where she sells beauty products. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate funds. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of beauty products. She hopes that in the future she will have increased profits. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh, 48, lives with her husband and four children in Baalback, Lebanon. She is a housewife, and her husband supports the family with the income from his small restaurant in the town.


But because of difficult circumstances, Fatmeh is applying for a 575 USD loan through Kiva's field partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay for her children’s educational fees, the second time she has done so. She is very happy to be able to register her children for the coming school year.

loans.use: to pay for her children's educational fees.

loans.name: Ganga Group

texts.en:
Ganga Group started in the year 2015 at Bhawanipatana of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. They are eight active self-dependent women who have the objective of developing their existing businesses and improving their livelihood. All the members of the group have their own profession and business.

Gomati is one of the group. She has taken on a great role in her own development and in developing the group members’ source of revenue improvement. She is standing in the first row, second from left, with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 39 years old and lives with her family: her husband and three sons.

Gomati has been running a tea stall and selling some bakery items beside her home for the last 18 years. Her husband is helping her promote the business. In this business, she earns a monthly income of 7,000 Indian rupees (INR). Her opinion is that it is very difficult to maintain her family with this small income in the current market situation. To get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible. So Gomati formed a group for strengthening social relations and to access a loan for the expansion of her business.

Gomati plans to purchase various bakery items, sugar, tea and other related items from the wholesaler. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for the construction of her own house.

The other seven members of the group are also smart at their professions and also actively engaged with different businesses, such as tailoring, a rice business, snack shop, and grocery shop. With this loan, they also hope to improve their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase various bakery items, sugar, tea and other related items.

loans.name: Yuneida

texts.es:
La señora Yuneida toda su vida estuvo buscando una manera de generar recursos, pues sabía que el dinero no caía del cielo, tomar una pequeño capital ahorrado que tenia, compro algunos productos alimenticios y los vendió; con el paso del tiempo le fue gustando mucho la vocación de ventas e hizo grandes sacrificios para poder montar un negocio comercial. 

Hoy a sus 31 años de edad, con el negocio ya montado, busca la manera de sostenerlo y poder generar empleo.

Quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de gelatinas al por mayor mara poder mejorar sus ventas y poder sostener a su pequeño hijo. (Ver Foto)
texts.en:
All her life, Señora Yuneida has been searching for a way to generate income, since she knows that money doesn't fall from the sky. She took a little capital that she had saved and bought some food products and sold them. With the passing of time, she was enjoying the sales work a lot, and she made great sacrifices to be able to set up a commercial business.

Now, at the age of 31, with the business already set up, she is looking for a way to sustain it and to be able to generate employment.

She wants to apply for a loan for the purchase of jellies wholesale in order to be able to improve her sales and support her little son (see the photo).

loans.use: to buy jellies wholesale in order to be able to improve her sales.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is forty years old and married with three children. She earns a living by fattening and selling pigs in the Philippines. She also earns additional income by selling food.


Julia is borrowing 9000 PHP through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She is working tirelessly to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who for the past four years has bought and sold used clothing in the Philippines. She earns additional income running a sari-sari, or small general store.


Helen has applied for a 15,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell. She has been sustaining her business through her own efforts and the help of loans from NWTF. She is working continuously to save enough money to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Julio

texts.es:
Julio es una persona humilde y trabajadora, sonriente que lucha día a día por mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y familia la cual está conformada por él, su esposa y dos hijos masculinos de 4 y 8 años de edad.

Es un orgullo agricultor, se dedica al cultivo del producto insignia de Colombia, el café, para llegar al cultivo tiene que hacer un largo desplazamiento pero no le importa porque gracias a este cultivo la calidad de vida de su familia ha ido en crecimiento.

Seguir mejorando constantemente, tener capital para pagar la educación de sus hijos, son los anhelos y los motivos por el cuales trabaja y su mentalidad emprendedora y ganadora lo hacen siempre buscar mejorar su cultivo, por ello quiere acudir a un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas y compra de gallinaza, para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos, los insumos serían principalmente semillas, abonos, riegos, pesticidas y fungicidas.
texts.en: Julio is a humble, hardworking and smiling person who works every day to improve the situation of his home and family, comprised by him, his wife and two sons, 4 and 8 years old. He is a proud farmer who works cultivating the main product of Colombia, coffee. In order to reach his crops, he needs to travel for a long time. This is not a problem for him, because thanks to this cultivation, his family's quality of life has kept on growing. His wishes and motivation for which he works are to constantly continue improving and to have the capital to pay for his children's education. His winning and enterprising mentality make him always look for ways to improve his crops. For this reason, he wants to request a loan to buy agricultural inputs and to buy "gallinaza" (organic fertilizer) to maintain his crops. The inputs will be mainly seeds, manure, irrigation, pesticides and fungicides.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and gallinaza (organic fertilizer) to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
En el año 2000 fue el principio de un cambio total en la vida del campesino Jaime, una persona humilde y verraca que se desempeñaba como mayordomo, pero su mente ganadora y las ganas de salir adelante lo llevaron a comenzar su cultivo, un negocio que ha sabido administrar y ha logrado grandes cosas, ampliarlo, tener un camión para distribuir sus productos y una buena calidad de vida para su familia.

Pagar la educación de su muchacha de 2 años de edad es su deseo, mantener su cultivo y dejar un buen legado a esa niña es su meta.

Jaime quiere solicitar un préstamo para reparar el camión donde transporta sus productos, el resto de dinero lo quiere invertir en insumos agrícolas para el mantenimiento de todos sus cultivos.
texts.en:
The year 2000 was the beginning of a complete change in the life of the farmer Jaime, a humble and determined person who works as a foreman. But his head for business and the will to get ahead brought him to begin farming, a business that he knew how to manage, and he has accomplished great things. He expanded it, and he has a truck to distribute his products and a good quality of life for his family.

His wish is to pay for the education of his 2-year-old little girl, and his goal is to maintain his farm and leave a good legacy to this child.

Jaime wants to apply for a loan to repair the truck in which he transports his products, and he wants to invest the rest of the money in agricultural supplies to maintain all his crops.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle in which he transports his products and use the rest of the capital for the purchase of agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Nematinlaye Group

texts.fr:
Mme MAMOUNATA est responsable du groupe NEMATINLAYE. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 08 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. 01 enfant va à l’école et elle a 06 personnes en charge.
Mme fait de l’agriculture depuis 09 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte acheter 02 sacs d’engrais et 05 boîtes d’herbicides.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour renforcer son activité et payer un bœuf. Elle ambitionne acheter une moto.
texts.en:
Ms. MAMOUNATA is the official of the group NEMATINLAYE. She is a married mother of three children. The oldest is 8 years old, and the youngest is 3. One child goes to school. She has six persons to support.

Ms. MAMOUNATA has been farming for nine years. She gets her supplies from nearby markets.

With the money granted, she intends to purchase 2 sacks of fertilizer and 5 cans of herbicides. She wants to use the profits from the loan to bolster her business and pay for a head of cattle. Her ambition is to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of fertilizer and 5 cans of herbicides

loans.name: Themebokin Group

texts.fr:
Mme HALIMATA est responsable du groupe  THEMEBOKIN. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 12 ans et le moins âgé a 01 an.  02 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 07 personnes en charge.
Mme fait du jardinage depuis 10 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé elle compte acheter 03 sacs d’engrais, 02 boîtes d’herbicides, 01 boîte de graine de choux.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour renforcer son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle ambitionne faire de l’élevage et acheter une moto.
texts.en:
Ms. HALIMATA is the official of the group THEMEBOKIN. She is a married mother of four children. The oldest is 12 years old, and the youngest is 1. Two children go to school. She has seven persons to support.

Ms. HALIMATA has had a market garden for ten years. She gets her supplies from nearby markets.

With the money granted, she intends to purchase 3 sacks of fertilizer, 2 cans of herbicides, and a can of cabbage seeds. She wants to use the profits from the loan to bolster her business and improve her family’s living conditions. Her ambition is to raise livestock and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of fertilizer, 2 containers of herbicides, and a container of cabbage seeds

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Para Francisco, ser el único vendedor grande de carne, es una gran ventaja para sacar su negocio adelante. 

Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital para comprar surtido y por ello quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar gran cantidad de carne, de este modo impulsar su negocio y hacerlo más prospero.
 
Su principal sueño es tener un negocio estable, un local comercial, mejorar ventas, y que este negocio le dé estabilidad económica y lo suficiente para cubrir sus necesidades y las de sus dos hijas.
texts.en:
For Francisco, being the only big seller of meat is a great advantage for moving his business forward.

His principal difficulty is the lack of capital to buy stock, and for that he wants to apply for a loan to buy a large quantity of meat. In this way he will boost his business and make it more prosperous.

His principal dream is to have a stable business, a commercial space, improve sales, and have this business give him economic stability and sufficient resources to cover his needs and those of his two daughters.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of meat to boost his business and make it more prosperous.

loans.name: Ludivia

texts.es:
En la cría de aves encuentran muchas personas una gran oportunidad de vida y desarrollo, tal es el caso de Ludivia que con sus 34 años tiene un pequeño negocio de cría de gallinas ponedoras y pollos de engorde, los cuales alimenta para venderlos posteriormente.

Vive en el municipio de Mariquita donde comparte su vida con su esposo.
Son una familia humilde pero muy trabajadora y sincera.
En los ojos de esta campesina se refleja el esfuerzo y el pasar de los años con un gran corazón.

Solicita un apoyo económico para la compra de gallinas, pollos y alimento para los mismo, de este forma lograra aumentar su producción y mejorar su capital de trabajo para ofrecerle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Raising birds gives many people a great opportunity in life to develop a business.  This is the case with Ludivia, 34, who has a small business raising laying hens and chickens which she feeds to fatten and later sell. Ludivia lives in the municipality of Mariquita, where she shares her life with her husband.  They are a humble family, but are hardworking and sincere.

In the eyes of this woman, who has a great heart, you can see the effort over the passing years.  Ludivia is requesting a loan to buy hens, chickens, and chicken feed.  In this way, she can increase her production and have more working capital so that she can provide her family with greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy hens, chicken, and chicken feed

loans.name: Amakene Group

texts.fr: Dans la photo la femme qui  tient  la corde du mouton est  Satou. Elle est  Malienne analphabète âgée de 48 ans mariée et mère de 9 enfants dont  une fille et 4 garçons Scolarisés. Son mari est un agriculteur. Elle fait l’élevage  il y’a 12 ans et gagne environs 40 000fcf de bénéfice à la vente. Elle achète ses montons au marché local et les revend chez lui aux acheteurs. Satou  cherche un prêt au près du RMCR pour acheter des moutons et aliment bétail pour développer son activité d’élevage et augmenter ses revenus. Le profit que son activité va générer l’aidera de payer les habits supplémentaires pour ses enfants  et soutenir les frais de leur fournitures scolaires.
texts.en:
In the photo, the woman holding the sheep’s rope is Satou. She is Malian, illiterate, 48 years old, married, and the mother of nine children, of whom a girl and 4 boys are in school. Her husband is a farmer. Satou has been raising livestock for twelve years and earns about 40,000 francs CFA of profit from her sales. She purchases her sheep at the local market and resells them to buyers there.

Satou is seeking a loan from RMCR to purchase sheep and some feed to develop her livestock business and to increase her revenues. The profit her business will generate is going to help her to pay for extra clothing for her children and to cover the cost of their school supplies.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to sell

loans.name: Sidony's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé depuis 2009 rassemble des membres qui habitent le même village et ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Sidony qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la représentante du groupe,elle est âgée de 40 ans,est mariée et mére de 04 enfants dont 02 garçons

Son activité est le commerce de légumes ,de bananes et d'ingrédients tel que: le piment

Elle compte acheter avec le crédit 15 kg de piments à200 f le kg,40 kg de Gombo à 1000f le kg et 30000f de bananes à 175 f le kg.

Le bénéfice réalisé lui permettra  d'assurer la scolarité de ses enfants,de consolider son activité et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
This group, created in 2009, is composed of members living in the same village. Their work involves small-scale commerce. Sidony, found at the right in the photo with an arm raised, is the group's representative. She is 40 years old, married, and a mother of four children, including two boys. She does commerce in vegetables, bananas, and ingredients, such as: chili peppers.

With this loan, Sidony intends to purchase 15 kg of chili peppers at 200 francs per kilo; 40 kg of okra at 1,000 francs per kilo; and 30,000 francs of bananas at 175 francs per kilo.

The profit earned will allow her to ensure her children’s schooling, consolidate her business, and meet family needs.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, some ingredients, and bananas

loans.name: Bedan

texts.en:
Bedan is a married man. He describes himself as a visionary. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. Bedan has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be bad weather.
Bedan will use the 15,000 KES loan to service and maintain his motorcycle. His business goal is to have several motorcycles within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be able to educate his children. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Juletha

texts.en:
Juletha is 49 years old and married with four children.

Juletha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries like sugar, detergent, canned goods, snack foods, candies, and biscuits to sell.

She has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming root crops.

Juletha aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like sugar, detergent, canned goods, snack foods, candies,and  biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is 54 years old from the district of Gori. She lives with her daughter and two grandchildren. The family has no income and they live in poverty. They get social assistance of 104 GEL monthly from the government.
Mzia wants to start a business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 3,000 GEL to start up a trade business. With the received credit she will begin a trade in fruits and vegetables. Mzia is very motivated to start her own business and awaits your support. With income gained she will provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to begin a trade in fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Ikram

texts.en: Ikram is a 38 year old married woman living with her husband who is the main income provider in the family. Ikram is a mother of five children, dedicated only to her home and family. Due to hard financial circumstances and with the aim to help her children with their education, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to be able to pay their school educational fees. Ikram's only dreams are to ensure her children a full life, help them to achieve high educational levels, and to always be able to satisfy their needs.

loans.use: to pay her children's educational fees.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, aged 45 years, supports four children. She is a small scale farmer. She has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya for 25,000 KES to buy a dairy cow to boost her farming activity and to start a business of supplying milk to raise more income.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and educate her children. Agnes hopes to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to boost her farming activity and start a business of supplying milk.

loans.name: Stafford

texts.en:
Stafford is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail shop where he sells clothes and has been involved in this business for three years. Stafford's business is located in a competitive place and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds.

Stafford will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of clothes. His business goal is to be a supplier within five years. He hopes that in the future he will have increased profits. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: Amadou   est l’homme qui tient le bœuf dans le groupe. Il est un emboucheuse  malien,  âgé  de 34 ans. Il est marié et père de 4 garçons et 3 filles. Le plus âgé a 13 ans et le cadet  a  7 mois. Trois garçons et une fille fréquentent l’école. Alphabétisé en arabe il s’approvisionne  au marché local. Il exerce ce métier il y a 6 ans pour faire face aux besoins vitaux de sa famille. Il a un bénéfice de 10000fcfa par mois. En plus du ménage, sa femme pratique aussi l’élevage ovin. Amadou fait recours auprès du RMCR pour pouvoir acheté de meilleurs qualité de bœufs et suffisamment de nourriture animal pour l’embouche afin d’attirer beaucoup d’acheteurs et en tirer le maximum de profit. Le revenu lui servira de payer les frais scolaire des enfants, les frais médicaux et autres charges de la famille. Amadou rêve de donner une décente à sa famille dans l’avenir
texts.en:
Amadou is the man holding the cattle in the group photo. He is a Malian livestock farmer, 34 years old, and a married father of four boys and three girls. The oldest is 13 years old, and the youngest is 7 months old. Three boys and a girl are attending school. Literate in Arabic, Amadou gets his supplies at the local market. He has been in this trade for six years to cope with vital family needs. He makes a profit of 10,000 francs CFA per month. In addition to being a homemaker, his wife also raises sheep.

Amadou turned to RMCR to be able to purchase better quality cattle and enough feed to fatten his animals, so as to attract many buyers and make a maximum of profit. The income will be used to pay for the children’s schooling, medical costs, and other family expenses. For the future, Amadou dreams of giving his family a decent [life] .

loans.use: to purchase sheep to sell

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is from the village of Hartashen where she lives with her husband. They both are already in retirement age but are still engaged in their farming business. Larisa and her husband have been running their farm for 20 years and over those years they have worked hard to develop and sustain it.
Larisa asked for this loan to purchase two cows and forage for feeding the livestock. This will help her to fatten the livestock and get more milk and meat to sell.
As this is Larisa's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Larisa will get a chance to have their first loan and develop their business.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lolita is 48 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

She has a business selling fertilized duck eggs (balut) in the Philippines. Lolita requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more fertilized duck eggs to sell to her customers.

Lolita has been in this business for three years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fertilized duck eggs to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anelia

texts.en:
Anelia is from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is 43 years old, married, with three dependents ages 10, 13 and 17. Anelia is a beautician who renders services for a fee. She knows how to do hair rebonding (straightening), manicures and pedicures for her clients. This has been her business for six years now.
Anelia is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy hair rebonding chemicals, nail polish, cuticle removers and nippers. With all these things she can maximize her services and increase her income for her family. Anelia hopes that in the near future she will be able to engage in other business opportunities to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy hair rebonding chemicals, nail polish, cuticle removers and nippers (fingernail clippers).

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail shop where she sells cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes, onions and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are the general public. Everline describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds.
She will use the 100,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of tomatoes, onions, carrots, and cabbages. Everline's business goal is to be the main supplier of vegetables in the market within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be a wholesaler. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of tomatoes, onions, carrots, and cabbages.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Lilibeth requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Lilibeth has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Linibeth

texts.es:
Linibeth es una mujer con 23 años de edad, madre de un pequeño con 2 años de edad. Su trabajo es vender mercancía por catálogo, esto le permite pasar más tiempo en su casa y estar al cuidado de su hijo.
Su deseo es abrir un local, generar empleo y ofrecer nuevos productos.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de mercancía como lo es ropa, bisutería y otros.
El sueño de esta madre es comprar una vivienda la cual en un futuro sea de su hijo, pues este es el motor que impulsa a esta mujer para luchar día a día.
Como Linibeth, miles de empresarios esperan de su ayuda, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Linibeth is a 23 year old woman, mother of a 2 year old boy. Her job is to sell merchandise by catalog,
this allows her to spend more time at home and take care of her child. Her wish is to open a store, generate employment, and to offer new products. She is asking for a loan to purchase merchandise such as clothing, jewelry and others. Her dream is to buy a house which, in the future, will belong to her child, because he is the reason for her to fight day after day. Like Lindbeth, many entrepreneurs await for your help. Get inspired, make a loan.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as clothing, jewelry, and others.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a married man with five children. He describes himself as optimistic. He operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for two years.

His business is located in a competitive place and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

Samwel will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more carpentry materials. He hopes that in the future, he will have increased profits.

This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more carpentry materials.

loans.name: Tsitsino

texts.en:
Tsitsino is 58 years old married woman. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and grandson.

The family has a car wash and generates income. Tsitsino decided to start additional business and requested a loan.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of USD 5000 to renovate a flat and rent it out. Tsitsino will be able to generate stable income and improve the living conditions of her family. Tsitsino awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out to generate stable income.

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
Melisa is a married woman. She has three children and describes herself as industrious.

She sells medicine. Melisa has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

Melisa says her biggest business challenge is low stock.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more medicine. Melisa hopes she will improve her life.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more medicine.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita a is a 44 year-old woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is married with eight children. Four of them are ages five to ten.

Angelita and her husband work hard on their fishing business to provide for their children. Fishing has been their source of income for 16 years.

Angelita would like to expand her business. She is asking a loan to buy new fishing nets and pay for boat repairs.

Her profit will be used for healthy meals and school fees of her children. Angelita's dream is to see her children finish school.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and pay for boat repairs.

loans.name: Hmayak

texts.en:
Hmayak and his wife live in Mayisyyan village of Shirak region. They have run their farm for many years and work really hard to have a stable income.

Their two sons live and work abroad with the hope of gathering money and coming back to their motherland someday.

Hmayak asks for this loan to purchase an ox, fertilizer and seeds for land cultivation.

His loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the under-served population of the Shirak region, to help them access the market and earn a living.

Shirak is considered to be a poor region, with a high unemployment rate, and low living standards. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions and high costs make it difficulties for people to develop their business in the Shirak region.

Hmayak thanks his Kiva lenders and anticipates their support. He is sure that working with Kiva lenders will be productive and profitable.

loans.use: to pay for an ox, fertilizer and seeds for land cultivation.

loans.name: Garibaldy

texts.es:
Garibaldy es un pujante y soñador hombre de 47 años de edad, una persona que encontró en el emprendimiento una salida a sus problemas económicos, puesto que en la zona de fresno es muy difícil emplearse.

Garibaldy se dedica a la venta de alimentos y la cría de animales, este negocio es el soporto y única entrada económica de una familia conformada por él, su pareja y un pequeño de 3 años de edad.

Para una persona baja de recursos como el cliente, es muy difícil sacar adelante y mantener su profesión ya que la mayoría de ingresos los destina para su hogar, dejando en ocasiones poco capital para reinvertir en la empresa, por este motivo Garibaldy quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para la compra de cerdos, un carnero y ganado bovino, todos los animales destinados a mejorare las entradas económicas de su negocio.

Con el préstamo lo que Garibaldy quiere hacer, es tener una unidad productiva sostenible en el tiempo, que le permita cubrir sus dos frentes, su negocio y su hogar.
texts.en: Garibaldy is a thriving 47 year old man. He discovered that being an entrepreneur gave him a way out of his economic problems, because it is very difficult to find work in the oak field zone. Garibaldy works selling food and breeding animals. This business is the only support and sole economic source of his family, which consists of him, his partner, and their 3 year old child. For a low income person such as this client, it is very difficult to get ahead and keep this business going,  since the bulk of his income goes to household expenses leaving very little for investment. This is why Garibaldy is asking for a loan to buy pigs, a sheep and cattle, all the animals intended to improve the economic earnings of his business. With this loan, Garibaldy intends to have a production unit sustainable in time, which will allow him to cover his household and business needs.

loans.use: To purchase pigs, a sheep and cattle, with all the animals intended to improve profits from his business.

loans.name: Sughra

texts.en: Sughra, shown in the photo with her husband, is an average Pakistani female villager as she has been working from a very tender age. She is 52 years old and the mother of four children. From an early age she has been involved in the cattle business and looking after livestock. Due to her low purchasing power, Sughra has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR so she can buy new cattle and expand her earnings, which will lead to a better standard of living. Currently, she hardly manages to provide two meals a day in addition to meeting her family's basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy new cattle and expand her earnings, which will lead to a better standard of living.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a married man with two children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a transport business, transporting customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the 90,000 KES loan to buy a new motorcycle. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 42-year-old married mother of five children. Thirteen years ago, she started selling clothes to cover the needs and expenses of her family. She started tailoring as a hobby because she was a designer, but her skills pushed her to open her own business.

Josephine is a hard worker who has a good reputation in her area. She is trying desperately to develop her business, so today she is acquiring a loan from UGAFODE Microfinance. She will use it to buy the necessary materials and tools to facilitate her work and allow her to provide her customers with better service.

Josephine hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy materials for making more designs

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: Emelita is a 35-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has seven children ages one to thirteen. She helps her husband in fishing. She catches and sells fish. She has been selling fish for more than twelve years. She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy fishing nets, floaters, fishing weights and nylon. In the future, Emelita hopes that her fishing business will prosper to support the education of her children, expand her business as well as provide healthy meals for the family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, floaters, fishing weights and nylon

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman. She describes herself to be enterprising.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. Florence has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes.

Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be humble.

James operates a transport business where he transports customers using tuk tuk. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be weather changes.

He will use the Kes 70,000 loan to service and maintain his tuk tuk. James hopes that in the future, he will prosper. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service and maintain his tuk tuk

loans.name: Maguli

texts.en:
Maguli is 48 years old. She lives in the Ozurgeti district.

Maguli is unemployed and wants to start her own business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of USD 2,100. With the received credit she will open a food market.

Maguli is very motivated to start her own business and she will work hard to generate stable income and expand the market in future. Maguli awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a food market and generate stable income

loans.name: Yakene Group

texts.fr: Marie set la Femme qui a le bélier sur la photo, elle est âgée de 20 ans. Elle est  Malienne rurale non alphabétisée qui habite avec son mari cultivateur. Elle a 2 garçons âgés respectivement de 4 et 2 ans. Marie fait l’élevage  de moutons depuis  3 ans  et elle gagne environs  7500fcfa par mois. Marie achète ses moutons au marché de local et y effectue aussi ses ventes. Marie prend le prêt pour  la première fois au RMCR, elle veut acheter des moutons pour son activité et augmenter son revenus afin de faire face aux besoins de ses enfants sur le plan de santé  ainsi que l’habillement. Elle envisage d’épargner aussi assez d’argent afin d’envoyer tous ses enfants à l’école et pour que sa famille puisse avoir un meilleur avenir.
texts.en:
