Marie is the woman with the ram in the photo. She is 20 years old and illiterate. She lives in rural Mali with her husband, who is a farmer. She has two sons who are 4 and 2 years old respectively.

Marie has raised sheep for 3 years and earns around 7,500 F CFA [CFA francs] per month. She buys her sheep at the local market, where she also makes her sales. This will be Marie's first loan with RMCR. She would like to buy sheep for her business and increase her income so that she can clothe her children and see to their health. She also hopes to save enough money to send her children to school and to allow her family to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy sheep to sell.

loans.name: Elkin Alonso

texts.es:
Elkin es un hombre casado con 35 años de edad, presta el servicio de moto taxi en el municipio de Taraza. Una actividad que aprendió por medio de su hermano quien realiza la misma labor.
Trabaja todos los días durante 7 horas diarias.

Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en el mantenimiento y arreglo de la moto y actualizara papeles como el seguro y tecno mecánica.

Su sueño es comprarse una vivienda propia, brindarle a sus hijos una buena estabilidad económica y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elkin is a married 35-year-old man. He provides a mototaxi service in the town of Taraza. He learnt the business through his brother who does the same job. He works every day for 7 hours a day.

He is currently requesting a loan which he will spend on maintenance and repairs for his mototaxi and updating his papers such as the insurance and vehicle inspection certificate.

His dream is to buy himself a house of his own and to provide his children with good financial stability and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance and repairs for his mototaxi and update his papers such as the insurance and vehicle inspection certificate.

loans.name: Jose Liberto

texts.es:
José es un hombre casado con 41 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, padre de 6 hijos menores de edad, los cuales adora con toda su alma. Dedicado a la cría de aves, una actividad que aprendió gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre y un medio por el que ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia luego de quedarse sin empleo por varios meses. 

Se encuentra solicitado un préstamo con el cual comprara pollos de engorde, cuido, un refrigerador y los materiales necesarios para remodelar y expandir sus galpones.

A pesar de las circunstancias por las que ha pasado, para José no existe nada imposible, su sueño es continuar ejerciendo esta labor y más adelante mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, ya que esta no está en buen estado.

Con su aporte este hombre podrá cumplir sus sueños, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
José is a 41 year old married man, who is hard working and humble. He is father to 6 underage children, who he adores with all his heart. He rears poultry, an activity which he learned thanks to his father's teaching and one through which he has managed to provide for his family after being without work for a number of months.
He finds himself asking for a loan with which he will buy chickens for fattening, animal feed, a refrigerator and the materials needed to remodel and expand his sheds.
In spite of the circumstances which have happened to him, José considers nothing to be impossible. His dream is to continue practicing this work and in the future improve the conditions of his home, which is already not in a very good state.
With your contribution this man will be able to achieve his dreams; go for it, give him a loan.

loans.use: to buy chickens for fattening, animal feed, a refrigerator and the materials needed to remodel and expand his sheds.

loans.name: Hernán

texts.es: Hernán trabaja en su propio negocio de ganado para producción de leche, solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones ( ₡ 1 000 000 ), para poder aumentar el hato en su finca, de esta manera logrará aumentar sus ventas y su participación en el mercado.
texts.en: Hernán runs his own activity breeding dairy cattle to produce milk. He is requesting a loan of one million Colones ( ₡ 1,000,000 ) to add more animals to his herd. This way he will succeed in increasing his sales and boost his presence in the market.

loans.use: to buy more dairy cattle.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
At the tender age of 20, David's passion for farming and education drove him to start practicing mixed farming. Right now he is 53 and a very industrious, honest, and hardworking father from the Nkubu area of Kenya, near the famous Mount Kenya.

David has been farming for the past 15 years. Over the years, he has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in his village. He has been practicing mixed farming. His primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, tea, crops, and some small business ventures that help him make ends meet. David is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating his farm. That is why, every day, he wakes up very early to go to his farm to plough.

Although he makes profits from farming, he is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase his income by buying seeds so that he can plant them and sell them after harvesting. That is why he is seeking this loan to buy seeds. Kenya's Nkubu area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for food. This means that David could increase his profits and satisfy the demand that is there.

Accessing funds has been a challenge for David, but he now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring men farmers like him turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. David believes that this loan will be of much help, and that he will be able to satisfy the demand for food.

He also believes that the extra income he earns will enable permanent change in his life and increase his business. Increased profits will allow David to repay this loan and secure the future of his school-going children.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Bhairabi Group

texts.en:
In the year 2015, nine independent women of Medinipur, Bhawanipatana in Kalahandi district, Odisha, India formed a group named Bhairabi. Their main objective is to expand their existing businesses and develop their social livelihood by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation.

Santilata is the most active lady of the concerned village and has taken the leadership to form a self-help group. The lady is about 22 years old and standing in the first row, the second person from the right hand side with her hand raised in the photo. She is a cheerful lady with a high ambition. Her family consists of her husband and in-laws. She has no children.

For the last three years, Santilata’s family is engaged in a laundry business. The monthly family income is Rs 6,000 only from their occupation. This is not even $100. The present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses for her family. So Santilata decided to avail a loan with other members of the group. She will purchase a washing machine and a good quality non-electric iron with this loan. Through this, Santilata hopes this will definitely generate a handsome amount of extra income. She has a dream of saving enough for a better life, building a cabin in the nearby market and starting a dry cleaning business.

The other eight members of the group are also engaged in different small businesses like a goatery, vegetable vending, a laundry, seasonal business, etc.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine and a good quality non-electric iron.

loans.name: Baburaga Group

texts.en:
Baburaga Group was formed in the year 2015 in Kusumsila village of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. There are nine active independent women, with an objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of the concerned group have their own professions and businesses. Jamuna is one of the members. She has taken a great role in her development and the group members' source of revenue improvement. She is standing in the front line, second from left with her hand raised in the photo. She is about 45 years old and lives with her family consisting of her husband and three children.

Her family has been engaged in vegetable cultivation and selling for the last 10 years. All family members are promoting the business. But from the concerned business, the monthly income of the family is 7,500 INR. In Jamuna’s opinion, this income is not at all sufficient to maintain her family and hence, there are almost zero surpluses at the end of the month. She planned to improve her business with more investment but the availability of funds is her main concern. So as a result, Jamuna had applied for a loan for her group and got approved by Mahashakti. With this loan, she will purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc for the vegetable cultivation as well as potatoes, onions, garlic, ginger, cauliflower, carrots, radishes, apples, bananas etc. for the vegetable and fruits business. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for construction of her own house.

The other eight members of her group are also smart at their professions and actively engaged in different businesses like vegetable vending, paddy business, leaf plate making and selling, etc, With this loan, she hopes to heighten their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc for vegetable cultivation as well as potatoes, onions, garlic, ginger, cauliflower, carrots, radishes, apples, bananas etc.

loans.name: Tenghory Transgambienne Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 05 mai 2002. Ce groupe est composé de femmes dynamiques qui font le commerce. Madame Awa qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle célibataire, âgée de 35 ans et mère de deux enfants dont une fille. Elle s'active dans l'aviculture depuis plus de dix années. Avec le prêt sollicité elle va développer son activité. Elle a de bon clients qui lui permettent d'écouler tous ses produits. les bénéfices vont servir à assurer la nourriture et à payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The banc villageois was inaugurated on 5th May 2002. This group is composed of dynamic women who engage in trade.
Mrs Awa, who is on the right of the photo raising her hand, is the group representative. SHe is single, 35 years old and mother to two children including one girl. She has been working in poultry production for over ten years. With this loan she will develop her activity. She has good clients who allow her to sell all her products. The earnings will help to provide food and pay her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed.

loans.name: Adama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe composés de femmes a été crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois. Elles sont issus du même quartier et sont unis par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Madame Anta est la responsable elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés.
Elle s'active dans le commerce par la vente de petit déjeuner avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter des condiment ;du lait ,du café du sucre des baguettes de pain qu'elle va revendre au détails au niveau de son quartier.Les bénéfices réalises lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaire scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants et de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group made up of women was created since the first cycle of the banc villageois. They come from the same neighbourhood and are united by good social and professional relations.
Mrs Anta is the leader, she is married and the mother of three children who all attend school. Her job is the sale of breakfast. With her new loan, she will purchase condiments, milk, coffee, sugar, and bread that she will retail at her neighbourhood level. The earnings will allow her to take care of the food, school and sanitary needs of her children and to build her savings at the banc villageois.

loans.use: to buy sugar, powdered milk, coffee and condiments to prepare and sell breakfast.

loans.name: Tenghory Transgambienne Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 08 mai 2001. Ce groupe est composé de femmes qui évoluent dans le secteur du commerce. Madame Diarra qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 51 ans et mère de six enfants dont quatre garçons. Elle s'active dans la vente d'arachide depuis plus de cinq années. Elle va acheter avec le prêt sollicité plusieurs sacs d'arachides. La rareté des concurrents fait que l'activité se développe bien. Les bénéfices vont servir à épargner et à payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The banc villageois was inaugurated on 8th May 2001. This group is made up of women who work in trade.
Mrs Diarra, who is on the right of the photo raising her hand, is the group representative. She is married, 51 years old and the mother of six children, four of whom are boys. She has been selling peanuts for over five years. With the loan, she will purchase several bags of peanuts. The lack of competitors means that her activity is growing well. The earnings will contribute to savings and to pay for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Tenghory Transgambienne Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 08 mai 2001. Ce groupe est constitué de femmes commerçantes. madame Amicolle qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 42 ans et mère de huit enfants dont cinq filles. Elle s'active dans la vente de légumes depuis plus de dix années. Elle va acheter avec le prêt sollicité des quantités importantes en légumes de qualité. Elle a des clients qui lui sont fidèles et qui paient sans retard. les bénéfices vont servir à épargner et à aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The banc villageois was inaugurated on 8th May 2001. This group is made up of businesswomen.
Mrs Amicolle, who is at the right of the photo raising her hand, is the group representative. She is married, 42 years old and the mother of eight children including five girls. She has been selling vegetables for over ten years. With the loan, she will purchase large quantities of quality vegetables. She has loyal clients who pay on time. The earnings will contribute to savings and to help her husband take care of the family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Norman

texts.en: Norman is a married man. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells spices. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of spices. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of spices.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 3 hijos bajo su cargo, está casado con Ana Berta, Vicente tiene 58 años y se dedica a la producción de café, el anhela poder darle a su familia una vida de calidad y que sus hijos puedan acceder a capacitarse en diferentes temas agrícolas para que aprovechen la tierra y buen clima de la zona donde vive, en estos momentos Vicente está interesado en un proyecto de colmenas bajo la supervisión y capacitación técnica de COCAFCAL de la cual es socio.
La producción de miel es un cultivo para el cual el clima de la región es muy propicio y la gran variedad de flora es un factor determinante para que la producción de miel sea abundante y de muy alta calidad, Vicente quiere iniciar el trabajo con colmenas (Apis melífera) lo más pronto posible ya que le interesa aprovechar las capacitaciones técnicas de COCAFCAL acerca del tema.
Vicente solicita un crédito para comprar colmenas e iniciar con el proyecto, con el crédito pretende comprar 3 colmenas de cajas para atrapar de 3 a 5 más lo que le daría un total de 6 a 8 colmenas, las colmenas que Vicente adquiera iniciaran la producción para la próxima temporada seca, con las ganancias obtenidas de la producción de esta primeras colmenas Vicente pretende hacer su apiario más grande hasta llegar a una meta de 100 colmenas en 3 años, con las ganancias obtenidas por la miel Vicente hacer crecer el pequeño patrimonio de su familia.
Un crédito ayudará a Vicente a iniciar con este proyecto de colmenas que aparte de proporcionarle un ingreso extra le permitirá capacitarse en el tema.
texts.en:
Vicente works in agriculture. He has 3 dependent children and is married to Ana Berta. Vicente is 58 years old and he is a coffee producer. His greatest wish is to be able to give his family a good quality of life and his children access to training in different agricultural areas so that they can benefit from the land and the good climate in the local area. Vicente is currently looking into a beehive project with the supervision and technical training offered by COCAFCAL of which he is a member.

The local climate is very favourable for honey production and the wide variety of flora is a determining factor for producing large quantities of very high quality honey. Vicente wants to start working with beehives (Apis melífera) as soon as possible because he is keen to take advantage of COCAFCAL's technical training on this subject.

Vicente is requesting a loan to buy beehives and start the project. With the loan, he intends to buy 3 beehive boxes to attract 3 to 5 more, which will give him a total of 6 to 8 beehives. These hives will start his production in the upcoming dry season then with the profit from the production of these initial beehives, Vicente intends to expand his apiary to 100 beehives in the next 3 years. With the profit from the honey Vicente will increase his family's small pool of resources.

A loan will help Vicente start the beehive project, which apart from giving him extra income will also enable him to train up on the subject.

loans.use: to buy beehives, crates for beehives, food for bees and other equipment for his apiary.

loans.name: Wuendy Lizeth

texts.es: Wuendy, tiene 27 años de edad,  vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en el Municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Ella tiene su propio negocio de pulpería desde hace un año donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser arroz, maíz, frijol, azúcar, manteca, carne, refrescos, golosinas, especies, y otros. Anteriormente se dedicaba a vender mercadería en ropa, calzado, cosméticos etc. El prestamo que está solicitando es el quinto ciclo con la institución y es por 21,000 lempiras para comprar refrescos, golosinas, carnes, manteca, productos plásticos, granos básicos para mantener surtido el inventario. Su sueño siempre ha sido ser una empresaria y poderles dar mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Wuendy is 27 years old and lives together with her husband, with whom she has two children, in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barabara.

She has been running her own grocery business for a year and sells staple goods such as rice, corn, beans, sugar, butter, meat, drinks, sweets, spices and other goods. She previously earned a living selling clothes, shoes and cosmetic merchandise.

She is applying for a loan for the fifth time with the institution and it is for 21,000 lempiras in order to buy drinks, sweets, meat, butter, plastic goods and basic grains in order to maintain a range of stock.

Her dream has always been to be a business woman and give her children a better life.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, sweets, meat, butter, plastic goods and basic grains.

loans.name: Gertrudis

texts.es:
Gertrudis se dedica a la agricultura, a sus 55 años tiene 6 hijos bajo su cargo, está casado con Agustina con quien tienen 9 hijos, Gertrudis se dedica especialmente a la producción de café, el anhela poder darles a sus hijos todo lo que necesiten y que puedan acceder a capacitarse en diferentes temas para que aprovechen las bondades de la región, en estos momentos Gertrudis está interesado en un proyecto de Colmenas (Apis Melíferas) impulsado por COCAFCAL de la cual es socio.
La producción de miel es un cultivo para el cual el clima de la región es muy propicio y la gran variedad de flora es un factor determinante para que la producción de miel sea abundante y de muy alta calidad, Gertrudis quiere iniciar el trabajo con colmenas (Apis melífera) los más pronto posible, “Con el apoyo de COCAFCAL tenemos la oportunidad de aprender a trabajar las colmenas”: menciona muy entusiasmado Gertrudis.
En estos momentos Gertrudis solicita un crédito para comprar colmenas e iniciar con el proyecto, con el crédito pretende comprar 5 colmenas y algunas cajas para atrapar 5 más por su cuenta lo que le daría un total de 10 colmenas para iniciar, las colmenas que Gertrudis adquiera iniciaran la producción para la próxima temporada seca, con las ganancias obtenidas de la producción de esta primeras colmenas Gertrudis pretende hacer su apiario más grande hasta llegar a una meta de 200 colmenas en 5 años, con las ganancias obtenidas por la miel Gertrudis espera tener una mejor calidad de vida e iniciar nuevos proyectos para que sus hijos puedan aprender diversidad de temas agrícolas.
Un crédito ayudara a Gertrudis y a su familia a iniciar un nuevo proyecto que les permitirá tener ingresos extras y sobre todo a aprender técnicas para el manejo de colmenas.
texts.en:
Gertrudis makes a living from agriculture. He is 55 years old with 6 dependent children. He is married to Agustina and they have 9 children. Gertrudis' specialty is growing coffee. He is eager to provide for his children's needs allowing them to acquire skills in different areas so that they can take advantage of the regions natural resources.

Gertrudis is currently interested in a beehive project (honey bees) backed by COCAFCAL of which he is a member. The regional climate favours honey production; the great variety of flora is an important factor that provides for abundant, high quality honey. Gertrudis wants to start a beekeeping business as soon as possible.
"With COCAFCAL's support we have an opportunity to learn beekeeping" Gertrudis says enthusiastically. Gertrudis is currently asking for a loan to buy hives to start the project. He intends to use the loan to buy 5 beehive colonies and boxes to house 5 more of his own giving him a total of 10 hives to start with. Gertrudis will use the hives to start production during the next dry season.He intends to increase the size of his apiary using the earnings generated by the first batch of hives until he reaches his goal of 200 hives in 5 years. The income generated by selling honey will allow Gertrudis to enjoy a better quality of life and start new projects that allow his children to learn a variety of agricultural skills. The loan will help Gertrudis and his family to start a new project allowing them to get an extra income and above all learn the skills required in beekeeping.

loans.use: To buy beehives, hive boxes and other materials for his apiary.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan es empresario con 11 años de experiencia en atención hospitalaria que decidió generar recursos a través de la venta medicina natural, aprovechando sus conocimientos en el sector de la salud consideró que podría ofrecer productos bastantes reconocidos por sus beneficios e inició con esta actividad hace un año,  obteniendo excelentes resultados gracias a su dedicación y carisma para las ventas.  Él agenda a sus clientes de acuerdo a su horario laboral y así les ofrece una asesoría en la que define que necesidades tiene la persona y que producto satisface sus necesidades. Sus compras las realiza por internet y con la finalidad de mantener un stock de productos con el que pueda responder oportunamente a la demanda y beneficiarse obteniendo descuentos en sus compras, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en productos naturales.  Su meta dentro de dos años es tener un negocio financieramente más estable y así realizarle unas adecuaciones a su vivienda para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is a businessman with 11 years of experience in hospital care. He decided to generate income through the sale of natural medicines. Making the most of his knowledge of the health sector, he came up with the idea of selling products that are quite well recognised for their benefits. So he started this business a year ago, getting excellent results thanks to his dedication and sales charisma. 

He schedules his customers to fit in with his work timetable and offers them a consultation in which he determines the person's needs and which product will satisfy their needs. He sells his products over the internet. With the goal of maintaining a product stock that will allow him to respond promptly to demand and benefit by getting discounts on his purchases, he is applying for his first Kiva loan through the "Mario Santo Domingo" Foundation. He will use this to buy natural products. 

His two-year goal is to have a more financially stable business so that he can make some changes to his home and offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in natural products

loans.name: Sanene Group

texts.en:
Rehema, who is in her late 40's, is married with four kids who are still at school. She has been a food vendor for one year now. She works from 6am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit

This will be Rehema’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy soft drinks and increase the stock in her mamalishe (local restaurant) and she paid back her loan successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees, do loan repayment, build her house, build rooms for renting and to cover household expenses.

She will use this loan to increase the soft drinks and to restock the out-of-stock items in her mamalishe business. She dreams of owning a Hotel.

Rehema will share this loan with her loan group Sanene which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the soft drinks and to restock the out-of-stock items in her mamalishe business.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard and her family have been involved in an agribusiness for more than 15 years. Their farm is located near the house where they live and includes cows, calves and hens. In their own nearby yard, Alvard also cultivates potato and cabbage.

To be able to purchase 2 ox and forage for feeding the livestock, Alvard has applied for this loan. This will help her to feed the oxen and sell them in the winter with higher price.

As this is Alvard's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Alvard will get a chance to have their first loan and develop their business.

loans.use: to pay for 2 ox and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is a mother of two children ages seven and twelve. She and her family live in Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in a sari-sari (convenience) store business and also makes panggal (crab traps) using bamboo strips.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy rice, canned goods, toiletries and bamboo for crab traps. She works hard to earn a living for her family. Esmeralda's priority is to ensure that her children get education.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned goods, toiletries and bamboo for crab traps.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a single man. He describes himself as honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using a motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the rainy season which affects business.

He will use the KES 60,000 loan to add to his savings to buy his own motorcycle for transport . He hopes that in the future, he will start another business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle for transport.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a single man. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. He hopes that in the future, he will be a supplier of clothes to other retailers. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Ma. Vilma

texts.en:
Like most people in Talibon, Bohol, Ma. Vilma finds her livelihood through raising hogs. This has been her business for eleven years now. She also operates a sari-sari store in her area.

It has been a challenging job raising hogs since it takes a while to fatten the pigs. Without quality feed, her animals’ growth will be compromised. But with the quality feed, she can increase her chance of a higher return of investment.

She is asking a loan to buy feed for her animals and soft drinks for her store.

In the future, she hopes to keep improving and expanding her business for better profitability.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Paul Sinneh

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Paul Sinneh. He is married, and has 3 children. In 2014, Paul Sinneh established his grocery shop (provisions, drinks etc.) business. He began his business because he wanted to empower himself because he is unemployed. His business is located on the outskirts of the city and his main customers are the general community. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Paul Sinneh requires a loan in order to buy more drinks, mayonnaise, sardines, powdered milk and assorted items for resale. He hopes that this loan will support him and help him to add stock and maximize profit.

In the future, Paul Sinneh plans to develop a plot of land acquired in Waterloo as a dwelling house and give quality education to the children. He says many thanks to Kiva borrowers and may they continue their good work .He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks, mayonnaise, sardines, powdered milk and assorted items for resale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman. She is 29 years old and has five children. Her eldest is ten and her youngest is one.

Irene sells items like candies, biscuits, coffee, chips, shampoo, and seasoning. She hopes to make her store bigger and increase her inventory, so she is asking a loan to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, soy sauce, hair conditioner, toothpaste and bath soap.

In the future, she plans buy more merchandise that she does not currently carry to expand her business and attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, soy sauce, hair conditioner, toothpaste and bath soap.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is engaged in a fishing business. She is from the island of Calituban in Talibon, Bohol. She learned fishing through her husband. This has been their livelihood for more than 30 years now.

She is asking a loan to buy new fishing nets. This will replace the old one and will allow them to catch more, thus, increasing their income.

In the future, she hopes to save and live in comfort while she continues to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Christiana Okoni

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Christiana. She is married, and has 2 children aged 26 and 30. In 2010, Christiana established her blouse, shirt, trousers, etc. business.

She began her business to help take care of her family. Her business is located on the outskirts of the city and her main customers are the general public. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan of an amount of SLL 5,000,000. Christiana requires a loan in order to buy more dozens of trousers, T. shirts, coats, etc. for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her efforts to add to the stock and maximize profit.

In the future, Christiana plans to establish a bigger business in order to attract more customers. She says many thanks to Kiva borrowers for continuing their good work. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more dozens of trousers, T. shirts, coats for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more boards and furniture to make chairs, tables, beds for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more materials for her water production business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Kadiatu. She is married and has four children, aged 16, 13, 10 and 4 years. She has two additional dependents who live with her for schooling.

In 2002, Kadiatu established her charcoal business. Working seven days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,200,000 (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business.

Kadiatu would like a loan of the amount of SLL 5,000,000. She now requires a new loan in order to purchase bags of charcoal and rice by the bag for resale, and to pay the transport costs.

Kadiatu cannot meet her plans because of the current health crisis in the country, but still plans to earns more profit, educate her children up to the university level, build houses, and get another international business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Twisungane Sub Group A

texts.en:
Twisungane is a group led by Donatha, who is 24 years old. The group name means “Support each other” in English. The group members sell various items, but they have the same idea for changing their lives.

Donatha is not married. She sells fruits and has been doing business for the past two years.

With the loan, she would like to buy more fruits to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and build a new house.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase piglets for rearing and sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 50 cartons of frozen fish for resale.

loans.name: Nuera

texts.en:
Nuera is a 59-year-old single woman from the community of Talibon, Bohol.

She owns a sari-sari store business and she also raises hogs for a living. These businesses keep her busy and occupied. However, since customers take her merchandise on credit, Nuera needs additional capital to keep it going.

She is asking a loan PHP 30,000 to buy sacks of rice and soft drinks for her store. Nuera plans to make her store bigger and she also plans to increase her inventory to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and soft drinks.

loans.name: Tinna

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Tinna. She is married and has two children, age 7 and 4.

In 2012, Tinna established her cosmetics, hair products and provisions business. She began her business because she has to take care of herself and her family. Her business is located in the outskirts, close to the main road, and her main customers are the general public.

Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. Competition and the rainy season are her big challenges.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Tinna requires a loan in order to purchase more body cream, soap, make up, and hair products as well as some provisions like milk, sugar, etc. for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her to increase her profit margin.

She promised to buy a plot of land, which she is still working towards. In the future, Tinna also plans to educate her two children and build a house for them. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Gladys. She is married and has three children, age 23, 20 and 15.

In 2007, Gladys established her cooked food business. Her business is located in city centre and her main customers are the general public.

Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 700,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Gladys requires a loan in order to purchase a bag of rice, five gallons of palm oil, fish, etc. to prepare the food for resale.

She hopes that this loan will enable her to help the business increase as a result of maximizing profit. In the future, Gladys plans to have enough capital and build a house for her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a bag of rice, five gallons of palm oil, fish, etc.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis tiene 34 años de edad, madre soltera, vive en casa propia de material rustico junto a su hijo, que estudia en colegio secundario, en el distrito Aramango, provincia Bagua, Región Amazonas, Selva norte de Perú; es una pequeña zona rural donde los habitantes se conocen y dan buenas referencias del señora Gladis.

La actividad que realiza Gladis es la venta de abarrotes en general. El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en compra de mercadería y surtir su negocio. Esta inversión le permitirá ganancias y por ende invertir en mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Gladis is a 34-year-old single mother. She lives with her son, who is in high school, in her own rustic house in the Aramango District, located in the the Bagua Province of the Amazonas region, in the northern rain forests of Peru. It is a small rural community where all the residents know each other, and they give Gladis good references.

Gladis sells groceries for a living. She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store. This investment will help her increase her profits and thus improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Estrella De Belen Group

texts.es: La Sra. Tarcila tiene 73 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos que ya no dependen de ella. Es la presidenta de la alcancía comunal “Estrella de Belen” formada hace más de 5 años y que ahora está integrada por 5 mujeres emprendedoras. Como negocio tiene una pequeña bodega en casa donde ofrece todo tipo de golosinas y bebidas. El préstamo lo utilizara para invertirlo en su bodega como comprar al por mayor diferentes tipos de bebidas y golosinas que ofrece para sus clientes. De esta forma con esfuerzo y perseverancia Tarcila está cumpliendo con sus objetivos planteados, que es terminar de construir su casa. En la foto grupal Ella se encuentra de pie en medio de sus demás compañeras sentadas.
texts.en:
Tarcila is 73 years old, she is married and has four children that are now independent. Tarcila is the president of the community group 'Estrella de Belen'. The group was formed five years ago and is made up of five businesswomen.

Tarcila's business is a small store selling drinks and snacks that she operates out of her home. She will use the loan to buy drinks and snacks wholesale to then sell to her customers. In this way, with persistence and hard work, Tarcila will be able to fulfil her goal of finishing the construction of her home.

In the photo, Tarcila is the woman standing in between the other seated women.

loans.use: to buy a variety of drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 30 bags of rice, cooking oil, and 20 containers of palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 50 bags of rice, cooking oil, and 50 containers of palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: This is 45-year-old Isatu.  She is married and has 3 children, ages 18, 16 and 7 years. In 2005, Isatu established her business selling local foodstuffs (including gari (cassava) and palm oil). Her business is located in the outskirts of the city, and her main customers come from the whole community. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 600,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Isatu needs the  loan in order to buy more bags of gari and 50 containers of palm oil for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her to serve more customers and increase her profit margin.  With the help of her last loan, she was able to buy a plot of land, where she would like to build a dwelling house and a store in the future.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of gari (cassava) and 50 containers of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is an artisan from Peru who specializes in silver jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and semi-precious gemstones. Victor has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"Jewelry is my life. It impassions me. Each design is like a child to me. My artistic formation began when I was 12, when my older sister married an experienced silversmith. I was an apprentice at his workshop, and then became a master silversmith. I love the thrill of working on new designs.

"With this microcredit I intend to purchase the raw materials I need to craft more pieces ahead of the holiday season. Thanks to everyone who supports me through this kind gesture."

Use this link to view Victor's silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/7269

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and semi-precious gemstones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 50 bags of rice, 50 containers of cooking oil and a variety of local foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Tenghory Transgambienne Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 08 mai 2001. Ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont comme activité le commerce. Madame Siré qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 56 ans et mère de trois enfants dont deux filles. Elle s'active dans la vente de l'huile de palme et du citron depuis plus de cinq années. Elle va acheter des bidons de cinq litres d'huile de palme pour renforcer sa marchandise. Les produits sont de très bonne qualité et elle a des clients qui lui sont fidèle et qui lui font souvent des commandes. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille et à épargner.
texts.en:
This banc villageois has been inaugurated on May 8, 2001. This group is composed of women who work as vendors. Ms. Siré who is on the right in the photo raising her hand, is the group’s representative. She is married, 56 years old and has three children, including two daughters. She has been selling palm and lemon oil for over five years.

Siré will buy five-liter [1.3 gal] jugs of palm oil to replenish her stock. Her products are of a very good quality, and she has loyal customers who places orders often. Her revenues will allow her to help her husband with everyday household expenses and to grow her savings.

loans.use: to buy palm and lemon oil.

loans.name: Twisungane Sub Group B

texts.en:
Illuminee leads the Twisungane group (group name means "support each other" when translated).  She is 32 years old and is married with three children (range in age from 1-6 years old).  For the past six years, she has been involved in a clothing business.  With the loan, she would like to buy more shirts, shorts, and trousers to sell.  The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and to renovate her house.

The group members sell different items but have the same ideas for changing their lives.

loans.use: to buy more shirts, shorts, and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Embassy Group

texts.en:
Kibuna is 31 years old, single, and has two children who are still in school.  For the last ten years, she has supported her family by running a beauty salon business.  She is a hairstylist and works from 8am-6pm each workday.  She serves many people per day and has the ability to make a fair monthly profit.

She will use this loan to buy hair dressing equipment for her salon.  This will be her fifth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, and the loan will be divided among Embassy Group's two members.  The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.  Kibuna used her previous loans, which have been paid back in full, to buy salon equipment.  She received some extra income, which she used to support her family and to buy a TV, radio, sofa, and digital deck.  She is really enjoying Kiva's benefits and believes she will be able to be an international businesswoman one day.

loans.use: to buy hair dressing equipment for her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in toe caps, soles and rubber, as well as a new assortment of clothing and accessories.

loans.name: Jacobo

texts.en: Jacobo is a carpenter who lives in El Alto.  He is divorced and has a daughter.  He lives and works at his parents' house.  This time he needs a loan to buy a carpentry machine because he wants to increase his production of caskets.  He hopes that you can help him because he is doing a lot to increase his customer base and he would like to have his own place to live in the future.

loans.use: to buy a carpentry machine.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 55 years old.  She is divorced and is the mother of two daughters (one is married and the other is in college).  Fatima owns her house and a boutique where she sells clothes, such as dresses, coats, jackets, and t-shirts.  She needs a loan to buy more clothes for her boutique.  She hopes that you can help her because she works hard and her daughters cannot help her.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her boutique.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.en: Mariela is a mother, and her child is very young.  She is married, and she works with her husband selling fruit at many fairs.  Mariela and her husband live in Achacachi.  She needs a loan to buy more fruit for her business.  Mariela and her husband are a good team; he helps her with transportation, and she has a good eye for choosing fruit.  She hopes you can help her and her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit for her business.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 29 years old and married with two kids. He is a loving father and he and his family live at his parent's house.

Henry works at a fried chicken restaurant and he is also a mechanic. Henry needs a loan to buy a compressor for his business Henry works hard he is the only support for his entire family including his parents so he hopes you can help him

loans.use: to buy a compressor for his repair business

loans.name: Flor Del Rio Santa Clara Group

texts.en:
The town of Santa Clara La Laguna is located above the popular town of San Pedro La Laguna on the shores of Lake Atitlan. The population of the area produces traditional weavings, woven baskets, and candles. It is an agricultural area with coffee and avocados harvested. The people who live here hold fast to many traditions including speaking their Maya dialect. As you can see in the photograph, they still wear their native traditional outfits or “traje”.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Flor del Rio Santa Clara” meaning “Flower of the Santa Clara River” was formed here by 8 motivated women who are dedicated to empowering themselves and eliminating poverty in their lives. These ladies are involved in various commercial ventures like animal husbandry (chickens, pigs,cattle), meat sales, clothing sales and even carpentry. The ladies have big families and there is an average of six children in each. Education is a high priority and the women work hard so that their children can go to school and enjoy a higher quality of life.

Carolina is a 27 year old member of the Trust Bank who is Maya Kaqchikel. She has an animal husbandry business and raises and sells chickens and bulls. This multi-tasking lady also weaves pine baskets and weaves beautiful traditional belts. She wants to secure a loan in order to purchase another calf to raise and sell. She will generate more income to support the needs of the family. Carolina has a long term goal of seeing her children excel in their studies and complete their university studies. She was only able to attend school up to the 6th grade.

The Microcredit Plus Program of Friendship Bridge, that combines small loans and education is very effective for the women. At each of their monthly meetings, a Friendship Bridge Facilitator shares practical and useful information with them on a variety of subjects. Some of these topics include hygiene, health and the use of medicinal plants, setting goals, as well as self-esteem and empowerment. The ladies also learn how to effectively manage their businesses with information about budgeting, pricing, marketing and accounting.

Kiva investors play an important role in funding loans for these women. The ladies are poised to step into a brighter future, benefitting themselves, their families and their community of Santa Clara La Laguna! Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to purchase another calf to raise and sell.

loans.name: Del Carmen Group

texts.en:
San Juan La Laguna is a clean and beautiful town on the shores of Lake Atitlan in the Highlands of Guatemala. Many say it is a magical town as it is full of unique art, painted murals and friendly people. It is a peaceful and well-organized town that draws tourists from all over the world.

Seven women have organized themselves into the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Del Carmen”. The ladies are happy to report that because of their previous loans generously funded by Kiva investors, they have increased their earnings and expanded their businesses.They are requesting their 3rd loan from Kiva investors.

Rebeca is the Secretary of the Trust Bank who has a shop near the Lake where she sells beautiful scarves, shawls, ponchos, makeup bags, purses, hammocks, and bedspreads. Many of the textiles are dyed using natural dyes, a specialty of the town. She says that during the three loan cycles, she has realized great benefits being a member of the Trust Bank.

Rebeca recalls that at the beginning of her relationship with Friendship Bridge, her inventory was very small and it has grown considerably. She is very pleased. With the new loan that she is requesting, Rebeca would like to purchase 200 pounds of thread and yarn in various textures and colors.

Rebeca has two children and is keenly aware of the value of education for them. Fortunately, the Microcredit Plus Program of Friendship Bridge combines education and small loans and so Rebeca and her friends in the Trust Bank have an opportunity to educate themselves. Each month, a Friendship Bridge Facilitator shares useful information with the ladies using drawings, role playing and games. The women gain valuable business tools as they learn about effective business practices like budgeting, pricing, accounting and customer service. They also learn about women’s and children’s rights, violence against women, as well as how to set goals and dreams. The ladies also learn about health, hygiene and the use of medicinal plants.

It is impossible for an indigenous woman to walk into a bank in Guatemala to secure a loan. Kiva investors play such an important role in the lives of these women when they fund loans. Thank you for your kindness and generosity!

loans.use: to purchase 200 pounds of thread and yarn in various textures and colors, for use making her traditional handicrafts.

loans.name: Máxima

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD DE TAMBO REAL, la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de quesos, manjares y yogures para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Solidaridad de Tambo Real" communal bank. Máxima continues to work in her business selling cheese, condensed milk and yogurt to all her clients that request them. She has run her business for a long time and things are going well for her thanks to the determination she brings to her business each day. She wants to continue to work in this way to continue to support her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy milk amongst others.

She is grateful for the loan awarded and promises to comply with the established installments.

loans.use: to buy milk amongst others.

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été créé en 2013, le groupement compte 27 femmes du même village, leur activité principale est le commerce.

Awa qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant la main   est notre emprunteuse vedette, elle est âgée de 55 ans, est mariée et n'a pas d'enfant.

Awa est commerçante, elle vend de la cola.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter un panier de 50 kg de cola à 60 000f le panier.

Les bénéfices issus de ce commerce serviront à la dépense familiale et à augmenter son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
The banc villageois was created in 2013, the group contains 27 women of the same village whose principal activity is trade.
Awa, who is on the right of the photo and raising her hand, is our featured borrower, she is (5 years old, married and has no children. Awa is a trader, she sells kola nuts. With this loan she intends to buy a 50-kg basket of kola nut at 60 000f per basket. The earnings from this trade will be used for family expenses and to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy a 50-kg basket of kola nuts.

loans.name: Mayama's Group

texts.fr:
Inauguré le 04 Juin ce banc villageois est composé de femmes du groupement du village qui ont adhéré dans le programme afin de rendre les activités dans le petit commerce plus rentables, elles s’activent également dans l’agriculture sous pluie. Une bonne ambiance anime les rencontres du groupe. 

Madame Mayama, âgée de 36 ans (assise à l’extrême droite et levant la main droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de vêtements et de chaussures.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter des habits et des chaussures d’un montant de 300 000f pour le revendre en détails dans son village et payer un transport de 25000f. 

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Inaugurated on 4th June, this banc villageois is made up of women from the village group who joined the program in order to make their petty trade activities more profitable. They also work in agriculture during the rainy season. A good atmosphere pervades the group meetings.
Mrs Mayama, 36 years old (seated at the extreme right and raising her right hand) is the group's featured borrower. She is married and mother to six children. She sells clothes and shoes. WIth her new loan, she intends to buy clothes and shoes for 300 000f and retail them in her village, and pay for transport at 25 000f. With the earnings, she intends to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for 300 000f to retail in her village and pay transport of 25 000f.

loans.name: Nagjije

texts.en:
Nagjije is a 50 year old woman living in the south eastern part of Kosovo. She is married and has six children. Her husband has not been working and in order to earn a living she has been selling milk in her neighborhood. She has been conducting her business from her home for a long time now and for the first time she is requesting a loan in order to purchase another cow and to renovate her stable.

As her business is the only source of income for the family, she works hard to improve their lives, but recently she had to sell her cow for income and has not been able to continue with her business or to have a steady form of income.

Her goal is to offer her family a more comfortable lifestyle and improved standard of living. She is grateful to Kiva lenders to help her to purchase another cow and to renovate the stable, so that she can continue to help her family and eventually grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase another cow and to renovate her stable.

loans.name: Oblitas

texts.es:
Oblitas tiene 33 años de edad, vive en casa propia familiar de material rústico, vive con sus padres no tiene hijos en su poder , tiene muy buena referencias tanto personales como laborales en su comunidad,en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, Sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica es la agricultura, específicamente a realizar labores de peón agrícola,con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años, el préstamo que se le otorgara lo utilizara en compra y mantenimiento de sus herramientas de trabajo y en la compra de una mochila para fumigar, De esta manera tener una mejor calidad de servicio que ofrecer a sus clientes, mejorar su volumen de ventas y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Oblitas is 33 years old and lives in a house of his own made out of rustic materials. He lives with his parents and doesn't have any child under his care.

He has good personal and work references from the people of his community, located in the district of Pomahuaca, in the Jaen province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

He works in agriculture, specifically as a farm worker, and he has 10 years of experience doing this activity. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy and give maintenance to his working tools, and also to buy a fumigation backpack.

With this help he hopes to give his customers the best quality of service, improve his sales and his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy and give maintenance to his working tools, and to buy a fumigation backpack.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nuevo horizonte se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, este es un grupo formado por 9 mujeres y 3 hombres que decidieron unirse y acceder a  los créditos los mismos que esperan recibir  para mejorar sus negocios y su calidad de vida, la mayoría se dedica al comercio informal.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Merly, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su marido es chofer de un taxi. 
Doña Merly con la intención de ganarse algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar a su marido con los  gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de sobrecamas, edredones y en ciertas ocasiones ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, ella  deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, lleva casi tres años con esta actividad la misma que empezó con uno de los créditos que recibió de la institución, ella antes se dedicaba a la costura pero por motivos de salud dejo de coser y dedicarse a algo más fácil y que le deja muy buenos ingresos.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: sabanas, edredones y ropa. Este es su primer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito, antes estaba en otro grupo y ahora empezó en este el cual espera seguir por mucho tiempo ya que siempre los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son seguir adelante mejorando su vida.
texts.en:
The members of the Nuevo Horizonte community bank meet twice a month in Portoviejo, one of Ecuador's most important commercial centers. The members--9 women and 3 men--banded together to raise funds that they will use to improve their small and mostly informal businesses.

Our featured member, Merly, 56, is married and has three grown children, one of whom still lives at home. Her husband has a taxi business. Doña Merly had a tailoring business before but gave it up for health reasons. She has a business buying and selling clothing, sheets and bed covers now and says that it suits her better. She started the business three years ago with a previous loan and sells her merchandise door to door and, for those customers she knows well, from her home. She sells on credit and collects from her buyers twice a month.

Doña Merly is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with clothing, sheets and bed covers. This is the group's first round of funding. (Doña Merly was a member of another community bank before.)

loans.use: to stock her retail sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Saulina

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Zavala Província de Inhambane, viúva mãe de 1 filha adoptiva menor de idade e não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
É proprietária de um salão de beleza onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com valor solicitado pretende aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo produtos de beleza tais como cabelos e vitaminas para satisfazer as necessidades dos seus clientes.
Futuramente pretende construir um salão de beleza e concluir a sua obra de residência.
texts.en:
She was born in Zavala, Inhambane province. She is a widow and the mother of an adoptive daughter. She is not responsible for anyone else.

She owns a beauty salon, where she earns an income that she uses to cover the home expenses. With the requested amount, she is planning to expand her business and buy beauty products such as hair extensions and vitamins to fulfill her clients’ needs.

In the future, she would like to build a beauty salon and finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and vitamins to fulfill her clients' needs.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La Señora Ana es una persona responsable, emprendedora que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan desde hace mucho en su domicilio particular, también en el mismo lugar la señora para poder salir adelante abrió su tienda en su barrio. Su actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de pan, trabaja sola ya que su esposo se dedica al transporte de pasajeros.
La señora Ana realizo cursos para elaboración de pan el cual tiene un certificado avalado por FAUTAPO.  
La señora solicita el presente préstamo para adquirir un horno e implementos, laminadora para masas e insumos para panadería y de esta forma mejorar su equipamiento de panadería y por ende mejorar su situación económica de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is a responsible and entrepreneurial person and she has worked for many years making and selling bread from her home.  In the same place she opened a store in her neighbourhood to allow her to get ahead. Her main activity is making and selling bread. She works alone and her husband works transporting passengers. 
Ana took courses in making bread in which she received a certificate endorsed by FAUTAPO.
She is requesting the present loan to buy an oven and implements, a laminator for the dough, and supplies for making bread. In this way she will improve her bread-making equipment and ultimately improve her and her family's economic situation.

loans.use: to buy an oven and implements, a laminator for the dough, and supplies for making bread.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Cidade de Maputo tem 31 anos de idade, casada oficialmente é mãe de 2 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua sobrinha que vive em sua casa.
Começou a trabalhar com Hluvuku em 2011. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: cimento, blocos e chapas de zinco para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Futuramente pretende concluir a sua obra e iniciar um negócio de criação de frangos para a venda. O seu maior desafio é concretizar os seus sonhos
texts.en:
She was born in Maputo. She is 31 years old and married. She is the mother of two children; one of them goes to school. She is responsible for her niece, who lives with her.

She started to work with Hluvuku in 2011. This is her fourth loan from Hluvuku, and she is planning to buy construction materials such as cement, bricks, and zinc sheets to continue with the construction works.

In the future, she plans to finish the construction works and start raising chickens to sell. Her biggest challenge is to make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, and zinc sheets.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more shirts and dresses for sale.

loans.name: Lariba

texts.fr: Lariba est une femme mariée de 45 ans et vivant à Agoè . Avec quatre enfants à charge, Lariba est une femme dynamique et courageuse qui achète des foulards et des basins au marché une fois par mois et qu’elle revend de quartier en quartier. Lariba désire ce prêt pour commander des basins afin d’atteindre ses objectifs fixés et aider son mari à payer les frais scolaire de leurs enfants dès la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en: Lariba is a 45 year old married woman living in Agoè. With four children in her care, Lariba is a dynamic and courageous woman who buys scarves and brocade cloth at the market once per month which she resells from neighbourhood to neighbourhood. Lariba would like this loan so as to order brocade cloth so that she can meet her objectives and help her husband to pay their children's school fees from the next shool year.

loans.use: to buy twelve pieces of brocade cloth.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD TAMBO REAL, él socio continua dedicándose a la ganadería, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio es una persona responsable, el socio agradece a los inversionistas por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar una vaca.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Solidaridad Tambo Real". Mario continues to work raising livestock. He has had his business for quite some time and things are going well thanks to the determination he brings to his business each day. He is a responsible person and he thanks the lenders for the loan and promises to comply with the established installments. He wants to be able to continue working so that he can continue to support his family.

He is requesting the loan to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia Cirila pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD TAMBO REAL, la socia continua dedicándose a la  ganadería y agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua cultivando papa, maíz entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar abono  y semillas.
texts.en:
Cirila belongs to the "Solidaridad Tambo Real" communal bank. She continues to work in agriculture and raising livestock. She has been in the business for quite some time and things are going well for her thanks to the determination she brings to her work each day. She continues to grow potatoes and corn amongst others. She wishes to continue to work in this way to continue to support her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy manure and seeds.

loans.use: to buy manure and seeds.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
It is possible to have a better living condition someday. This is Gorret's dream. She is a widow and runs a variety store and also retails rice, sugar, soap, salt, bread, cooking oil and other items. She works hard and saves little by little in order to expand her business.

The people in Gorret's location are quite familiar with each other. When her neighbors ask for credit for her goods, she cannot refuse them. Sometimes it depletes her capital.

As of now, she needs additional capital of ugx1,500,000 for her business. She will use it to buy additional items for her inventory. It will improve her profit, and she will use the proceeds to pay tuition for her children and meet the other family financial obligations. She provides their daily food sustenance and helps pay the monthly bills for electricity and water. She is praying that you would be one of God’s instruments to grant her needed capital. She would really appreciate your kind support.

Gorret is committed to Kiva's vision to alleviate poverty, and she regularly saves with the institution to raise more money to buy a piece of land where she will in future build a family house to escape the burden of renting.

She is so much appreciative of Kiva lenders for the support.

loans.use: to boost her retail trade by expanding stocks for sale

loans.name: Shukrije

texts.en:
Shukrije wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan. She has been able, through the loan, to improve her family conditions. Her husband is still working in a construction company and Shukrije has started a small business as a seamstress, working from her home while caring for the house and children . Shukrije makes various types of clothing for men and women, mainly for events and celebrations.

At this time she is in need of a loan for material to help her improve her business. She really appreciates the help from Kiva lenders that will enable her to continue her business and improve it for her customers. Her goals is to open her own shop and expand her business so she can make even more income and help her family have a stable and comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy material and sewing necessities for her home sewing activity

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina is a 44-year-old married mother of two children, both in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Evelina has a soft drink retailing business in the Philippines. Evelina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more soft drinks to sell.

Evelina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Evelina would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 28 years old and single. She lives in a rural community near Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She runs a small general store selling varieties of food items such as rice noodles, canned foods and she also makes and sells ice block drinks. She has been doing this for three years.

Daisy needs a loan to buy sugar,coloring, flavor and a sealer machine to assist her run the business. She plan to use her profit to expand her business and to help covers her family's expenses.

She has been a SPBD member since 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: a loan of $5400 helps Daisy buy sugar, coloring, flavours, plastic and a sealer machine for her business.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas, 27-year-old, has been running several businesses from which she provides for her two children. She is successfully running a salon business and several rental-house units at Nairobi’s Mukuru Kwa Reuben.

At her rental units business, her tenants do not have any toilets facilities; they use the neighboring pit latrines at a fee of five Kenyan shillings per use.
Since Fresh Life Toilets began operation in Mukuru, land lords have been on the frontline in joining the movement and currently Dorcas wants to be part of it too. She has seen the positive impact Fresh Life Toilets have had in reducing open defecation and tenants’ turnover rates within plots.
She has an ongoing plan to revamp the plot house units’ including installing one Fresh Life Toilet. With the facility, she targets to ensure her tenants have access to a free, clean, and hygienic toilet facility at all times.
Let us join Dorcas towards sanitation improvement at her plot business!

loans.use: to pay for one Fresh Life toilet.

loans.name: Agua Viva Racana Group

texts.en:
to expand her restaurant business.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Agua Viva Racana” is in the southwest region of Guatemala where there are large pine trees and tall mountains. The Trust Bank is located in the small town of Santa Maria Chiquimula that is in the State of Totonicapan where the Maya K’iche language is the primary language spoken. The women wear the traditional clothing of beautifully embroidered huipiles (blouses), fajas (belts) and cortes (wrap-around skirts). They feel that wearing their traditional clothing is their identity and more importantly, protects their cultural traditions.

Ten small business women have joined together to form the Trust Bank “Agua Viva Racana”. Their businesses are inside and outside of the borders of their community. The women buy and sell a variety of items, such as, food, cellular accessories, pig and goat meat, and traditional blouses and belts. These are very humble women who are responsible and committed to improving their lives and those of their children. Their average school attendance was only through the second grade. Each lady has an average of five children.

One of the group’s members is Timotea who is 38 years old. She plays a very important part of the group as its President. Timotea has six children and she is very pleased that each is attending school. She and her husband have a small restaurant where the couple also sells freshly made tortillas.

Their business has been growing and growing. In order to satisfy their customers’ needs, Timotea is asking for a loan to buy tables and chairs, as well as more corn for the tortillas. She also wants to invest in animal husbandry - pigs, goats, chickens and turkeys. Income from them will help the family in the inbetween times. All the women of “Agua Viva Racana” thank Kiva investors for supporting them in becoming better business women, as well as helping them have a brighter future. Mil gracias!!!

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs, as well as more corn for the tortillas on sale at her restaurant.

loans.name: Ricchary Anteña Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “RICCHARY ANTEÑA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosalbina, la socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia vende lo que son productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar gaseosas entre otros.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde  a la reunión por  motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The Group members are part of the “RICCHARY ANTEÑA” community bank. This bank is located in Anta district, part of Anta province in the Department of Cusco.

Rosalbina is a member of the Group; she makes a living from her business running a grocery store.She has run the business for some time which is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. The member is a diligent and responsible person, she sells staples such as rice and sugar amongst other things. In this way the member provides for her family. The member is grateful to everyone who is part of this dream by providing financial resources and commits to make the monthly payments according to the established terms. The member is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks and other goods. The members who appear in the in the attached photos apologized for being late for the meeting due to work commitments.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and other goods.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD DE TAMBO REAL, él socio sigue dedicándose a la ganadería, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas,
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar una vaca entre otros.
texts.en:
Walter belongs to the "Solidaridad de Tambo Real" communal bank. He continues to work raising livestock. He is a responsible and diligent person. He has had his business for quite some time and it provides him with personal satisfaction. He wishes to be able to continue working and in this way continue to support his family.

He is grateful for the loan awarded and promises to comply with the established installments.

He is requesting the loan to buy a cow amongst others.

loans.use: to buy a cow amongst others.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a resident in the town of Mcarthur, Leyte who grows and sells rice. She is a 58-year-old married mother of eight children. Her youngest child is 19.  She has been farming rice for more than 20 years. In the photo, she is standing in front of her newly well-milled rice ready to be sold. 

Letecia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings. She wants to improve the yield of her farm and sell quality rice. Her income will enable her to pay her obligations and handle her finances. She then could support the schooling of her children and provide them with nutritious diets.

In the future, she dreams of expanding her rice farming business to be more productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with 2 children.

She has a personal care products business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more personal care products to sell. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a general store.

Mary dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 54 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Luisa has a general store business in the Philippines. Ma. Luisa requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Luisa has been in this business for four years. In the future, Ma. Luisa would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez, 47 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Kaneez  needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand.
