She has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel is applying for a loan of (USD) $1,000 to improve her retail business. She is married and has a small kiosk that she plans to expand in the future. Isabel is taking out this loan to buy additional merchandise to sell in her kiosk including detergent, slippers, pens, toothpaste, sugar, lighters, and soft drinks. She started her business in 2010 with working capital of (USD) $500. Isabel is happy with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin that provides her with more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy detergent, slippers, pens, toothpaste, sugar, lighters, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: 100 X 100 Bolivia Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “100 X 100 BOLIVIA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Placida es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa,  venta de chalecos y chamarras, venta de frutas, servicio de albañil, venta de comida, venta de verduras, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Placida es integrante, ella indica que es el tercer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chamarras; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace doce años ya que este negocio lo aprendió trabajando en un taller como costurera, es así que con sus ahorros decidió abrir su propio taller. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas por mayor) que adquirirá de tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la confección de las chamarras, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive es viuda y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The eight members of the 100x100 community bank are embarking on their third round of funding from Pro Mujer, a project supported by the Panamericana Center. The members operate a range of businesses--clothing sales; food sales; construction services; corner groceries; etc.--and loans will go to supporting and growing their businesses.

Sra. Placida is the group's president. She started a business making and selling coats and jackets 12 years ago and joined the community bank at the invitation of a friend who was already a member. She worked in a shop making coats and jackets before and scraped together her savings to start her own business. Sra. Placida will use her share of the loan to buy wholesales supplies of the fabric she needs to make coats and jackets. She will buy the fabric in El Alto and sell the finished coats and jackets locally. Sra. Placida is a widow with three children and the investment will help her to provide for her family.

When we asked Sra. Placida what she most likes about Pro Mujer, she told us that she likes the savings that the institution delivers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies of fabric for her coats- and jackets-making business.

loans.name: Ganjimo

texts.en:
Ganjimo is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1974. She is living in a big city with her family. She is married and has three children. Her husband is an emigrant who works in Russia. She has a business in agriculture, keeping and feeding livestock and then selling them in the animal market. She likes to keep livestock. She is a responsible and careful mother and aunt.

Ganjimo came to IMON and asked for a loan to pay for the education costs of her cousin. She hopes to support her cousin and see her be active in her studies. She awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her cousin's education costs.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD DE TAMBO REAL, la socia continua  dedicándose a la ganadería, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo leche a su clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
La socia solicita el crédito para arreglar su establo.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank Solidaridad De Tambo Real. She still works with livestock, and has been in business for some time. Things are going well for her because she works hard every day. She still sells milk to all the customers who come to her. She wants to be able to keep working in order to continue supporting her family.

Member Martha is grateful for this loan and promises to comply with her payment terms. She is requesting it in order to fix up her barn.

loans.use: to fix up her barn.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: La señora Esther es originaria de Potosí migro hacia el trópico con la finalidad de buscar un mejor futuro, en la actualidad vive en Entre Ríos, Carrasco en una casa que se compró con mucho sacrificio, desde muy joven se dedicó a trabajar en la agricultura ya que sus bajos ingresos económicos de sus padres no permitieron que ella pudiera acceder a una formación escolar por ello desde entonces trabajo mucho, en principio en la parcela de sus amigos luego en la parcela de otras personas que le acogieron amablemente posteriormente con los ahorros de su trabajo adquirió su propio lote agrícola el cual le permitió progresar ya que todo los ingresos generados fueron para su beneficio, en el futuro tiene sueños de ampliar y mejorar su vivienda donde podrá vivir más cómodamente para ello quiere mejorar los rendimientos de su producción lo cual será posible gracias al apoyo brindado por la institución dando como resultado el desarrollo económico y social de la señora. La señora requiere un préstamo para ampliar su negocio y poder ofrecer mejores alternativas.
texts.en:
Esther is originally from Potosí and moved to the tropics for the purpose of looking for a better future. She currently lives in Entre Rios. She lives in a house that she bought with much sacrifice.
She has worked in agriculture since she was very young. Because her parents' low economic income did not permit it, she was not able to have access to academic formation and this is way she has worked. She worked mainly on a plot of land owned by friends and later of other people that were friendly and accepted her. After that she was able to purchase her own plot of land with the savings from her work. This has allowed her to progress and now all of the income that she generates can be used for her benefit.  
In the future she has dreams of expanding and improving her house where she will be able to live more comfortably. She wishes to improve the efficiency of her production, which will be possible thanks to the support from the institution, which has helped with economic and social development. 
Esther needs a loan to expand her business and to be able to offer better alternatives.

loans.use: to buy supplies to expand her agricultural production and improve her family's income.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lilibeth works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store.  Lilibeth is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy a variety of frozen food to sell for her business.

Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of frozen food to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alma is 45 years old and has three children who are in school.

Alma has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock of dried fish to sell.

Alma has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Analine

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Analine works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Analine is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business for her food vending business.

Analine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur, is 49 years old and has three children who are in school.

Violeta has a food vending business in the Philippines. Violeta requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Violeta has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Violeta would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Tungteeya  Bim - Masaka Group

texts.en:
Azara is a 50-year-old hard working woman from Bimbilla in the Northern region of Ghana. Azara is married and has 6 children. Azara is the individual pictured with the hands on the milled parboiled rice among members squatting.

Azara is a member of a parboiled rice processing group that has been in business for the past decade and half. The name of the group is ‘Tungteeya Bim - Masaka- Bimbilla’. She earned a good profit from the business after her previous loan that helped her processed an increased volume of quality parboiled rice for the local markets around Bimbilla and beyond.
Azara and ‘Tungteeya Bim - Masaka Bimbilla’ group have asked for anther loan of GHC 11,900.00. Azara’s share of the loan is GHC 500.00 which would be used to buy paddy rice from local rice farmers for processing.

Azara loves to make her children happy, hence wants to earn more income, so as to repay this loan, support her family and grow her business. Azara thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy paddy rice from local rice farmers for processing.

loans.name: Bendicion De Dios Xejuyup Group

texts.en:
In the Western Highlands of the Guatemalan State of Quetzaltenango is the town of Cantel where the primary language is Maya K’iche. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Bendicion de Dios Xejuyup” with its nine members is located here. These dedicated women are asking for their first microcredit loan from Kiva investors so that each member can expand her small business.

Thirty-one year old Aholibama, who is married with three children in school, has a business embroidering the traditional blouse called a “huipil”. Her business has been successful enough that she is able to employ three other women to help her. Aholibama is asking for a loan to buy seven dozen boxes of metallic threads, a dozen different fabrics, 13 dozen fabric linings, needles and pins, as well as other necessary items that go into producing the beautiful huipiles.

Aholibama and her “Bendicion de Dios Xejuyup” companions have an added bonus with their membership in the Trust Bank. They have the opportunity to have a non-formal education that is part of the Friendship Bridge “Microcredit Plus” program combination of microloans and education. At the monthly meetings of the group, the Friendship Bridge Facilitator provides information on important topics that the women can use on a daily basis whether it is within their families or to improve their businesses.

Thanks to the capital support of Kiva investors, the women are able overcome obstacles in their way and create new and empowering opportunities for themselves and their families. They are able to replace the negative with strong self-sufficiency and decisionmaking. It is a win-win for them and their children. A big shout-out to each Kiva investor! THANK YOU!

loans.use: to buy seven dozen boxes of metallic threads, a dozen different fabrics, to continue with her embroidery business.

loans.name: Tristeza

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Goba, Distrito de Namaacha Província de Maputo, tem 40 anos de idade, é solteira mãe de 3 filhos que frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pala sua neta que vive em sua casa.
Começou a trabalhar com Hluvuku em 2009. Este é seu 7º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende ampliar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo produtos tais como: amendoim e feijão, para satisfazer as necessidades dos seus clientes.
Futuramente pretende concluir a sua obra de residência e adquirir uma viatura. O seu maior desafio é manter o seu negócio como base de sustentabilidade
texts.en:
She was born in Goba, Namaacha district of the Maputo province. She is 40 years old, single, and the mother of three children, who go to school. She takes care of her granddaughter, who lives with her.

She started to work with Hluvuku in 2009. This is her seventh loan from Hluvuku, and she is planning to expand her business. She will buy products such as peanuts and beans in order to fulfill her customers’ needs.

In the future, she is planning to finish building her house and purchase a vehicle. Her biggest challenge is to keep her business running to sustain her family.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and beans to fulfill her customers' needs.

loans.name: Hilda Aurora

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 53 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo sin hijos en una zona rural en el distrito de Macuaco, del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Hilda se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cuyes, pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Hilda espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Hilda is 53 years old and married. She lives with her husband and no children in a rural part of the Macuaco district in the Oyotún district, which is located in the Chiclayo provice, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this district work primarily in agriculture, ranching, and commerce.

Hilda makes a living raising and selling small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, hens, ducks, turkeys, and others. Her business is located in her own home. She has 10 years of experience in this business, and has very good personal and professional references in the area.

The loan Hilda is requesting will be used to buy a larger quantity of animals such as hens, ducks, chickens, and others, and also to buy nourishing food for them. With this, HIlda hopes to offer a better product to her customers, which will allow her to increase her income, and ultimately will improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals and nourishing food for them.

loans.name: Las Estrellas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ESTRELLAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Domitila es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de calzas, venta de trabas, venta de cosméticos, venta de busos de lana, venta de comida, venta de autos, venta de fresco.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Domitila es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su prima que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá hace más de diez años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de trabajo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Las Estrellas community bank are embarking on their first round of funding from Pro Mujer, a project supported by the Panamericana Center.  The members operate a range of businesses--footwear sales, cosmetics sales, food sales, automobile sales, etc.--and your loans will go to supporting and growing their businesses.  

Sra. Domitila is the group's president.  She has operated a food business for more than ten years and joined the community bank at the invitation of a cousin who was already a member.  Her mother had a food business before and taught her everything she needed to know to start her own business.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy wholesale supplies of potatoes.  She will buy the potatoes from distributors in El Alto and sell them locally.  Sra. Domitila is partnered and has four children.  The investment will help her to provide for her family.

When we asked Sra. Domitila what she most likes about Pro Mujer, she told us that she values the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies of potatoes for her food sales business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Arlene is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy assorted vegetable to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 59 years old, married with two children.

Monica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Monica has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending.

Monica aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Celestina works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell vegetable. Celestina is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell for her buy and sell dried fish business.

Celestina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more bananas, cassava and beans for sale.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresia has lived in Mukuru Kayaba for fifteen years. It is here that she has raised her three children and established her micro-enterprises of water vending and a retail shop.
In her area, there are no decent toilets. Her family and community use makeshift options, often located by the Nairobi riverbed.

At night, due to insecurity, these facilities are not accessible particularly by women and girls for fear of rape. She learnt about Fresh Life Toilets through the sales associates at Fresh Life and is determined to join the movement by acquiring one Fresh Life Toilet.

She sees this as an opportunity to provide a sanitary and safer toilet option for her family and neighboring community at all times.
Ultimately she hopes her work contributes towards a cleaner environment free of flying toilets along Kayaba pathways.

loans.use: to pay for One Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.en:
Jhonny is 53 years old, father of 4 and the family has their own house. Jhonny works as a waiter. His wife works as a messenger.

Jhonny needs a loan to fix a room at his house. He is trying to give his family better conditions of life, so he hopes you can help him. His house has many problems and he wants to solve them, although it will take a lot of time

loans.use: to repair his home, particularly the roof terrace.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
La socia Yanet sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de lácteos como leche y quesos, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia continua dedicándose a la ganadería, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Member Yanet still works selling dairy products like milk and cheese. She is a responsible and driven person. She continues to sell her products to all the customers who come to her. Working with livestock is how she earns a living and provides for her family.

Yanet is requesting this loan to buy milk and other products. She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with her payment terms.

loans.use: to buy milk and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an expensive oral surgery.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 42 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Florence has a general store business in the Philippines. Florence requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Florence has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Florence would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 32 years old, married and has five children, three children who are in school.

Flora is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Flora requested a PHP 26000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Flora has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Flora would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 59 years old and married with five children. Beverly works very hard to provide for them.

Beverly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Beverly has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Beverly would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD TAMBO REAL, la socia continua dedicándose a la ganadería, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua criando a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the communal bank Solidaridad Tambo Real. She still works with livestock and has been in business for a good amount of time. Things are going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. She still raises animals for the customers who come to her, and she wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.

She is requesting this loan to purchase a cow, among other things. She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with her payment terms.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en: Zamira is a hospitable woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1962 and she lives in small city with her family. She is married and has two children. She is a teacher at secondary school near to their house. She likes children and teaches them gently. Her own children got sick, and she worries about them and wants to see them healthy. They were tested at the hospital and doctors said that they need to get hospital treatment. She had not saved up money to pay for medical services. She thought it would be better if she get a loan from IMON and then made repayments over time. She hopes Kiva lenders will be kind and support her in this difficult time in her life.

loans.use: to pay for medical services at the hospital for her children.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El socio  pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD TAMBO REAL, el socio continua dedicándose a la ganadería, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio continua criando a sus animales para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, él socio desea poder continuar trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar una vaca entre otros.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the communal bank Solidaridad Tambo Real. He still works with livestock and has been in business for a good amount of time. Things are going well for him thanks to the effort he puts into his business every day. He is still raising animals and later selling them to the customers who come to him. He wants to be able to keep working so that he can continue to support his family.

He is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with his payment terms. He is requesting this loan to purchase a cow, among other things.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena has been engaged in farming for more than 20 years now. She grows and sells rice. She is a 64-year-old, married woman with ten grown children. She hails from the town of Mcarthur, Leyte.

Lucena decided to take a loan to support her current source of income. Lucena is standing in front of several sacks filled with newly harvested rice ready to be sold to her respective customers. She has requested a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides. With these, she would be able to grow and get higher yields. Her farm will improve and enable her to settle her obligation. She could also provide nutritious meals that are essential in her day-to-day livelihood. Thus, Lucena could start to expand her farm and invest in any possible business opportunities.

She hopes to be successful in handling her source of income for it to become sustainable in preparation for old age.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Martina Nila

texts.en:
She hails from the town of Mcarthur, Leyte. Martina Nila is fifty-five years old, a married woman with three grown children.

She runs an eatery. She prepare meals and sells them to the locals. She will buy meat for adobo (a Filipino dish of chicken or pork stewed in vinegar, garlic, soy sauce, bay leaves and peppercorns), and menudo(pork stew). With the presence of these, it will enable her to prepare and sell a variety of meals and cater to the orders of her respective customers.

She needs additional capital to finance her ongoing business. Thus her income will improve her livelihood. She will be able to balance her finances and set aside some savings for emergency use.

Martina Nila dreams to expand her business to become financially stable in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like meat, seasonings and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El señor tiene 29 años de edad, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cochabamba tiene una familia compuesta de su esposa e hijo de 4 años de edad, el señor es un trabajador profesional, sin embargo hace 7 meses ha sufrido un accidente trágico de transito en una avenida de la ciudad siendo atropellado por una movilidad que no paró para auxiliarlo y se dio a la fuga.  a raíz de ésto él ha perdido parte de su pierna y después de estar en peligro su vida por complicaciones infecciosas y tratamientos costosos, está buscando en las compañías de aparatos ortopédicos una prótesis que le devuelva la seguridad de movimiento.  felizmente se está recuperando con mucho esfuerzo y necesita una prótesis que podrá hacer que pueda movilizarse sin las muletas nuevamente.  la misma tiene un costo alto y necesita parte de los recursos para poder cubrir esta su necesidad para poder movilizarse nuevamente y continuar con su vida laboral y familiar, pasando la pagina de este trágico acontecimiento.
texts.en: Our member, 29, lives in the city of Cochabamba with his wife and 4-year old son.  He is a skilled worker, but has been unable to work since he was badly injured by a hit-and-run driver 7 months ago.  He was hit crossing a road by a driver who failed to stop and help, an accident that cost him part of his leg and almost cost him his life.  He also incurred huge medical expenses for the treatments he needed.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy a prosthesis that will return some of the mobility that he has lost.  He has worked hard to recover and, happily, has made a lot of progress.  The prosthesis will allow him to walk without crutches, but it is expensive and he needs your help to buy it.  The investment will allow him to go back to work and turn the page on this tragic event.

loans.use: to buy an orthopedic device that will allow him to go back to work.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 53 years old and has five children. Florencia is married and has three children who are in school.

Florencia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Florencia requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Florencia has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Florencia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with ten children, four of her children are in school. She is 44 years old, and she is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marilyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalia is 46 years old and has five children who are in school.

Rosalia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell in the market.

Rosalia has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell in the market.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a married woman with four children, and two of her children are in school. She is 40 years old, and she is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rosalie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell in the market.

Rosalie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell in the market.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 52 years old and has four children. Lilia is married and has three children who are in school.

Lilia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Lilia requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lilia has been raising pigs for 8 years now and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 36 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Flordeliza is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Flordeliza has been raising pigs for 4 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Flor De Tzununa Group

texts.en:
Leaving port from the shores of Panajachel and taking a smooth, 25 minute boat ride due west and you will find yourself in the community of Tzununa, Guatemala. After walking further up inland, the village becomes spread out and sparse as you pan across the beautiful mountainside that makes up the home of communal bank “Flor de Tzununa”.

Maria, the group’s treasurer, is 21 years old who offers the most delightful air of charm that spreads every time she speaks. Not being married or having children, Maria is able to dedicate all of her time to her business that helped get its start from Friendship Bridge just over two cycles ago.

Maria produces and sells intricately and uniquely designed huipiles, skirts, and bordering in her local and surrounding communities. In order to increase her business, Maria is asking for a loan from Kiva in order to purchase new materials so that she may more effectively produce goods as wells as offer a wider variety of fabric to satisfy her customers growing demands. Maria remarked how Friendship Bridge and the loans she has received have helped her in ways that she could not have imagined. The new loan that Maria will receive will surely boost her to an even greater quality of life while simultaneously increasing her appreciation for the help she is receiving.
Aside from the loan that she receive, Maria, and the rest of the 22,000 clients, receives a monthly non-formal education session touching on various topics of personal development. Thank you Kiva investors for the continued confidence in Friendship Bridge and the women of Guatemala!

loans.use: to purchase new materials, so that she may more effectively produce traditonal textiles.

loans.name: Jose Ebelio

texts.es:
El señor Jose Ebelio  es un hombre  muy trabajador y querido en su Aldea, se dedica a la fabricación de artesanía siendo esta su mayor fuente de ingresos y tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad, sus artesanías de fino acabado tienen mucha  aceptación en las  tiendas, su actividad la realiza desde su casa de habitación la cual se encuentra en un punto estratégico en su aldea.
Don Jose Ebelio  se levanta muy temprano para empezar a trabajar  solicita el apoyo del crédito para la compra de materias primas como ser: maderas, resinas, selladores de madera etc. y otros productos. El sueña con tener un negocio donde pueda dar más empleo y poder cubrir con la demanda de la clientela y así poder mejorar sus ingresos y los de su familia.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Julio del  2015
texts.en:
Jose Ebelio is a very hardworking and well-loved person in his village. He works making crafts, which is his main source of income. He has been in this business for several years. His finely finished crafts are well-received in stores. He works at home, which works out well because his house is well located within the village.

Jose Ebelio gets up very early in order to start working. He is requesting support in order to buy materials like wood, resin, wood sealer, and other products. His dream is to run a larger business where he could create more jobs, meet customers' demand, and improve his and his family's income.

loans.use: to buy wood, resin, wood sealer, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD TAMBO REAL, el socio sigue dedicándose  al negocio de ganadería, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio continua criando a sus animales para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante  a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar una vaca entre otros.
texts.en:
He is a member of the communal bank “Solidaridad Tambo Real.” He is still raising cattle. He has been doing this for some time now and is doing well thanks to how hard he works every day. He continues raising animals and selling them to his customers. He gets ahead with his family thanks to this business.

He is requesting a loan to buy a cow, among other things.

loans.use: to buy a cow, among other things

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter's medical care.

loans.name: Monjama J

texts.en:
This is 31 year-old Monjama. She is married, and has 1 child aged 10yrs.

In 2012, Monjama established her provisions, and cosmetics business. She began her business after she was trained in a salon as a hairdresser. She decided to open her own shop in order to better herself and the only child she has for now. Working 6 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 SLL every month from this business.

Monjama would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,0000 SLL. She requires a loan in order to buy more packets of cereal, expression hair weavon, cartons of paste cream, soap, hair oil and hair spray. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 500,000 SLL.

Monjama was unable to meet her plans because of the current crisis in the country, that the movement of people from one place to another is restricted. In the future, Monjama still plans to open a boutique and to import goods of different types for wholesale. She is very hard working and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more packets of cereal, nutria, expression hair, cartons of paste cream, soap, hair oil and hair spray.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Conchita is 58 years old now.

Conchita has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy garments and other materials needed for her business.

Conchita has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Conchita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy garments and other materials needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Josephine is 56 years old now.

Josephine has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy materials needed, like garments and thread.

Josephine has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed, like garments and thread.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Analiza works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Analiza is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her vegetable farm.

Analiza has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 30 years old and has two children who are in school.

Marilyn has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy bundles of firewood to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bundles of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Meralin

texts.en:
Meralin is 29 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Meralin is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Meralin requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Meralin has been raising pigs for 4 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Meralin would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD TAMBO REAL, la socia continua dedicándose a la ganadería, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo leche  a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This individual is a member of the communal bank Solidaridad Tambo Real. Her business continues to make a living from livestock. She has worked in her business for a good amount of time. It is going well for her thanks to the determination that she puts into it every day. She continues selling milk to her customers that request it. She hopes to be able to continue working so that in this way she may continue supporting her family.

She is requesting the loan to purchase a cow, among others.

She is thankful for the loan and promises to make the payments of her loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cow, among others.

loans.name: Silia

texts.en: Silia is a single 21-year-old lady with one child. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a bag of sugar, bags of flour, vegetable oil, an oven, and baking soda. In the future, Silia hopes to save more of her profits to expand her business and to support her family financially. She joined SPBD at the beginning of this month to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a bag of sugar, bags of flour, vegetable oil, an oven, and baking soda.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Juan es un señor muy trabajador y querido en su barrio, se dedica a la sastrería que es fuente de ingresos fábrica uniformes para guardias de seguridad, colegios, etc. esto lo realiza desde su casa de habitación la cual se encuentra en un punto estratégico en su barrio.
Don Juan se levanta muy temprano para empezar a trabajar, solicita el préstamo para la compra de materias primas como ser: telas, hilos, zippers, botones, broches, etc. espera que esta inversión le sea de mucha ayuda en su negocio y que pueda salir adelante con su familia.
Don Juan  sueña con tener un negocio donde pueda dar más empleo y poder cubrir con la demanda de la clientela y así poder mejorar sus ingresos y los de su familia.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Julio del  2015
texts.en:
Juan is very hardworking and well-loved in his neighborhood. He works as a tailor. His main source of income is making uniforms for security guards, schools, etc. He works at home, which works out well because his house is in a good location within his neighborhood.

Juan gets up very early in order to start working. He is requesting this loan to purchase materials like fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, clasps, etc. He expects this loan to be of great help for his business so that he and his family can get ahead.

Juan's dream is to run a larger business where he could employ more people, meet higher demand, and improve his and his family's income.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, clasps, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Kisa

texts.en: Kisa is a 22-year-old woman who is single with no children. She plans to start a small business, planting and selling vegetables in her community for a living. Kisa needs a loan to buy a spade, rakes, bush knives, a bag of fertilizer and vegetable seeds. She will use her profits to expand her business and to support her family financially. Kisa joined SPBD at the beginning of this month to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a spade, rakes, bush knives, a bag of fertilizer and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Paulina Julia

texts.es: La señora Paulina Julia es una persona de 30 años de edad de estado civil conviviente, alcanzó a estudiar hasta la primaria, cuenta con cinco hijos dependientes a su cargo, vive en casa propia mismo que es de construcción rustica con material local ubicado en la comunidad de Kaspi Cancha abajo, Tiraque; su actividad económica es la agricultura en la que produce: papa, haba en vaina verde, arveja (seco), todos los productos mencionados son cultivados aproximadamente en una superficie de 2 has, los cuales cuentan con riego pero fue atacado por las inundaciones de la región; es por lo que la señora Paulina Julia necesita un préstamo para poder comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza) y semilla de papa para su producción con la intensión de que mejore sus ingresos y al mismo tiempo mejorar la vida de su familia y sus dependientes
texts.en: Paulina Julia is 30 years old and is in a common-law marriage. She managed to study up to primary school. She has five children who are dependent on her. She lives in her own home located in the Kaspi Cancha community below Tiraque. Her home is of rustic construction. She works in agriculture where she produces: potatoes, green beans, and dried peas. All of the products mentioned are cultivated in an area of approximately two hectares in size. The area has irrigation but it was attacked by floods in the region. This is why Paulina Julia needs a loan to buy organic fertilizer (manure) and potato seeds for production with the goal of improving her income and at the same time improving her family's and her dependent's lives.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma and her partner are engaged in the fishing business, like most of the community in Calape, Bohol. They have been doing this for 11 years. Alma is a 33-year-old woman and has three children. Her oldest child is 11 years old and her youngest is 3 years old. In order to increase their livelihood, she is asking for a loan of PHP 4000 to buy a fishing net. With this, Alma wishes to improve her business in the future for them to have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en:
Rosina is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosina is 65 years old now.

Rosina has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fire wood to sell.

Rosina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business .

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Maricor is 18 years old and is 5th of six children in the family. Her mother Corazon supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Maricor is studying Bachelor of Science in Business Administration, with a major in financial management and is currently in the 1st year of this 4 years-year course.

Corazon is borrowing 22000 to pay for tuition fees of the 1st year/1st semester.

When she graduates, Maricor plans to be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees for a B. Sc. in Business Administration and Finance

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business for her food vending business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is 34 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Hazel works very hard to provide for them.

Hazel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like home product care, junk foods and other groceries.

Hazel has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future, Hazel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like home product care, junk foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Ma.luz

texts.en:
Ma.Luz is 49 years old, married with five children.

Ma.Luz works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

Ma.Luz has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ma.Luz aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Joser Arturo

texts.es: Joser Arturo  tiene la edad de 19 años, está soltero   y vive con los padres   actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de una vacas de leche   .El espera poder obtener mas leche y queso para vender a los negocios y vecinos y engordar las crías  y venderlos con el peso ideal y  así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Joser Arturo is 19 years old and single. He is currently living with his parents. He needs a loan to buy milk cows. He hopes to produce more milk and cheese, and fatten the calves until they reach the right weight to be sold, in order to make better profits.

He hopes to be able to continue growing, improve his family’s quality of life in the future and offer them financial stability. This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He had not had loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR offered him better conditions and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy milk cows.

loans.name: Richar

texts.es: Richar tiene la edad de 38 años, está casado  y vive con la esposa y dos hijos actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de almacigo y abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de café que quieren iniciar. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Richar is 38 years old, is married and currently lives with his wife and two children. He needs this loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer to help a coffee plantation he wants to start. He wants to give the crops the proper maintenance so that he can have a greater production and thus have higher income. In the future, he hopes to provide his family a better quality of life and more economic stability. He also hopes to be able to keep growing as a person and as a producer. This is the first loan he receives from FUDECOSUR. He had not had any prior loans with state banks but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with better terms and the lower interest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, rice, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are locals.

Jacob will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, rice and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, rice and other items.

loans.name: Mercyline

texts.en:
Mercyline is a married woman. She describes herself as loyal. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, rice, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a marketable place, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, rice and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, flour, rice and other items.

loans.name: Nidia Maria

texts.es: Nidia Maria tiene la edad  de 48  años, está casada y vive con el esposo  y dos  hijos actualmente. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que a recibido de FUDECOSUR. Élla no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Nidia Maria is 48 years old and married. She currently lives with her husband and two children. She want to use this loan to purchase fertilizer and fungicides, as well as pay for labor to help with her coffee crops. She expects to make a small profit from these improvements so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

This is her first loan through FUDECOSUR. She has never obtained a loan before through a regular bank, but FUDECOSUR offers easier lending terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Aotoa

texts.en: Aotoa is 66 years old and married with four children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of flour, a bag of sugar, vegetable oil, an oven and a pot. In the future, Aotoa hopes to expand her business and to support her family financially. She joined SPBD at the beginning of this month to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, a bag of sugar, vegetable oil, an oven and a pot.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
A $ 600.00 is offered to Jacinta to improve her business.She is married and has three children. She runs a fruit and vegetables stall where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as tomatoes, citrus and vegetables.

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Jacinta independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family.

She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with this loan because it will improve her living condition in the future.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, citrus, vegetables.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a single mother of five children. She lives in Nairobi’s Majengo area where she also runs her rental units business. In addition, she sells vegetable products such as onions at Muthurwa market.
She recently saw Fresh Life Toilets at her home area in Majengo and was intrigued by the cleanliness and odorless nature of the facilities. At her plots, her family and tenants use neighboring pit latrines that are poorly maintained hence often clogged up especially during the rainy season.

Naomi is determined to join the Fresh Life movement with a goal to provide a sanitary toilet option for her tenants and family.
Moreover, she also hopes to offer toilet services to business people in her neighborhood thereby championing overall improved sanitation in Majengo while also creating a job opportunity for her son Paul who will be in charge of the facility’s maintenance.

Let us help Naomi in acquiring one Fresh Life Toilet!

loans.use: to pay for one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Lagomau

texts.en: Lagomau is married and the mother of two children. She runs a small business selling vegetables in her community and has been doing this for the last three years. She has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, a bag of fertilizer, a spade, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and a rake. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lagomau will expand her business and be able to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Alba Lizeth

texts.es:
La señorita  Alba Lizeth  es una  joven dinámica muy trabajadora y querida en su localidad, su negocio en un salón de belleza en el cual tiene tres años de brindar sus servicios profesionales  a  su clientela.
Doña Alba Lizeth  solicita el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de  materiales  de  belleza como ser  champú tintes, peróxidos,  queratinas secadora, etc. espera que esta inversión  le permita salir adelante en  su negocio y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 
Doña Alba Lizeth  sueña con que su negocio se mas grande y reconocido de su comunidad.



Tegucigalpa,  Honduras  - Julio del  2015
texts.en:
Alba Lizeth is a young woman who is dynamic and hardworking and loved in her community. Her business is a beauty salon in which she has provided her professional services to her customers for three years.

Alba Lizeth seeks the support of a loan to buy beauty products like shampoo, dyes, peroxide, keratin, a dryer, etc. She hopes that this investment will allow her to succeed in her business and to improve her and her family's quality of life. Alba Lizeth dreams that her business will get bigger and recognized in the community.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, dyes, peroxide, keratins, a dryer, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Lusa

texts.en:
Lusa is 43 years old and married with four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling daily consumption goods such as drinks, snacks, frozen products and more. She has been doing this for more than 10 years.

Lusa needs a loan to buy bags of sugar, flour, and rice, as well as drinks, bags of chicken, sausage, snacks and more. She hopes to use her profits to support her family financially and to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, flour, and rice, as well as drinks, bags of chicken, sausage, snacks and more.

loans.name: Karen Vanessa

texts.es:
La señora Karen es una  joven dinámica muy trabajadora y querida en su localidad, se dedica a su empleo como subdirectora en una escuela de su comunidad es una escuela para educar y tratar a niños especiales en el cual se destaca su labor humanitaria en gestión de  ayudas para estos pequeños y su fuente de ingresos proviene de su empleo.
Doña Karen es  también comerciante y se  dedica  a la venta  de mercaderías  con  lo genera un poco mas de ganancias con las cuales sostiene a su hija.  Esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de champo, cremas, lociones, ropa, zapatos, aretes, pulseras, etc. con esta inversión espera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 
Doña Karen sueña con tener un negocio donde pueda cubrir con la demanda de la clientela.



Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Julio del 2015
texts.en:
Karen is a young, dynamic, and hardworking woman, loved by her community. She is the deputy director of a community school for kids with special needs. It is important to highlight her humanitarian work administering the aid directed at these kids. Her job is her source of income.

Karen is also a businesswoman who sells different products. In this way, she generates an additional income to sustain her daughter. She is requesting a loan to buy shampoo, creams, lotions, clothes, shoes, earrings, wristbands, etc. With this investment, she hopes to be able to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

Karen dreams of having a business that fulfills all her customers’ demands.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – July, 2015

loans.use: to buy shampoo, creams, lotions, clothes, shoes, earrings, wristbands, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora Suyapa es una señora muy trabajadora y querida en su barrio, se dedica a la venta de leña que es su fuente de ingresos en ocasiones también vende jabones, esto lo realiza desde su casa de habitación la cual se encuentra en un punto estratégico en su barrio.
Doña Suyapa se levanta muy temprano para empezar a trabajar y sus clientes son todos sus vecinos y amigos de su comunidad, está solicitando el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de más leña de roble y ocote. Espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante con su familia y mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Doña Suyapa sueña con tener un negocio mucho más grande, tiene dos locales vacios que antes los alquilaba como apartamentos y quiere llenarlos de leña porque en la temporada de navidad este producto tiene mucha demanda y ella quisiera poder cubrirla.


 Tegucigalpa, Honduras  - Julio del 2015
texts.en:
Suyapa is a very hardworking and well-loved person in her neighborhood. She works selling firewood, which is her main source of income. Sometimes she also sells soap. She works at home, which works out well because her house is well located within the neighborhood.

Suyapa gets up very early in order to start working. Her customers are all neighbors and friends from the community. She is requesting the support of this loan to buy more oak and pine wood. She expects this investment to allow her to get ahead with her family and improve their quality of life.

Suyapa's dream is to run a much larger business. She has two empty spaces which she used to rent as apartments, and she would like to use them as storage for extra firewood, because during the Christmas season her product is in high demand and she would like to be able to meet it.

loans.use: to buy firewood for her business.

loans.name: Jorge Gerardo

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. Jorge; el socio continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de laptops para los distintos clientes que le solicitan, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio y a la vez el socio  continua trabajando para una institución privada de asesor financiero, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el préstamo para hacer el mantenimiento de su laptop.
 El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This is Jorge. He continues to make a living from the business of selling laptops to the different customers that request them from him. He has worked in his business for a good amount of time. It is going well for him thanks to the determination that he puts into it every day. He also continues to work for a private financial consulting institution, which is the way he continues to bring his family out ahead.

He is requesting the loan to maintain his laptop.

He is thankful for the loan awarded and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to maintain his laptop.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells Agrovet products. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals and she describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of Agrovet products. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank and her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of Agrovet products.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are locals.

Gladys describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: Purity is a married woman who has two children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions, cabbages and fruits. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of tomatoes, onions and cabbages. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of tomatoes, onions and cabbages.

loans.name: Tusiga

texts.en: Tusiga is a 26 years old single woman with one child. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages, cucumbers, pawpaw, tomatoes, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Tusiga has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed sprayer, etc .She has been a member of SBPD since 2011.With her profits,Tusiga hopes to support her family.

loans.use: to buy weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, etc.

loans.name: Kaisatina

texts.en: Kaisatina is a 56 years old woman who is married  with five children. She runs a business selling and sewing clothes in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. Kaisatina has requested a loan to buy materials, threads, a sewing machine, scissors, an elei board etc. She plans to use her profits to extend her business and to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, paint, thread, materials and scissors.

loans.name: Peka Felila

texts.en:
Peka is a single 19-year-old girl. She runs a small business selling pork buns and chips in her community and has been doing this for one year.

Peka has requested a loan to buy a pot, a fryer, bags of flour, a sack of chicken and vegetable oil. She joined SPBD in July to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Peka will support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a pot, a fryer, bags of flour, a sack of chicken and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”, el socio continua ejerciendo  su carrera de  guía de turismo, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, el socio continua realizando tours como Valle Sagrado, City Tours, Machupicchu entre otros, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de boletos, entradas entre otros.
 El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the communal bank Amauta. He is a responsible and driven person. He still works as a tourist guide. He is still organizing tours such as Sacred Valley, City Tours, Machupicchu, and others. This is the means by which he provides for his family.

He is requesting this loan to buy tickets and passes, among other items. He is grateful for the opportunity he is being offered and also promises make all of his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tickets and passes.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is married and the father of two children. He describes himself as patient and determined, and earns a living by operating a secondary school. He has been involved in this business for the last year and is doing well because his school is located in a good area. He will use this Kes 50,000 loan to buy lockers for students. This is Peter's second loan from the SMEP Microfinance bank; he successfully repaid his previous one.

loans.use: buy lockers for students

loans.name: Erick

texts.en: Erick is a married man. He describes himself as being hardworking. He operates a retail business where he sells jewelry and artistic products. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in an area with high demand for the products and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 85,000 loan to buy more stocks of jewelry. His business goal is to have a company with a wide range of artistic products within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank and his previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of jewelry.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is a 59-year-old man from Bohol, Philippines. He is married and has five children. To earn a living he and his wife run a sari-sari store business. They have been doing this for 25 years. Felix is asking a loan to buy stocks such as eggs, spices, chips, biscuits, canned goods, noodles, toiletries, liquor, soft drinks, sugar, coffee, powdered juice and chocolate drinks. He also buys fruits and vegetables to sell. In the future, Felix dreams to have a sustainable livelihood. With this, he works hard to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy eggs, spices, chips, biscuits, canned goods, noodles, toiletries, liquor, soft drinks, sugar, coffee, powdered juice, chocolate drinks, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sell basins, mattresses, school uniforms and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are regular. She will use the Kes 120,000 loan to buy more stock of basins, mattresses and school uniforms. She hopes that in the future, she will improve the living standards of her family. This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a cow.

loans.use: buy more stock of basins, mattresses and school uniforms.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be persuasive. She operates a preschool where she offers education. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to expand the school. She will use the Kes 95,000 loan to refurbish the school and hire more teachers. Her business goal is to have a big private school within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own groups of schools. This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the school.

loans.use: to refurbish the school and hire more teachers.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 31 years old and married, with three children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Analyn runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like biscuits, junk food, home care products, and other groceries.

Analyn has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items, such as biscuits, junk food, candies, soap, shampoo, coffee, and other groceries.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like biscuits, junk food, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Geiner

texts.es: Geiner  tiene la edad  de 32 años, está casado , vive con la esposa y tres hijos. Con su crédito pretende comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Geiner is 32 years old and married. He lives with his wife and their three children. He plans to use this loan to buy some seedlings so that he can replant at the start of the rainy season and increase plant density on his land. He expects to make a small profit from this improvement so that his living conditions improve and he can achieve other goals.

This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR. He was never able to borrow from regular banks, but FUDECOSUR offers easier terms on their loans and their interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to buy coffee plant seedlings.

loans.name: Osiris Eulalia

texts.es:
La señora Osiris Eulalia es una  persona muy dinámica muy trabajadora y querida en su localidad, se dedica la  venta  de  ropa y mercaderías  desde hace  9 años brindando sus productos a  su clientela que  en su  mayoría  son de las oficinas  del centro de  la ciudad.
Doña Osiris con muchos esfuerzos ha establecido una pequeña tienda para la exhibición de  sus productos y solicita el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de mercaderías en general  como ser blusas, pantalones, vestidos, camisas,  zapatos, joyería de  fantasía como collares, etc.
Doña Osiris sueña con tener un negocio donde pueda cubrir con la demanda de la clientela y así poder mejorar sus ingresos y los de su familia.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Julio del  2015
texts.en:
Osiris Eulalia is very dynamic and hardworking, and she is well-loved in her town. For the past nine years, she has been working selling clothing and merchandise. The main customers buying her products are office workers in the downtown area.

Osiris has put lots of effort into setting up a small store to display her products. She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise in general, such as blouses, pants, dresses, shirts, shoes, and costume jewelry like necklaces, etc.

Osiris wants to have a business that can meet her customers' demand so that she can improve her and her family's income.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, dresses, shirts, shoes, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Soloa

texts.en: Soloa is 27 years old and single with one child. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as snacks, cookies, chicken, sausages, etc. She has been doing this this year. Soloa needs a loan to buy shopping bags, a cooler,a freezer, etc . She hopes to use her profits to support her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in July this year to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a cooler, a freezer, shopping bags, tin fish, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits for his genge to resell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be persuasive. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to have a tailoring company within five years. This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is a 29-year-old woman from Bohol, Philippines. She is married and has two children ages eight and three years old. Her husband is a laborer, while she is planning to sells food (snacks) in their place to earn a living.
