Ana Marie and her husband work together for their family. Thus she is asking a loan of PHP5000 to buy ingredients such as flour, cooking oil, sugar and fruits. In the future, she plans to improve her business to increase their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, sugar and fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her treatment at hospital.

loans.name: Dubai Group

texts.en:
Victoria, who is in her early 30s is married with three children, two of them are still in school and one is still small. She has been running two projects, a retail shop and mamalishe for six years now.  She works from 6 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Victoria's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, paid back successful, to buy food cooking ingredients such as cooking oil, beans, meat, vegetables and rice together with adding missed items to her shop. She is really working hard to improve her life. With her efforts, Victoria managed to generate income which she used to buy a TV, a bed, a sofa set for her house and bought a plot of land where she expects in the future to build a house. She really enjoys Kiva's loan.
 
She will use this loan to increase the shop inventory and to restock the out of stock items in mamalishe. Victoria will share this loan with her group, Dubai, which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the shop inventory and to restock the out of stock items in mamalishe.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en: Abraham is a married man. He describes himself to be committed to work. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, flour, rice, salt, mandazi, and other items. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an area with loyal customers, and his primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, sugar, cooking fat, salt, and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He successfully repaid his previous loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, sugar, cooking fat, salt, and other items.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 59 years old and married with two children.

Carmelita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Carmelita has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is not new to the Fresh Life Toilets venture. He currently operates two facilities in his home area of Makongeni. As he says, the venture has been helpful to his family by complementing his income in providing for their basic needs. In addition, it has greatly impacted towards improved sanitation in his area; “There are no flying toilets in our neighborhood and particularly at my backyard,” Alexander beams.  

While his Fresh Life Toilet’s business is doing exceptionally well, he is concerned that he is losing potential customers owing to the large queues particularly during peak hours of morning and evening.

He has therefore resolved to establish an additional Fresh Life Toilet so as to serve his customers better. Having championed sanitation in Makongeni for over two years, his goal now is to scale up and inspire better sanitation among his community members. 

Let us join Alexander in acquiring one Fresh Life Toilet!

loans.use: to pay for one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Cleofas

texts.en:
Cleofas is 59 years old and has six children, with two children who are in school.

Cleofas is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Cleofas requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Cleofas has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cleofas would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Blandina

texts.en:
Blandina is 60 years old and married with six children.

Blandina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, rice, home product care and other groceries.

Blandina has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from buy and sell coconut wine.

Blandina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, rice, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
To earn a living, Asteria sells food (snacks) to the community of Tubigon, Bohol. She has been selling for ten years. Her husband is a carpenter and work hard for the future. They have four children who are already grown up.

She is asking a loan of PHP6000 to buy ingredients such as flour, fruits, sugar and cooking oil. In the future, Asteria dreams to have a better life. With that, she wants to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, fruits, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 21 and single. She runs a small business selling donuts, chicken roll, sausage roll, pie, drinks and more in her community and has been doing this for 2 years.

Christina has requested a loan to buy a bags of flour, baking soda, bags of chicken legs, vegetable oil, a fryer and a bag of onions.

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Christina will expand her business and support her family .

loans.use: to buy a  bags of flour,  baking soda, bags of chicken legs, vegetable oil, a fryer and a bag of onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock such as rice, snacks, cooking oil; coconut milk etc.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina  tiene la edad de 24 años, está casada    y vive con el esposo y dos hijos   actualmente. Ella con el  crédito lo quiere para la compra de una vaca de leche   .Ella espera poder obtener mas leche y queso para vender a los negocios y vecinos y engordar las crías  y venderlos con el peso ideal y  así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo. Es el segundo  préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado los préstamos con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Karina is 24 years old, married, and lives at present with her husband and their two children. She wishes to use the loan to buy a milk cow. Karina wants to obtain more milk and cheese to sell to businesses and neighbors, and to fatten calves to sell at the ideal weight and, thus, to bring in greater economic income. In the future, she wishes to offer her family a better quality of life, greater economic stability, and the possibility to continue growing.

This is her second loan obtained through FUDECOSUR. Karina has had no previous loans from state banks, but she will receive the best terms and the lowest available interest rate.

loans.use: buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus moved to Nairobi from Kisii three years ago in search of business opportunities. He settled in Mukuru Kwa Njenga where he has established a retail and grocery shop.

Recently he expanded his ventures by building four rental house units in the area. In the past, plot owners have established rental units with no available toilets.

Cyrus is determined to offer his tenants an accessible toilet facility and further champion Fresh Life’s work of ending open defecation within informal settlements.

He is seeking to acquire one Fresh Life toilet!

loans.use: to pay for one Fresh Life toilet.

loans.name: Jose Clementino

texts.es: Jose Arturo tiene la edad de 57 años, está casado  y vive con la esposa    actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de un novillo  pequeño  para su alimentación .El espera poder engordarlo y venderlo con el peso ideal y  así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Jose Arturo is 57 years old. He is married and lives with his wife. The loan he wants is to buy a small steer to feed. He hopes to be able to fatten it and sell it at the ideal weight so he can have more income. In the future, he hopes to offer his family a better quality of life and more financial stability, and to be able to keep growing. This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had other loans before  from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him more ease of payment and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy a steer.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Kasem

texts.en: Kasem is a 28-year-old single man who started installing air conditioners ten years ago to cover his needs and expenses. He learned this domain from his uncle. Kasem is a hard worker and ambitious man who is trying hard to develop his business, thus today he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy the necessary updated installation tools to help with his business and provide his customers with quick service. Kasem hopes to continue expanding his business to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy the necessary updated installation tools to help with his business.

loans.name: Bolivar

texts.es: Bolivar  tiene la edad de 56 años, está soltero   y vive solo  actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de unos cerdos pequeños y el concentrado para su alimentación. El espera poder engordarlos y venderlos con el peso ideal y  así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro tener una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo. Es el segundo  préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado los  préstamos con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Bolivar is 56 years old, single, and presently lives alone. He desires the loan to purchase some small pigs and the feed they will require. Bolivar hopes to fatten them and sell them at the ideal weight and, as a result, to receive a larger economic income.

In the future, he hopes to enjoy a better quality of life, greater economic stability, and to continue growing. 

This is Bolivar's second loan through FUDECOSUR. He has had no previous loan from state banks, but he is being offered loans with the best facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: purchase pigs to fatten and sell.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andres   tiene la edad de 29 años, está casado   y vive  con la esposa y dos hijos   actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de unos cerdos pequeños y el concentrado para su alimentación. El espera poder engordarlos y venderlos con el peso ideal y  así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle  una mejor calidad de vida  a su familia y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo. Es el primer   préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el  préstamos con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Andres is 29 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and two children. He wants the loan to buy some small pigs and concentrate to feed them with.  He hopes to fatten them and sell them at the ideal weight to have more income. IIn the future, he hopes to offer his family more financial stability a better quality of life, and to be able to keep growing. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him more ease of payment and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 40 years old and lives with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a grocery store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages to cover his household necessities from his own store. He speaks with an even tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his good behavior he has built up very good relations among his customers. Due to good relationships his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand.

Therefore Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so he can buy sacks of rice, sugar, flour, etc. She is very glad after taking this loan and is hopeful that he will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent his customers from being disappointed.

She is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, and assures that she will pay all due installments on time and with regularity.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar and flour for her husband's grocery store.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a mother of five children and lives in Nairobi’s Makongeni area. Together with her husband, they own and operate several matatu businesses as their source of livelihood. This year, they built ten rental units as part of their business expansion plan.

Anna came across the Fresh Life Toilets in the Makadara market and she was intrigued by the facility’s cleanliness. She has resolved to install one Fresh Life Toilet for her tenants' use. She anticipates that, while this venture is a niche against competitor plots with alternative toilet options, it will ensure her tenants have access to a hygienic and clean toilet, ultimately improving her housing business.

She also hopes to inspire her colleagues within the housing business to prioritize access to toilets for prospective tenants.

Let us help Anna acquire one Fresh Life Toilet!

loans.use: to pay for One Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is 44 years old, married and has two children. They live in Solana. She is raising hogs for income while her spouse is a farmer. Their profits go for school expenses. Her daughter Joyce Ann is a college student who is in need of funds to pay for school fees. Josefina is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to pay her child's tuition fee. She will be happy to see her children finish their education someday.

loans.use: to pay her child's tuition fee.

loans.name: Husniddin

texts.en: Husniddin is a generous man. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1988. He is living in a big busy city. He is single and lives with his parents. In 2010 he entered university and graduated in 2014 with excellence. While he was studying, at the same time he worked at organizations as a lawyer. In order to work on his self-development and become a specialist, he entered Russia-Tajik State University to get his master's degree. He studies at contractual basis education.  He appealed to IMON and Kiva to get a loan to pay his tuition fee. He awaits your compassion and support.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for his master's degree.

loans.name: Hà

texts.en:
Mrs Hà is 46 years old and she is married. She has had a retail business selling dry food and general thing for more than 10 years. She lives in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is that her latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan will change her life.
With her business profit, Hà hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is from Bohol, Philippines. She is married and has no school aged children. To earn a living, she is engaged in a sari-sari store business for a long time while her husband works in steel. They work hard for the future that they may be able to provide for themselves when they get old.

Carmelita is asking a loan to buy stocks for her sari-sari store, such as soft drinks, liquor, canned goods, spices, noodles, biscuits, chips and toiletries. In the future, she wants to improve her business to increase their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, drinking liquor, canned goods, spices, noodles, biscuits, chips and toiletries.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jennifer is 27 years old and has one child in school.

Jennifer has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jennifer requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jennifer has been in this business for four years. In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Juditha works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Juditha is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy a variety of vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetable business.

Juditha has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 33, a married woman with three children in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elizabeth has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 47 years old and married with six children. With three children in school, Lorena works very hard to provide for them.

Lorena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Lorena has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Lorena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
As a married parent, Fatima works hard to support her family.

She has an electronic load business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from bicycle transport. Fatima is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of electronic load to sell for her electronic load business.

Fatima has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of electronic load to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 39 years old with two children. With two children in school, Elvira works very hard to provide for them.

Elvira runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, candies, home product care, and other groceries.

Elvira has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Elvira would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, candies, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Christine Mae

texts.en:
Christine is a 28-year-old woman from Bohol, Philippines. She is married and has two children ages five and 10 months old. Her husband is a mechanic while she is engaged in sari-sari store business. She has been doing this business for three years.

She is asking a loan to buy assorted stocks such as canned goods, drinking liquor, canned goods, noodles, biscuits, chips, coffee, sugar, toiletries, powdered milk, juice and chocolate drinks. She also plans to use the money to repair their boat used in fishing to have other income. Christine wants to have sustainable earnings. With that, she aims to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, drinking liquor, canned goods, noodles, biscuits, chips, coffee, sugar, toiletries, powdered milk, juice and chocolate drinks and for boat repair.

loans.name: Alfonce

texts.en: Alfonce is a married man with four children. He describes himself as competent. He operates a food stall where he cooks food to sell. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock. He hopes that in the future he will have a stable business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Maribel es soltera, vive sola desde hace mucho tiempo en Cochabamba, se dedica a la venta de golosinas como ser caramelos, chiclets, galletas, refrescos, etc., es una persona de escasos recursos económicos con su pequeño negocio está terminando sus estudios como auxiliar de enfermería, la señora es una mujer muy trabajadora que por cuestiones de la vida y el muy bajo nivel económico de su familia ha tenido que saber salir adelante en la vida sola, también ayudando en cierta forma a sus otros hermanos, se ha dado tiempo para poder trabajar y estudiar al mismo tiempo ya que realizar las dos actividades es muy difícil pero su propósito de auto superación ha sido más fuerte y está pudiendo obtener un título que le permita defenderse en la vida y poder adquirir un poco más de ingresos y así poder mejorar su nivel de vida en la sociedad actual que cada día es más difícil.
es por ello que requiere un préstamo para ampliar su negocio y poder de esta manera obtener mas ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maribel is single, and has lived alone for a long time in Cochabamba. She works selling sweets such as caramels, gum, cookies, soft drinks, etc. She is a person of limited resources with a small business. She is finishing her education as a nursing assistant. She is a very hard-working woman who, because of issues in her life and her family's very low economic level, has had to know how to get ahead in life alone. She is also helping, in some way, her other siblings. She has given herself time to be able to work and study at the same time since to do the two activities is very difficult, but her goal of improving herself has been very strong and she is being able to get a degree that will allow her to support herself in life and be able to get a little more income and, in this way, improve her standard of living in today's society, which is becoming more difficult.

For this, she needs a loan to expand her business and be able to, in this way, get more income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to expand her merchandise and have better sales and generate income that can help for her education.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 31 years old and has six children.

Analiza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, condiments, and other groceries.

Analiza has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Analiza aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, condiments, and other groceries

loans.name: Helconida

texts.en:
Helconida is 62 years old and married with three children.

Helconida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, junk foods, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Helconida has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from an electronic repair shop.

Helconida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, junk foods, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 46 years old and has five children who are in school.

Marites has a peanut vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marites has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Emily Jinky

texts.en:
Emily Jinky is 31 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Emily Jinky works very hard to provide for them.

Emily Jinky runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, personal product care, and other groceries.

Emily Jinky has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Emily Jinky would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bicycle, thermoflast box, umbrella and ice cream for her husband's ice cream distributing business.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a 52 years old married woman with 3 children. She sells fish in her community to earn a living. She has more than 10 years of experience with this business.

Paulina needs a loan to buy a fishing net, a spear, goggles and a fishing boat. She plans to use her profits to support her family financially and to save for unexpected emergencies. Paulina has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, a spear, goggles and a fishing boat.

loans.name: Xenia

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 40 anos de idade vive maritalmente, mãe de 5 filhos, apenas 1 é maior de idade, todos frequentam a escola e não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2014. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: portas, janelas e tijoleiras, para terminar a sua obra de residência.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra e garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior. O seu maior desafio é adquirir uma viatura.
texts.en:
She was born in Namaacha, Maputo province. She is 40 years old and is married. She is the mother of five children. Only one of them is an adult; they are all in school. She is not responsible for anyone else.

She started to work with Hluvuku in 2014. This is her second loan, and she is planning to purchase construction materials, such as doors, windows, and tiles to finish building her house.

In the future, she plans to finish the construction works and guarantee her children’s higher education. Her biggest challenge is to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy doors, windows and tiles to finish building her house.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en: Saturnina is a 51-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. Her husband is a farmer while Saturnina makes crab traps locally known as "panggal". The primary material used in making panggal is bamboo. She is asking a loan of PHP12000 to buy more bamboos that she can use to make more panggals. Saturnina's income will pay for the school fees of her children ages 12, 15, 16 and 18. It is her goal to see her children graduate from school and live better lives.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo for making crab traps.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a sari-sari store owner. She is a 40-year-old woman from Bohol, Philippines. She is married and has four school aged children ages 19, 17, 13 and 10 years old. She has been doing a sari-sari store business for 15 years. Aside from this business, she also engaged in buying and selling scrap materials.

Elizabeth is asking a loan of PHP7000 to buy stocks for her sari-sari store like soft drinks and liquor. She also buys more scrap to sell. In the future, she wants to upturn their livelihood by working hard to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, drinking liquor and scrap.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah, aged 46 years, supports five children. She is a small scale farmer earning an income of KES 10,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya of KES 25,000 to buy a cow to boost her farming activity as well as meeting family demands for milk.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and educate her children. She hopes to improve her family living standards.

loans.use: to buy a cow to boost her farming activity as well as meeting family demands for milk.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married, the mother of nine children, and describes herself as committed to her work. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes, and has been in this line of work for fifteen years. Most of her customers are locals, and her biggest business challenge is the weather, especially rain. She will use this Kes 25,000 loan to buy more clothing to sell, and hopes that in the future she will be able to open a modern boutique. This is her second loan from SMEP Microfinance bank; she successfully repaid her previous one.

loans.use: buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El señor de 40 años de edad, trabaja actualmente como taxista en la población de Monteagudo, tiene su esposa la cual trabaja como enfermera en la ciudad de Monteagudo y tienen dos hijos que depende de ellos de las cuales el uno está en el nivel secundario y el otro en el nivel primario, vive actualmente en domicilio alquilado, vive en el departamento de Chuquisaca municipio Monteagudo. El solicitante tiene su madre que actualmente se encuentra mal de salud, es por eso que requiere el préstamo que será destinado para la operación, agostos médicos, clínicos y demás gastos que tendrá en dicha operación, asimismo la madre del solicitante se someterá a la operación y la cual tendrá una mejor salud, condición de vida en su diario vivir y volverá de nuevo a su casa a seguir con sus actividades diarias con su familia
texts.en: This 40-year-old man, works currently as a taxi driver in the town of Monteagudo. He has a wife who works as a nurse in the city of Monteagudo and they have two children who depend on them, of whom one is at the secondary school level and the other is at the primary level. He currently lives in a rented home, and lives in Chuquisaca department, Monteagudo municipality. The applicant's mother currently is in bad health, and for this he needs the loan which will be destined for the operation, medical and clinic expenses, and other expenses that she will have from this operation. Also, the mother of the applicant will have the operation and will have better health, better living conditions in her daily life, and will return to her home to continue with her daily activities with her family.

loans.use: to pay for the operation, medical and clinic expenses, and his mother's other expenses to reestablish her life.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es: La señora Demetria, del departamento de Cochabamba de la provincia Arani es concubina con el señor Celestino, la señora es una mujer muy humilde, trabajadora y responsable que se vinieron a trabajar desde muy joven a radicar al trópico de Cochabamba junto a su esposo en busca de nuevas oportunidades de trabajo y una vida mejor. trabajando duro y fuerte en la cosecha y mantenimiento de producción se compraron un lote agrícola en el sindicato Mirabel en donde actualmente trabajan con la producción de piña, yuca en donde tiene planeado ampliar mas la plantación de piña por el cual necesita un préstamo, donde también se compraron un lote urbano en donde construyeron su casa de madera de dos cuartos, en donde viven sus hijos para asistir a sus clases porque en el sindicato mirabel no hay colegio, de esta manera ella considera que podrá generar mejores ingresos y por ende podrá otorgar una vida mejor a su familia.
texts.en: Demetria, from Cochabamba department in Arani province is partnered with Celestino. She is a very humble, hard-working and responsible person who came to work when she was very young from the tropics of Cochabamba with her husband, seeking new work opportunities and a better life. Working hard and strong in the crops and maintaining the production, they purchased an agricultural plot in the Mirabel syndicate, where they currently work with pineapple and yucca production, where they have planned to expand the pineapple plantation, for which they need a loan. There, they have also purchased an urban lot where they built their wooden house with two rooms, where their children live to go to school because in the syndicate of Mirabel, there is no secondary school. In this way, she considers that she will be ale to generate more income and, in the end, will be able to offer her family a better life.

loans.use: to expand her pineapple and yucca production on her land, so to generate more income for her family.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 61 years old and married with eight children.

Rosalina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like home product care, junk foods, condiments and other groceries.

Rosalina has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Rosalina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like home product care, junk foods, condiments and other groceries.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 57 years old and has four children. Jocelyn is married and has two children who are presently in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jocelyn has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 53 years old and married with seven children. With three children in school, Corazon works very hard to provide for them.

Corazon runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, biscuits, personal product care, and other groceries.

Corazon has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, biscuits, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is 54 years old and married with six children.

Ma. Teresa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, personal product care, canned goods and other groceries.

Ma. Teresa has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 12 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ma. Teresa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, personal product care, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 31 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Mylene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like milk, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Mylene has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Mylene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like milk, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ma. Cecilia works hard to support her family.

She has a business making sidecars in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling spare parts. Ma. Cecilia is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for her business.

Ma. Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her business

loans.name: Zohra's Group

texts.en:
Zohra is a 45-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore. Her husband is a wholesaler of onions; he buys the onions from harvesters at a low price and sells in Lahore city to the market vendors and retailers. He has been doing the same practice for many years and has many reputed retailers who like to buy onions from him in large quantities. During this tenure he has built up positive relationships among the retailers and his customers have become the cause of his advertisement as well.

With the increment in new customers and demand he wants to buy onions in bulk, so that he can easily cope with the rapid increase in demand. In this way he would be able to increase his monthly income, savings and can cherish his children in good ways.

Zohra praises her honorable supporters; she thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy onions in bulk for her husband's wholesaling business.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 30 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Mylene is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Mylene has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mylene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Mohammad Ali

texts.en:
Mohammad Ali is 22 years old and single.   Four years ago he opened a grocery shop to cover his needs and expenses. He is independent and he took on his responsibilities from an early age. 

Mohammad Ali is ambitious.  He is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop his business.  Thus today he acquired a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase and diversify his merchandise with new items and thereby satisfy his customers.
 
Mohmmad Ali hopes to expand his small grocery shop to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to diversify his merchandise with new items and products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy frying pans, glasses, plates, containers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
El socio  Reynaldo pertenece al banco comunal AMAUTA.
El socio es casado y tiene hijos, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando como profesor en la ciudad de Cusco, él socio lleva buen tiempo ejerciendo su profesión el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante  a su familia.
El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar  una laptop.
 El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Member Reynaldo belongs to the communal bank AMAUTA.

He is married and has children. He spends some of his time working as a professor in the city of Cusco. The member has spent much time practicing this profession, which has been going well thanks to the determination which he gives to his profession daily. He is a responsible and persevering person, which has helped him provide for his family.

The member needs the loan to buy a laptop.

He is grateful for the opportunity given through this means, and he likewise commits to fulfill the payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy, aged 35 years, supports two children. She has been a small scale farmer for the last 10 years, earning an income of KES 10,000 per month. She has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya of KES 25,000 to buy farm inputs such as certified fertilizers for top dressing her crops to increase productivity. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and expand her farming activity. She hopes to buy a dairy cow to meet family demands for milk.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as certified fertilizers for top dressing her crops to increase productivity.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as dedicated. She operates a retail business where she sells beans, sorghum, sugar, bread, flour, rice, salt, mandazi (Swahili Buns) and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are locals.
Irene will use the 60,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of cereal, bread, sugar, cooking fat, salt and other items. Her business goal is to be the largest supplier of cereals to neighboring institutions within five years. Irene hopes that in the future she will own a big cereal store. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of cereal, bread, sugar, cooking fat, salt and other items.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 50 years old and has four children. She is married and two children are still in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 10 years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge  tiene la edad  de 60 años, está casado , vive con la esposa . Con su crédito pretende comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jorge is 60 years old, married, and lives with his wife.

With his loan, he hopes to buy some seedlings to re-sow at the beginning of rainy season. With this, the objective is to increase the density of plants per area. By bettering these crops, he hopes to obtain some earnings and, by doing so, better living conditions as well as reach some goals.

It is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not previously been given other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him a loan with great facility and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and coffee supplies.

loans.name: Tehmine

texts.en:
Tehmine is 35 years old and she lives in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region. Tehmine is married and she has two pretty daughters. She has a vocational education but she never worked anywhere since she always has been engaged in farming. On her farm she has cows, a heifer, a calf, piglets, sheep and chickens. With the help of her beloved husband, Tehmine sells her farm products such as milk, meat, macun (national-dairy product), cheese and eggs.

Tehmine mentions that despite the difficulty and a lot of work on her farm she likes it and she does it with pleasure. Her daughters also help her on the farm, working after their school especially in agricultural work (on her land she cultivates potatoes, greens and cabbage). Temine now has a lot of demand for her farm meat but she has little of it. She is asking for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams for the purchase of a heifer, a pig and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a heifer, a pig and also fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.en:
Rachelle is 22 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rachelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, charcoal, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Rachelle has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Rachelle would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, charcoal, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Siridisai Group

texts.en:
Siridisai Group was started in the year 2015 at Rekhapur village of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. There are 11 active self-dependent women, with the objective of developing their existing business as well as their livelihood. All the members of concerned group have their own professions and businesses.

Basanti is one of them who has taken a great role in her development and their group members’ source of revenue improvement. She is standing at the extreme left with multi color saree in the photo. She is about 29 years old and living with her family, her husband and one son and two daughters. All the children are going to school.

Basanti has been engaged with vegetable cultivation and selling for the last nine years. Her husband is also helping with cultivation and marketing. Through the concerned business, she earns a monthly income of 8,000 INR.

Her opinion is that from this small income it is very difficult to maintain her family. After that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible. In current market situation, the competition is also very high. Another big investment is necessary for the expansion of business. Fund scarcity is the main concern. So Basanti formed a group for strengthening social relations and to avail loan for the expansion of her business.

Basanti planned to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc., for the vegetable cultivation, as well as potatoes, onions, garlic, zinger, cauliflower, carrots, radishes, apples, bananas, etc., for the vegetable and fruits business. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for re-construction of her house and wishes to send her children to a better school for education.

The other ten members of the group are also smart at their professions and also actively engaged with differ professions like a goatery, a fishery, a shoe business, animal trading, a paddy business, vegetable vending, and a grocery shop.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc., for the vegetable cultivation, as well as potatoes, onions, garlic, zinger, cauliflower, carrots, radishes, apples, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier tiene la edad de 38 años, está casado  y vive con la esposa y cuatro  hijos actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de almacigo e insumos y dar asistencia a una plantación de café. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Javier is curently 38 years old, married, and lives with his wife and four children.

He wants this loan to buy seedlings and supplies and to help a coffee farm.

He wants to give proper maintenance to the crop, which would allow him to have an increased production and, therefore, to have a greater economic income. In the future, he hopes to give his family a better standard of living and better economic stability, and to continue to grow as a person and producer.

It is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not been previously given any loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him the loan with great facility and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy coffee supplies.

loans.name: Om Sai Ram Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Sabitree is a 46-year-old mother with one son in her care. She is mother and head of the household as her husband died some time ago. She has been able to support her family thanks to the fact that she works in various occupations. She hails from a small village of cuttack district.

She, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to restart her own business, a small chicken farm; she will raise the chickens, feed them, and subsequently sell them.

She essentially took the initiative because of her son, as she wants to enjoy a better life with him; she wants him to study and have a reason to smile everyday and never make him suffer from his father's absence.

Support this business owner, who wants to show that the role of mother and father isn't too much for her; she just needs your vote of confidence.

loans.use: to restart a small chicken farm

loans.name: Om Sai Ram Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Sumitra, 41, standing to the middle in a yellow saree, is the featured borrower of Om Sai Ram SHG-C. She hails from a small village of Cuttack district. She studied up to the fifth grade but did not continue studying due to low economic resources. She is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure her family a good lifestyle.

Therefore, she, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR. Sumitra will use her portion of the loan to build a toilet in her home, which she is lacking due to inadequate funds.

The loan will help her in promoting health and hygiene in her home as well as in her community. She is awaiting for your kind help to fulfill her basic need.

loans.use: to build a toilet

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 56 years old, married, and living with her four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, so as to benefit from the trainings, especially in enterprise development.

Grace practices mixed farming. She grows maize, beans, potatoes, and vegetables and she keeps poultry. She also sells vegetables at the market, so as to supplement her income.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more vegetables to sell and to buy fertilizer to boost farming production. With increased income, she will be able to buy better clothes and food for her family.

Grace is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell and fertilizer to boost farming production.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 36 years old.  She is married and the mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from its training, especially in enterprise development.

Ruth farms maize, beans and vegetables.  She operates a green grocer store, and she also sells milk, which she buys from local dairy farmers. 

She is asking a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and manure to increase her vegetable output.  She hopes that this will enable her meet customers' demand  and increase her income. With greater income, she will be able to provide better food and pay school fees for her children. 

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and manure and increase her production of vegetables.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 36 years old.  She is married and the mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from its training, especially in enterprise development.

Irene plants maize, beans, potatoes, and vegetables. She also sells vegetables at the market.  

She is asking for a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to boost her farming production. She hopes that this will help her meet her customers' demand  and hence increase her income so she can pay tuition fees for her children. 

She intends to use the profits to start poultry farming.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to boost her farming production.

loans.name: Karl

texts.en:
Karl started his business because he saw a need demanded by other businesses in his community. He opened Affordable Professional Business Services in 2014. Through his business he is able to provide businesses with affordable taxation, legal, and accounting services.

Karl has worked in the automotive community for the past nine years and has successfully served more than 500 + businesses. His biggest challenge has been the inability to grow his own business due to a limited amount of funds.

Karl is currently seeking a loan to create a budget for marketing. His vision for the future is to continue establishing his business as a reputable one and expand his services to businesses in other boroughs.

loans.use: to create a budget for marketing

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en:
Annastacia is 43 years old. She is married and has four children. 

She grows cabbages, cow peas, tomatoes, and mangoes and then sells her produce to her customers . She has been farming for past 18 years and the business earns her an income of KES 10,000 a month. 

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds. 


She will use the profit from her business to educate her children and increase her savings account. Her hopes and dreams are to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Om Sai Ram Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Premalata, 36, standing to the right side in the photograph, is a humble and respectful person in her community where she works in agriculture. With this, she is able to get her family ahead to where she is able to cover educational expenses for her children, just like any mother who would want the best for her family. She is a divorcee and is always concerned for her children's well being.

She has three children dependent on her income. She lives in a rural community very far away from the urban area. Premalata works in agriculture because it is the only thing she learned from her parents.

Last year she suffered a reduction in income due to low prices which affected agricultural products and also because of the rain which caused her to lose her potato production. She lost half of her potato harvest. The entire community suffered these damages.

For these reasons, her economic stability has suffered an imbalance, affecting directly the acquisition of agricultural supplies that are required for farming and to feed her children.

Premalata, along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy potato seeds and agricultural supplies to improve her economic well-being and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and agricultural supplies to improve her economic well-being and quality of life.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is 28 years old. She is married and has been blessed with two school going children. She grows passion fruit, maize, beans and watermelons. She has been farming for the last six years and the business is doing well.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds.


She will use the profit from her business to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La señora tiene 33 años de edad y vive en la zona sud de la ciudad, ella es de profesión abogada y trabaja a comisión realizando tramites y gestiones en un buffete, ayuda a sus padres para solventar los gastos muy costosos de un transplante  que le realizaron a la hermana de 17 años de edad hace año y medio y desde entonces tiene que hacerse controles rigurosos periódicos en otro país y viaja al mismo tal cual está indicando en el informe médico del hospital al que asiste para el tratamiento post operatorio.  Es por ello que requiere un préstamo para pagar los gastos de salud, porque la familia, solo con los ingresos de cada uno de los miembros no puede cubrir el tratamiento recomendado y con la periodicidad que establece un buen seguimiento para el restablecimiento de la hermana que es la paciente que poco a poco va mejorando y tiene la esperanza de retomar una vida más normal para una joven de la edad de ella.
texts.en:
This woman is 33 years old, lives in the south part of the town, and is a lawyer by profession. She works on commission in a legal practice doing paperwork and administration. She helps her parents cover the costs of a costly transplant that her 17-year old sister underwent a year and a half ago. Since then her sister has had to travel overseas periodically for intense post-operative treatment as indicated in the medical report of the hospital where the operation took place.

For this reason the woman requires a loan to pay for health costs as her family, even with contributions from every family member, cannot afford to pay for the treatment and regularity recommended if her sister hopes to gradually return to the normal life of a person as young as she is.

loans.use: pay for her sister's treatments after delicate and costly surgery so that her life can return to normal.

loans.name: Ofik

texts.en:
This nice lady is 25 years old, and she lives with her beloved husband (they are just married) and mother-in-law in Lchashen village of Gegharkunik region. 

With her mother-in-law, Ofik is engaged in farming and agriculture. In the farm she has cows, sheep, and chickens. 

Though still young, Ofik makes very tasty macun (a national dairy-product), cheese and curd from her farm milk.  She sells all that with her farm’s milk and meat. 

Ofik is also skilled in potato cultivation, and she sells her potatoes to a re-seller right from her farm.She also has a sweet harvest of strawberries in her garden. 

Ofik’s husband says he is pleased and proud of his young wife, who manages farming so skillfully and overcomes any hardships. Shealso thinks of increasing her number of farm cattle.

Ofik asks for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams to buy several more sheep and also fodder for all her cattle.

loans.use: to buy several more sheep and also fodder for all cattle

loans.name: Shodikhuja

texts.en:
Shodikhuja, age 39, is a kind-hearted man from the Shahrinav district of Tajikistan. He is married and the father of three children. His wife works in agriculture. Shodikhuja has already been working as a professional taxi driver for a few years. Since he is an experienced driver his services are in high demand and he is well respected by all.
Shodikhuja's job constitutes the family's main source of income, but his car broke down recently and needs to be repaired. Since Shodikhuja doesn't have enough money for this, he is taking a loan, hoping that you will be able to help him.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Tenghory Transgambienne Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 08 mai 2001. Ce groupe est constitué de femmes dynamiques qui évoluent dans le commerce. Madame Awa qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 30 ans et mère de quatre enfants dont deux filles. Elle s'active dans la vente de boutique villageois depuis plus de cinq années. Elle envisage avec le prêt sollicité renforcer sa boutique en marchandise. C'est la seul boutique dans le coin. les bénéfices vont servir à aider son mari dans les besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
The banc villageois was founded on May 8, 2001. This group is made up of dynamic women who are developing their business skills.

Mrs. Awa, who is at right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is married, 30 years old, and the mother of four children, two of whom are girls. Mrs. Awa has been involved in sales in a village boutique for more than five years. With the loan she is seeking, she plans to increase the boutique's merchandise. It's the only boutique in the area. The profits will go toward helping Mrs. Awa's husband with the family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to supply her boutique.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en:
Bonface is one of Kiambiu’s budding entrepreneurs. He owns a famous pork butchery along with a posho mill (maize milling) business in the Kosovo area. He is also one of the community’s leaders where he works with the chief towards improving security in Kiambiu.

Bonface heard about the Fresh Life toilets for the first time during his visit to the chief’s office. In Kosovo, there are no toilets, the community makes do with makeshift facilities and polythene bags disposed of along pathways. As this is unhygienic and exposes young children to hygienic related diseases, Bonface has resolved to join the Fresh Life movement by establishing one Fresh Life toilet in Kosovo.

With the access to a toilet facility, Bonface anticipates a reduction in flying toilets in his neighborhood and ultimately a cleaner, more hygienic, and safer environment for the children of Kosovo. In addition, by having a facility’s caretaker, a job opportunity will be created for the youth in his area.

Let us support Bonface in his quest to acquire one Fresh Life toilet!

loans.use: to pay for one Fresh Life toilet.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora  Eugenia,  tiene 40 años de edad, tiene 5  hijos que viven junto a ella y su esposo. Ella, no pudo acceder a una educación primaria por estar en una zona alejada y por falta de recursos por tal razón se ve comprometida y vive en una humilde casa en una zona poblada que construyeron con esfuerzo para brindar una vida saludable y educación a sus hijos, la actividad económica  a la que se dedica toda la familia es la agricultura en la producción de papa y cereales como el trigo y el maíz.
La señora Eugenia es una persona muy responsable y muy querida en el lugar donde vive y trabaja, la comunidad donde trabaja es de clima frígido- templado y el aporte que realiza con sus cosechas aporta a la seguridad alimentaria en la región.
En esta oportunidad la señora Eugenia acude a un préstamo  para la compra de semovientes (bueyes) para trabajar en con la yunta en el preparado de sus terrenos y seguir fortaleciendo la producción agrícola.
texts.en:
Sra. Eugenia is 40 years old and has five children who live with her and her husband. She could not attend primary school as it was in a distant location and because her parents were poor. For this reason she sees herself as living in difficult circumstances. Her home is a simple one, built with much effort in a busy part of town by the family so as to provide a safe life and education for the children. The whole family works in agriculture growing potatoes and cereal crops such as wheat and corn.

Eugenia is a very responsible person, much loved in the community where she lives and works. The climate is cool-temperate, and her harvests help provide food security in the region.

At this time Eugenia is asking for a loan to buy Bulls to yoke together so they can plough her land and continue strengthening production.

loans.use: Buy bulls to work her land and generate more income

loans.name: Dagath Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe de 42 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 01 Juillet 2011. Il regroupe des femmes du même village qui s'activent dans le commerce et l'embouche. Elles entretiennent de bonnes relations. Déguène debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 45ans. Elle est mariée et mère 2 garçons et 3 filles. Avec le prêt reçu, elle envisage d'acheter des arachides et des sachets pour glace. Elle compte acheter 100Kg d'arachide à 165 FCFA le Kg et des sachets. Elle achète aussi des gâteaux dans une boulangerie à 10 km de son village et vient revendre sur la route aux passagers.c'est une activités qu'elle maîtrise bien et a plus de 5ans d'expérience. Avec les bénéfices elle va prendre en charge les besoins de ses enfants car ils sont jeunes
texts.en:
This 42 member group is a part of the village bank that was created on July 1, 2011. It brings together women from the same village who work in sales and raising livestock. They have a good relationship. Déguène, standing on the right side of the photo with her hand raised, is 45 years old. She is married and the mother of two boys and three girls. 

With this loan, she wishes to buy peanuts and bags for ice. She intends to purchase 100 kilograms of peanuts at 165 francs per kilogram and some bags. She will also purchase cakes at a bakery 10 kilometers from the village to resell along the road to travelers. She manages her business well and has more than five years of experience. With the profits she will be able to take care of her young children's needs.

loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a Kiva borrower. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, flour, bread, salt, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

Jackson will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of flour, sugar, bread, salt and other items. His business goal is to have a larger shop within five years. Jackson will use the anticipated profits to improve his life.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of flour, sugar, bread, salt and other items.

loans.name: Om Sai Ram Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Seema, 27, standing to the extreme right in the photograph, is the featured borrower of Om Sai Ram SHG-D. She hails from a small village in the Cuttack district. Seema is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She owns a sewing workshop where she processes the customer's order and delivers it within the due course of time. Unfortunately, she does not have toilet facilities in her home and depends upon her backyard for urination and defecation, which is very unhygienic.

Therefore, Seema, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR in order to build a new toilet and incorporate water pipes in order to facilitate water supply so that she can maintain an hygienic atmosphere and ultimately safeguard the health of her family.

Seema aspires to build a bright future by providing the best education to her only daughter.

loans.use: to build a new toilet and incorporate water pipes

loans.name: Araujo

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Morrombene Província de Inhambane tem 37 anos de idade casado oficialmente pai de 3 filhos menores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua mãe que se encontram em Inhambane enviando lhes dinheiro mensalmente.
É negociante e proprietário de um estabelecimento comercial onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com o valor solicitado pretende ampliar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo produtos como bolos, ovos, óleo para incrementar no seu negócio. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
texts.en:
This borrower was born in Morrombene in the Province of Inhambane. He is 37 years old and married. He is officially a father of three young children, all of whom are in school. He is responsible for his mother, who is in Inhambane, sending money on a monthly basis.

He is a businessman and owner of a commercial establishment, earning an income which he applies to the household expenses. With this loan amount, he plans to increase the volume of his business by buying products such as cakes, eggs, and oil to expand the business. This is his second loan with Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy cakes, eggs, and oil to expand his business.

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is 51 years old, married and has got two sons and daughters, only the girls are at school. For eight years now, he has been supporting his family with an electrical goods business. He works from 8 AM to 6 PM every working day and is able to make a good profit each month.

This is his fourth credit request from Kiva's partner Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous three loans, paid in full, to improve his shop with additional electrical goods. He is always thinking of how to make his shop bigger, being able to sells more quantities within the same business.

With this new credit request Mohamed will buy items for his shop to resell. He will share this loan with his fellow member from Trust Group. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy items for his shop to resell.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as honest. Michael operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, flour, rice, salt, mandazi (Swahili Buns) and other items. He also runs an M-Pesa (mobile money transfer) business. Michael has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a favorable area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

Michael will use the 90,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of bread, sugar, flour, cooking fat, salt and other items. His business goal is to have more stock and have a flourishing business within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be able to provide stability for his family. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. Michael will use the anticipated profits to buy land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bread, sugar, flour, cooking fat, salt and other items.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 35-year-old lady living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She wants to save so that she can provide better living facilities to her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving a moto rickshaw for several years but his income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the motorbike and the rickshaw’s body, but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to fix the problem. 

Therefore, Nazia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband will be able to buy a moto rickshaw body. She hopes that she will be able to save enough to meet the sudden needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a moto rickshaw body for her husband's moto rickshaw.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 45-year-old married woman with six children; one child is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur with a scrap "buy and sell" business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more scrap materials to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials to sell

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 47 years old and married with two children. Aileen works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, junk food, home care products, and other groceries.

Aileen has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Aileen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, junk food, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
Nasceu em morrumbene província de Inhambane tem 38 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 5 filhos menores de idade, apenas 4 frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Começou a trabalhar com a hluvuku em 2011. Este é o seu 8º empréstimo com o qual pretende adquirir mercadoria como: antenas para televisores, ferro de engomar, chaleiras e mais para satisfazer as necessidades dos seus clientes.
Futuramente pretende expandir mais nos seus serviços prestados de montagem e reparação de antenas. O seu maior desafio é garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
This borrower was born in Morrumbene in the Province of Inhambane. He is 38 years old and is a married father of five young children, four of whom are in school. He is not responsible for anyone else.

He started to work with Hluvuku in 2011. This is his eighth loan, which he plans to use to acquire merchandise such as television antennae, irons, kettles, and more items to satisfy his clients' needs.

In the future, he plans to further expand his services of installing and repairing antennae. His greatest challenge is guaranteeing his children's education up to the tertiary level.

loans.use: to buy television antennae, irons, kettles and more to satisfy his clients' needs.

loans.name: Baba Dabaleswora Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Basanti is a 51-year-old elderly lady standing to the extreme left in the photo. She hails from a remote village in Cuttack district. She has a son, daughter-in-law, and husband who works at the primary school and gets a fixed salary. Basanti is a farmer and is engaged in betel leaf cultivation. She gets a small income that is hardly enough to meet even the basic needs of her family. Due to the lack of funds, she was never able to build a toilet for her family and faced a lot of difficulties for the same due to her old age.

Basanti, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a new toilet and attach the necessary sanitary fittings to it.

She aspires to have a happy and healthy life with her family the rest of her life.

loans.use: to build a new toilet and attach necessary sanitary fittings to it.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 48-year-old lady. She is married and has three children. She operates a green grocery, selling mostly mangoes, tomatoes, and potatoes.

She has been in the business for the last two years. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use the loan to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale.

She will use the profit from her business to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable business and to provide her children with a complete education.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Alhamisi

texts.en:
Alhamisi is a married man. He has seven children. He describes himself as intelligent.

Alhamisi operates a farm where he grows bananas and other crops. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a fertile place and his primary customers are locals. He says that his biggest business challenge is floods. He will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy farm inputs.

This is Alhamisi's fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a female Kiva borrower. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. Lilian will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of clothing. Her business goal is to have a large business within five years. Lilian will use the anticipated profits to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
This is Erick, a student at Kisumu Polytechnic. He loves reading and hopes to become an engineer one day. He dreams of owning his own company, providing employment, and supporting his family members and parents financially.

He is a final year student and he has been struggling financially. With a Kiva loan, he shall be able to clear his school tuition fees and study peacefully to pass his exams.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Clementina

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 42 anos de idade, solteira mãe de 3 filhos menores de idade apenas 2 é que frequenta escola e não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
É avicultora a mais de 7 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Solicita o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku para aumentar o volume do seu negócio de criação de frangos adquirindo produtos tais como: pintos, ração e vitaminas. 
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência e aumentar mais pavilhões para a criação de frangos.
texts.en:
This borrower was born in Namaacha in the Province of Maputo. She is 42 years old. She is a single mother of three young children, two of whom are going to school. She is not responsible for anyone else.
