She has been a poultry farmer for more than seven years, earning an income which she applies to the household expenses. She is applying for her fourth loan from Hluvuku to increase the volume of her business raising chickens. She will buy products such as chicks, feed, and vitamins.

In the future, she plans to finish construction work on her home and expand with more pavilions to raise chickens.

loans.use: to buy chicks, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Edinah

texts.en:
Edinah is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as generous.

Edinah operates a posho mill (a mill that grinds maize into flour). Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water storage facility to store water for domestic use.

This is Edinah's fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water storage facility

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as industrious. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, salt, rice, flour, cooking fat and other items.

She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is competition from other businesses. 

This is Monicah's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy more flour, sugar, bread, salt and other items to sell.

Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future she will open a hotel.

loans.use: buy more flour, sugar, bread, salt and other items to sell

loans.name: Ginky

texts.en:
Ginky is 30 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Ginky is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ginky requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Ginky has been in this business for eight years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ginky would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Ermelita

texts.en:
Ermelita is 49 years old and has four children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ermelita requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Ermelita has been in this business for 10 years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ermelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es: La señora Narcisa y su esposo José, viven en Cochabamba provincia chapare;  tienen 44 y 45 años de edad, económicamente son independiente, ambos se dedican a la actividad de agricultura siembran papa, Locoto y Zapallo. En una superficie de 4 hectáreas. Para la venta de sus productos cuenta con un mercado consolidado la feria semanal de Colomi, La señora requiere un préstamo para la compra de abono orgánico y Productos agro químicos ya que sus ahorros lo invirtieron en la compra de terreno agrícola.                                                                                                                                                                       Por último, la señora Narcisa y su esposo se sintieron con la esperanza de acceder al préstamo,  porque con la compra de abono orgánico y productos agroquímicos va tener mejores ingresos e incrementará su patrimonio familiar y de esa manera podrá mejorar su nivel de vida en beneficio de su familia hacia futuro.
texts.en:
Narcisa and her husband José live in Cochabamba, in Chapare province. They are 44 and 45 years old respectively. They are financially independent and both farm, growing potatoes, peppers and and squash on a 4 hectare parcel of land.

As a place to sell their crop she has as an established market the weekly fair in Colomi. She needs a loan to purchase organic fertilizer and agrochemical products, as they have invested their savings in the purchase of farmland.

Lastly, Narcisa and her husband were pleased to have the hope of accessing the loan, because with the purchase of organic fertilizer and agrochemical products, she is going to have better income, and will increase her family's assets, and that way will be able to improve their standard of living, and benefit their family going forward.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and agrochemical products for expanding her agricultural production and to have better income for her family.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as intelligent. He operates a retail business where he sells cereal, flour, sugar, bread, soap and other items. Emmanuel has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transport.

Emmanuel will use the 95,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of cereal, flour, sugar, bread and other items. He will use the anticipated profits to provide for family expenses. Emmanuel also farms.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of cereal, flour, sugar, bread and other items.

loans.name: Chepkoskei

texts.en: Chepkoskei is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, soda, and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more inventory of flour, sugar, bread, and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of flour, sugar, bread, and other items.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is a married man with one child. He describes himself as intelligent. He operates a motorcycle transport business and has been involved in this business for five years.

His business is located in a good place and his primary customers are locals. He says that his biggest business challenge is the rain season, which affects his business.

This is Wilfred's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the KES 20,000 to service and maintain his motorcycle.

His business goal is to own a tuk tuk for transport within five years. He hopes that in the future he will have a wonderful family.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Jocelino

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha província de Maputo tem 27 anos de idade, solteiro, responsabiliza-se pela sua irmã e sobrinha que vivem em sua casa.
Este é o seu 1º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: chapas de zinco, barrotes, pranchas e barrotes para fazer cobertura da sua casa obra de residência.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra e adquirir uma viatura. O seu maior desafio é dar continuidade com os seus estudos.
texts.en:
This borrower was born in Namaancha in the province of Maputo. He is 27 years old and single. He is responsible for his sister and his niece, who live in his home.

This is his first loan with Hluvuku, which he plans to use to buy construction materials such as metal sheets, beams, and boards to cover his home.

In the future, he plans to finish construction and acquire a vehicle. His greatest challenge is continuing with his studies.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, beams, and boards to cover his home.

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey if from the city of Kapan in the Syunik region of Armenia. He ended his third Kiva loan and he is thankful and happy for his successful partnerships. This time, he hopes for continued support and patiently awaits to realize his plan connected with his fourth Kiva loan.

Sergey is married and he has two daughters. Last year, his eldest daughter got married. With the help of a Kiva loan, Sergey organized a very nice wedding party. His youngest daughter is still a student. Sergey’s wife is unemployed. Being the only bread-winner in his family, Sergey does his best and works until late at night (he uses his own car for taxi services).

Soon, it will be the first anniversary of his eldest daughter's wedding and he wants to make a nice present and surprise for the couple. With this loan amount of 700,000 Armenian Drams, he wants to buy nice and comfortable bedroom furniture for them.

loans.use: to buy nice and comfortable bedroom furniture for the young couple as a gift for their first wedding anniversary.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is sixty years old, a teacher and lives in Sevan in the Gegharkunik region of Armenia. She lives alone because her two sons and their families now live in Russia.

Since 1982 Gayane has taught Armenian language and literature. She also gives paid private lessons in the same subjects and helps pupils to prepare for entrance exams. She mentioned that she likes her work and deals with her pupils with care and respect. In turn, she is also respected and appreciated for her kindness and outstanding work.

Gayane has applied for a 700,000 AMD loan through Kiva's field partner Nor Horizon to buy a computer and table for it, plus some professional literature for the classes she teaches at home. With the help of this loan she hopes to make her teaching more informative and interesting for her pupils.

loans.use: to buy a computer and table for it, plus some professional literature for the classes she teaches at home.

loans.name: Baba Dabaleswora Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Mina, 48, standing to the extreme right in the photo, is the featured borrower of Baba Dabaleswora SHG-B. She is married and a mother of two sons who are grown up and earn their own living separately. She hails from a small town in Cuttack district. Mina is a farmer by profession and is engaged in paddy cultivation. She has a limited source of income and was never able to build a toilet, which is her biggest necessity, due to a lack of finances.

Mina, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR to Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan to build a hygienic toilet in order to safeguard the health of her family and avoid unnecessary expenditures on medicines and hospital bills.

She is awaiting your kind hearts to help her.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet

loans.name: Baba Dabaleswora Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Pratima is 44 years old, divorced and engaged in a bakery business. She manages a bakery in the market. To make her business stall complete and gain a bigger income, Pratima supplies her stall with grocery items. She has been in the business for eight years. She lives with her only daughter in a small town in Cuttack district.

She dreams of enlarging her business and making it a one-stop shop so that her customers can buy all their needs in her stall. Therefore, Pratima, along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients for making bread. She will also use the loan to buy grocery items to sell.

She wishes that she could raise her sales and income and save it for her daughter's future.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients for making bread and to buy grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 38 anos de idade vive maritalmente é pai de 4 filhos menores de idade que frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua mãe que vive em Maputo.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku e 2008. Este é o seu 9º empréstimo com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como tinta e tubos para terminar com a sua obra de residência.
Futuramente pretende iniciar um negócio de criação de frangos para venda e erguer dependências para aluguer.
texts.en:
This borrower was born in Namaacha in the Province of Maputo. He is a 38-year-old married father of four young children, who are in school. He is responsible for his mother, who lives in Maputo.

He started to work with Hluvuku in 2008. This is his ninth loan, which he plans to use to buy construction materials such as dye and pipes to finish construction work on his home.

In the future, he plans to start a business raising chickens for sale and building apartments to rent.

loans.use: to buy paint and pipes to finish construction on his home.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 42 years old. He is married and has five children. He operates a retail shop and has been in the business for the last four years.

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya. He intends to use the loan to buy stocks of sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, tissue paper, paraffin, etc. for the shop.

He will use the profit from his business to educate his children and expand the business. His hope and dream for the future is to grow and stabilize the business to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy stocks of sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, tissue paper, paraffin, etc. for the shop.

loans.name: Shyrell

texts.en:
Shyrell is a 37-year-old married woman with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Shyrell has a buy-and-sell personal care product business in the Philippines. Shyrell requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like roll-on deodorant, lotion, etc..

Shyrell has been in this business for two years. In the future, Shyrell would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like roll-on deodorant, lotion, etc.

loans.name: Rodelita

texts.en:
Rodelita is 39 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. For the past six years she has operated her sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines.


Rodelita has applied for a 17,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy more items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, cigarettes, home care products and other groceries. She is working hard in the hopes that she can save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, cigarettes, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 68 years old and married with three children. Chona works very hard to provide for them.

Chona runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Chona has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Chona would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 44 años de edad, es un hombre que se esfuerza mucho para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, Miguel gracias a su esmero del día a día y con el apoyo del crédito logro incrementar sus productos de su pequeña ferretería, a Dios gracias esta inversión para él fue de gran bendición porque le dejo una buena ganancia, y ahora su ferretería ha cambiado mucho, y la gente lo buscan muy frecuentemente.  Miguel considera que es necesario una nueva inversión para su negocio y a raíz de esta necesidad él solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como: tubos, palas, piochas, alambres, pegamentos. Con estos productos Miguel espera poder satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
El gran anhelo de Miguel es que pueda seguir incrementado su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Miguel is 44 years old. He is a man striving to give his family a better quality of life. Miguel, thanks to his daily dedication and the support from a loan, has managed to increase the products at his small hardware store. He thanks God for this investment, which was a great blessing, because it brought him a nice profit and now his hardware store has changed a lot and people frequently seek him out.

Miguel believes a new investment is necessary for his business and as a result of this necessity, he is requesting a loan to buy products such as: piping, shovels, pickaxes, wire and cement. With these products, Miguel hopes to be able to better satisfy his customer’s needs.

Miguel’s greatest desire is to be able to continue growing his business and to improve his family’s income.

loans.use: to buy hardware products such as: piping, shovels, pickaxes, wire and cement.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Milena es una mujer con 42 años de edad,  que desde hace poco logro montar su primer negocio, una sala de belleza en un local alquilado cercano a su casa. Con esto ha tenido un gran progreso, sola logró salir adelante con su pequeño de 10 años de edad, luego de la separación de su esposo quien era el sostén del hogar.
Trabaja todos los días durante 10 horas por día.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo en la Corporación Interactuar con el fin de comprar productos capilares, tratamientos y una silla especial para manicure.

El sueño de esta madre es continuar trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de comprar una vivienda propia, la cual en un futuro pertenezca a su hijo, pues él es el motor que impulsa a esta mujer para seguir luchando.

Con su aporte Milena podrá hacer de sus sueños una realidad, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Milena is a 42-year-old woman who has recently succeeded in opening her first activity - a beauty salon - in a shop she pays rent for and that is close to her house. Thanks to this she has greatly progressed, as since she separated from her husband, who economically supported the household, she has had to provide alone for herself and her 10-year-old child. She works every day, 10 hours a day.

She is requesting a loan to Corporación Interactuar in order to buy hair products, hair treatments and a special chair for manicure.

This mother dreams to continue working in order to achieve her goal: to buy a house of her own that her son will inherit in the future. Her son is the driving force boosting this woman to carry on striving.

Thanks to your support, Milena will succeed in making her dreams come true; take action and give a loan!

loans.use: to buy hair products, hair treatments and a special chair for manicure.

loans.name: Jovel

texts.en:
Jovel has been operating his business for many years. In fact, he was able to repay his previous loan. He is with his children right now. He is the only one supporting the needs of his children in school.

He owns a garden where he plants bananas and sells them at the market. He aims to increase his income because of the increasing price of commodities. He decided to borrow a loan again to purchase fertilizer for the banana farm so that he can produce a good quality of bananas. This will also help him to deliver more bananas to the market, which will generate more income.

Jovel's plan for the future is to save money from his business income to sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his bananas.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 42 years old, married, and has one child who attends school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Josefina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Josefina has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Josefina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 38 anos d idade, casado oficialmente pai de 3 filhos menores de idade, dos quais 2 frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua mãe que vive em sua casa.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2011. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: blocos, cimento, areia e pedra, para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência.
Futuramente pretende abrir um estabelecimento comercial para a venda de produtos da 1ª necessidade e abrir uma oficina.
texts.en:
He was born in Namaacha, Maputo province. He is 38 years old, married, and the father of three underage children; two of them go to school. He takes care of his mother, who lives with him.

He started to work with Hluvuku in 2011. This is his fourth loan, and he is planning to buy construction materials, such as bricks, cement, sand, and stone in order to continue building his house.

In the future, he plans to open a store to sell essential products and a workshop.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and stones.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 32-year-old, married mother of four children. She started two years ago preparing and selling "Mouneh" from her house to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their beloved children.

Rania is a hard worker and sacrificing mother who is trying desperately to improve her family's living conditions. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to buy a necessary medical bed for her disabled, beloved child since she wants to renovate her house to make it a healthier place for her children.

Rania wants to futher expand her business in the future, to increase her income and remain capable of satisfying her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy a medical bed for her disabled, beloved child and renovate her house.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Justina; la socia tiene 71 años de edad tiene 07 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de restaurante, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 Las personas mayores de 65 años de edad están excluidas del sistema financiero formal y gracias a los inversionistas de Kiva pueden lograr su financiamiento de tal manera la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, aceite, carnes entre otros.
texts.en:
Justina is 71 years old, and is married with 7 children. She divides her daily activities with her restaurant business. She has been in her business for some time and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it each day. She is a responsible and hard-working person and wishes to be able to continue working, and in this way continue supporting her family.

People over 65 años are excluded from the regular financial system, but thanks to the Kiva investors they can succeed in obtaining a loan.

The borrower is grateful to those who form part of this dream in this way and promises to make her installment payments on time.

She is requesting the loan in order to buy rice, cooking oil, meats and other ingredients.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, meats and other ingredients.

loans.name: Ngoundio

texts.fr:
Ngoundia est membre dans le banc villageois depuis sa création.

Elle est âgée de 47ans.Elle est marié et mère de 5 enfants dont 3 garçons.

Avec son prêt,elle va acheter 3 moutons et une vache pour l’élevage.

Avec le financement obtenus,elle compte acheter 3 moutons à 50000f,1vache à 150000f et le reste des aliments de bétail.Elle fait cette activité depuis plusieurs années,mais elle n’est pas la seule à faire cette activité.

Avec les revenus,elle compte augmenter son épargne pour bénéficier du PIPE.
texts.en:
Ngoundia has been a member of this banc villageois since its creation. She is 47 years old, and is married and the mother of five children, three of them boys. With her loan, Ngoundia is going to purchase three sheep and one cow to raise.

With the financing she receives, Ngoundia plans to purchase three sheep for 50,000 CFA francs, one cow for 150,000 CFA francs, and [spend] the remainder on feed for the animals. She has been working in this industry for several years, but she is not the only one in the business.

With the profits, Ngoundia plans to increase her savings in order to be able to receive a PIPE loan [Prêt d'Initiation à la Petite Entreprise, a loan product offered by CAURIE Microfinance for small business borrowers who meet a certain savings threshold].

loans.use: to purchase sheep and cows.

loans.name: Caterine

texts.en:
Caterine is a married woman with two children. Her eldest child is 10 and the youngest is 3. She hails from the town of Dulag, Leyte. She farms. Caterine grows and sells rice. It has been almost ten years now that she has been engaged in farming. Her husband is also a farmer. She needs capital to finance her farming livelihood.

Caterine is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and this will help improve the yield of her farm. Thus, it will cause her to improve her earnings and be able to settle her obligations. These finances will continue to provide her family with healthy diets and better shelter to live.

Caterine is determined to manage her farming business to be successful and to continue to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and maize seeds.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a 41-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Liza has a food vending business in the Philippines. Liza requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Liza has been in this business for six years. In the future, Liza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en:
Macaria is 55 years old and married with seven children. With two children in school, Macaria works very hard to provide for them.

Macaria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal care products, and other groceries.

Macaria has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Macaria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more milk to sell.

loans.name: Sasun

texts.en:
Sasun is 52 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Chapni, a village in the Syunik region. Their two sons are already married and live with their families.

Sasun works at a private company as a watchman but simultaneously he is very actively and seriously engaged in agriculture and bee keeping activities. He has over 50 bee families, thanks to which he sells a lot of very tasty and healing honey right from his farm.

On his plot of land he also cultivates various vegetables such as potato, cucumber cabbage, pepper, garlic, greens, radish and onion. He sells this harvest at the city’s wholesale market to his already regular customers.

With this Kiva loan, Sasun wants to buy a new honey squeezing machine and frames and he also wants to repair the fence of his vegetable garden.

loans.use: to buy a new honey squeezing machine and frames and to repair the fence of his vegetable garden

loans.name: Raimundo

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Homoine Província de Inhambane tem 23 anos de idade vive maritalmente, responsabiliza-se pelos seus pais que se encontram em Inhambane enviando lhes dinheiro mensalmente.
Começou a trabalhar com Hluvuku em 2013. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo com o qual pretende adquirir produtos como: ração, vitaminas e pintos, para satisfazer as necessidades dos seus clientes. 
Futuramente pretende erguer uma obra de residência e ser um empreendedor de sucesso ao nível do distrito. O seu maior desafio é continuar com os seus estudos até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
He was born in Homoine, Inhambane province. He is 23 years old and married. He takes care of his parents, who live in Inhambane. He sends them money every month.

He started to work with Hluvuku in 2013. This is his third loan, and he is planning to purchase animal feed, vitamins and chickens to fulfill his customers’ demands.

In the future, he plans to build a house and become a successful entrepreneur at the district level. His main challenge is to continue with his higher-education studies.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, vitamins and chickens.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en:
Artemio is 57 years old and still has the eagerness to succeed. He is married and has four grown children.

Artemio is engaged in a bakery business, making and selling breads in the market. He also serves pancit lomi, a type of noodles that most Filipinos love to eat for a snack. Artemio wants to expand his business to earn a bigger income. Hence, he is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy flour, sugar, yeast, and other bread-making ingredients. He will also use the loan to buy noodles and raw ingredients in making pancit lomi.

Artemio's earnings from his bakery and pancit lomi business will serve as his capital to expand his stall. He hopes to attain his goal soon.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, and other bread-making ingredients.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is 47 years old, married and has five children. She cooks food to sell and also sells vegetables and raises hogs as additional sources of income. She is very patient in acquiring income to sustain her family. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy meat, vegetables and ingredients to cook and sell. She will also buy feed and medicine for her hogs. She will pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy meat and other ingredients to cook and sell.

loans.name: Zam Zam Group

texts.en:
Nyamayao, who is in her mid 40s, is married with three children who are still at school. She has been a food vendor for three years now. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Nyamayao's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep on increasing her mamalishe (small food store) stock and has paid back all her loans successfully.

She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan, and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in her food store and serve more clients. She dreams of building her own house.

Nyamayao will share this loan with her loan group Zam Zam, which consists of seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in her food store and serve more clients.

loans.name: Baa Dabaleswora Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Jhunia, 35, is the one standing on the right hand side in the photograph. She is divorced from her husband, and the mother of two boys. She is from a small town in Cuttack district, Odisha, India. She is an intelligent and skillful woman. Jhunia has developed and grown her business steadily. She started this business with a small amount of capital. She owns a ladies novelty corner near her house and sells cosmetics, nail paint, moisturizers, talc etc. She works really hard to earn her livelihood and fulfill her children's demands. Being a single mother, she has never let her children feel the absence of their father.

Jhunia, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan to purchase additional stock of cosmetics for her store in order to deliver the customer's demand within the due course of time and make her customers delighted with her service.

Jhunia dreams of providing the best possible education to her sons and see them become famous doctors one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of cosmetics for her store.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel has been operating his business for many years. In fact, he was able to repay his previous loan from GDMPC. He is with his children and his wife, who takes care of his children. He is the only one supporting the needs of his family.

He owns a farm where he plants rice and sells it at the market. He aims to increase his income because of the increasing price of commodities. He decided to borrow a loan again to purchase fertilizer for his farm so that he can produce a good quality of rice. This will satisfy the needs of his customers and enable him to deliver more rice to the market, which will generate more income.

Joel's plan for the future is to save money from his business income to sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his rice field.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, salt, maize, wheat flours, sugar and cooking oil to sell in the hope that this will enable him to get more income to support his family.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is an unmarried Palestinian young man living with his parents and four brothers and sisters in a Palestinian camp located in North Lebanon. He is 20 years old and has owned a fruit and vegetable shop inside the camp since 2010. 
To make his shop more appealing and attractive for his clients, Maher is asking for a loan of 1,543,992 Lebanese Pounds from Kiva field partner Ibdaa. He plans on using the loan to improve the decor of his shop, hoping to attract more clients which will increase his sales and monthly income as well as his business' sustainability. Maher has been working for nine years selling fruit and vegetables which helped him build a very good reputation in the area. He is known for being friendly with his customers and for selling fresh produce.

loans.use: to improve his shop's decor

loans.name: Sandro

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Maputo tem 33 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é pai de 1 filha menor de idade, responsabiliza-se pelos seus dois sobrinhos.
Este é o seu 1º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: blocos, cimento, varões, barrotes  para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência.
Futuramente pretende construir dependências para aluguer e abrir um estabelecimento comercial para venda de produtos da 1ª necessidade
texts.en:
He was born in Maputo. He is 33 years old, married, and the father of an underage child. He is responsible for two nephews.

This is his first loan from Hluvuku, and he is planning to purchase construction materials such as bricks, cement, beams, and iron rods to continue building his house.

In the future, he plans to buy rooms to rent and open a store to sell essential items.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, beams, and iron rods to continue building his house.

loans.name: Sofia Asuncion

texts.es:
La socia Sonia; la socia tiene 44 años  y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a su negocio de venta de zapatos, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar zapatos de mujeres.
texts.en:
Sonia, age 44, is single. She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling shoes. She has been in the business for a good amount of time. The business is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work each day. She is a responsible and diligent person. She wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family in this way.

She is grateful to those who form part of this dream through these means, and she pledges to make her payments. She is requesting the loan to buy women's shoes.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchace fertilizer for her banana production

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 57 years old and married with two children.

Susan works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, beverages, personal care products, and other groceries.

Susan has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from food vending. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Susan aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, beverages, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Rosebella

texts.en:
Rosebella is 56 years old and married with nine children, two in school, Rosebella works very hard to provide for her family

Rosebella runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Rosebella has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Rosebella would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goos, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Fidaa

texts.en:
Fidaa is a 42-year-old married mother of two children. Sixteen years ago, she got employed in a company to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their children. 
Fidaa is a hard worker who is suffering from the long distance and transportation difficulties from her house to her work. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car to improve her life. She hopes to stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car to improve her transportation to and from work.

loans.name: Catherin Betsabe

texts.es:
La socia Catherin ; la socia tiene 36 años  es soltera y  tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a su negocio de venta de productos balanceados, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos balanceados.
texts.en:
Catherin, age 36, is single and has one child. She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling balanced products. She has had her business for a good amount of time. It is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work each day. She is a responsible and diligent person. She wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family in this way.

She is grateful to those whom form part of this dream through these means. She pledges to make her payments. She is requesting the loan to buy balanced products.

loans.use: to buy balanced products.

loans.name: Amigas Solidarias De Miguel Grau Group

texts.es: La Sra. Nilda tiene 45 años de edad, esta soltera y tiene 3 hijos que solamente 2 dependen aun de ella. Es la presidenta de la alcancía comunal “Amigas Solidarias de Miguel Grau” este grupo viene trabajando responsablemente hace algunos años y ahora lo representan 5 mujeres luchadoras con todas las ganas de triunfar en conjunto. Nilda se dedica a trabajar como empleada del hogar todos los días, pero también tiene su pequeña tienda en su casa donde le ayudan sus hijos a atender cuando Ella se va a trabajar, es así como Nilda se esfuerza para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. El préstamo lo utilizara para invertirlo en su tienda como comprar al por mayor deferentes tipos de debidas y alimentos como arroz, papa, etc. Su plan a futuro es comprar un carro para poder alquilarlo y terminar de construir su casa. En la foto grupal Nilda se encuentra de pie en medio de sus demás compañeras sentadas.
texts.en:
Nilda, age 45, is single. She has three children; only two of them are dependent upon her. She is the president of the Amigas Solidarias de Miguel Grua communal bank. This group has been working responsibly for a few years. Now there are five tenacious women with a great desire to triumph together.

Nilda works as a household employee every day. However, she also has a small store at her house. Her children help tend the store when she goes to work. This is how Nilda puts forth great effort in order to be able to provide her children with a better quality of life.

Nilda will use the loan to invest in her store by purchasing different types of drinks wholesale and food like rice and potatoes, etc.

Her plan for the future is to buy a car to be able to rent it out and to finish building her house.

In the group photo Nilda is standing in the middle of the other members who are seated.

loans.use: to buy drinks and food.

loans.name: Grupo Sector Gutierrez Group

texts.es:
Dina es una mujer luchadora, con grandes propósitos en la vida, ella tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de los cuales son dos hombres y dos mujeres, y esta linda familia vive en una comunidad de Santo Tomas.
Dina (la segunda de derecha a izquierda) es un extraordinaria mujer, con mucho entusiasmo de seguir superándose, y eso la llevo a motivar y ser la líder del grupo denominada Grupo Sector Gutiérrez,  para Dina no hay nada más importante que su familia, y para darles lo mejor se dedica a la venta de pasteles y refacciones, ella es ambulante por las calles de su comunidad, pero para obtener mejores ingresos trabaja también en un restaurante de la comunidad.
Dina con el afán de mejorar sus servicios como pastelera ha decidido solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de productos como; harina, huevos, aceite, crema, y bases para pasteles, con esta inversión Dina espera mejorar su servicios a los clientes.  El gran sueño de Dina es poder contar con una agencia de pastelería y restaurantes para que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Dina is a hard working woman, with big goals in life. She has a beautiful family with four children. Two are boys and two are girls. Her lovely family lives in the community of Santo Tomas.

Dina (the second from the right) is an extraordinary woman with great enthusiasm to advance. This caused her to motivate herself to be the leader of the group called Grupo Sector Gutiérrez. For Dina, nothing is more important than family. In order to give them the best, she works selling cakes and snacks. She is a street vendor in the streets of her community, but in order to obtain increased income she also works in a restaurant in the community.

In her eagerness to better her services as a cake maker, Dina has decided to seek a loan that she will invest in the purchase of products such as flour, eggs, oil, cream, and cake stands. With this investment, Dina hopes to improve her services to her clients. Dina's big dream is to have a cake making business and restaurants, so that her children will have a better future.

loans.use: to buy the following materials to make cakes: flour, eggs, oil, cream, and cake stands.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta involved herself in a direct-selling business. She has sold personal products for over five years now. She is now 52 years old. She is asking for additional capital to invest in her business so she can offer more products and gain good profits from it. She needs 6,000 PHP. She will buy more colognes, perfumes, soap and shampoo to sell. This will help improve her earnings for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy more colognes, perfumes, soap and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is married, and she's 61 years old right now. Her husband is a farmer. She helps her husband in providing for their daily needs by running his general store. She promptly put up a small sari-sari store in the front of her house. 

Despite the small income it brought, the family needed daily income. She was presented with another opportunity, which was to borrow a loan for buying more goods to have a greater income. 

Flora’s plan for her future is to save money to sustain their daily needs and for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Maa Aghorkali Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Kameni, 47, is the lady standing on the left hand side in the photograph. She only went to school for four years because her parents couldn't cover the household expenses and those of education. She is a divorcee and she has five children only two of whom depend economically on her. She says, "that my children go to school and have a good quality of life is what motivated me to begin selling soft drinks and food 5 years ago." These are the words of Kameni, as she is known in the community. She says that she didn't want history to repeat itself with her children.

For five years, she has worked selling food and soft drinks and says that she began just with soft drinks, chips and cookies, but with the passing of the months, the customers began to ask her for food and then she began, with the help of her group member and using part of the earnings she got, to build a small structure where she set up her refrigerator for the soft drinks, the chips, and cookies, and five tables and a burner where she makes the food.

Kameni, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR to purchase oil, meat, vegetables, cream, cheese, soft drinks, chips and two tables.

She is awaiting your kind and generous hearts to help her.

loans.use: to purchase oil, meat, vegetables, cream, cheese, soft drinks, chips and two tables.

loans.name: Noure Group

texts.fr: Alizèta is 37 years old, married, and has one child. She has been a saleswoman for 2 years. Relocating to service facilities to sell her merchandise has been advantageous for the success of her business. She would like to use the loan to acquire 250,000 for Airtel Money and 50,000 for peanut butter. The loan will be utilized to acquire Airtel Money and peanut butter for her business so that she can earn a profit. She has already received one loan previously and repaid it within the deadline.
texts.en: Alizèta is 37 years old, married, and has one child. She has been a saleswoman for 2 years. Relocating to service facilities to sell her merchandise has been advantageous for the success of her business. She would like to use the loan to acquire 250,000 for Airtel Money and 50,000 for peanut butter. The loan will be utilized to acquire Airtel Money and peanut butter for her business so that she can earn a profit. She has already received one loan previously and repaid it within the deadline.

loans.use: to acquire 250,000f of Airtel Money (money transfer system) and 50,000f to buy peanut butter to resell.

loans.name: Susan Evelyn

texts.es:
La socia Susan; la socia tiene 31años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a ejercer su profesión ella es chef , la socia lleva buen tiempo ejerciendo su profesión el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como arroz entre otros.
texts.en:
Susan is 31 years old. She has one child and is single. She alternates her daily activities, and dedicates herself to her profession as chef. She has been in this profession for a good while, and does well at it due to the effort she puts into her work. She is a responsible and dedicated person. She wants to keep working in order to continue supporting her family.

Susan thanks those who take part in this dream through this loan, and commits to comply with the loan payments. She seeks a loan to buy supplies such as rice, among other things.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, among other things.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is a resident in the town of Mcarthur, Leyte. She is a 36-year-old married woman with an eight-year-old child. She toils the land and grows rice. It has been 8 years now that she has been engaged in growing and selling rice. Her husband is a carpenter. She is in need of capital to support her current source of income.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pay for farm maintenance. These resources are very essential in the improvement of her farming livelihood. It could boost her harvest and augment her income. With this, she could provide her child with a healthy diet and good living conditions.

Lani hopes that she could manage her livelihood successfully to become productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for farm maintenance

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Vicenta works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling spices. Vicenta is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy a variety of vegetables to sell for her vegetable-vending business.

Vicenta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Tuliho Group

texts.fr: Jean tient la culture du riz de ses parents et s'y est lancé depuis 2000. Il en a un bon souvenir car elle était la source principale de revenus de la famille qui a aidé ses parents à les prendre en charge. Quoique l'activité est frappée parfois par la carence en eau d'irrigation, les maladies et l'insuffisance des moyens financiers; Jean souhaiterait élargir son étendue culturale afin de profiter d'une bonne récolte dont la vente lui permettrait d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Sur photo, il tient un carnet rose dans une main. Notons cependant que le jeune gens AMANI en chemise bleue, en troisième position sur la photo (de gauche à droite) est membre du groupe TULIHO mais il a jugé bon de ralentir momentanément son activité rizicole afin de de poursuivre ses études.
texts.en:
Jean cares for the rice fields of his parents and he began to do so in 2000. They are a good memory since they were the principal source of income for the family, and they helped his parents to support themselves.

Although the activity is sometimes plagued by deficiency of irrigation water, by plant diseases, and insufficient financial means, Jean would like to extend his cultivated surface so as to take advantage of a good harvest whose sale will permit him to improve living conditions for his family. In the photo, Jean is holding a little booklet in his hand. The third person from the left with the blue shirt is a member of the Tuliho Group but momentarily slowed down his rice activities to focus on his studies.

loans.use: to maintain his fields, buy phytosanitary products, and buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Maa Aghorkali Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Puspalata is a charismatic, humble and enterprising lady from a small village in Cuttack district, Odisha, India. She is 30 years old and is the one standing on the extreme right in the photograph. She owns a vegetable and fruit vending business in her locality. Perseverance and passion for the job are what made her stay in the business despite the cut throat competition. She is married and her husband works as a farmer. She is blessed with two beautiful daughters who are currently in primary school. Unfortunately, she lacks a toilet in her home and has to walk a long distance in order to access a public toilet near the bus stand.

Therefore, Puspalata, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a new toilet and install a commode in it. She believes that 'Prevention is better than Cure'. That is why she wants to maintain her health and hygiene and wants to reduce unnecessary medical expenses.

loans.use: to build a new toilet and install a commode in it

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es:
El señor Gustavo Adolfo es un señor muy trabajador y querido en su colonia, se dedica a la venta de repuestos de vehículos y su fuente de ingresos proviene de su negocio  esto lo realiza desde su casa de  habitación,  se levanta muy temprano para empezar a trabajar  con sus clientes que en su mayoría son mecánicos automotrices de  la  ciudad.
Don Gustavo Adolfo solicita el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de productos automotrices  como ser aceites, lubricantes, stop, repuestos en general, etc. El sueña con tener un negocio donde pueda dar más empleo y poder cubrir con la demanda de la clientela y así poder mejorar sus ingresos y los de su familia.
Don Gustavo Adolfo uno de sus sueños es mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio y que este sea uno de los más reconocidos de su comunidad.


Tegucigalpa,  Honduras - Julio del  2015
texts.en:
Señor Gustavo Adolfo is a very hardworking man who is much loved in his town. He makes a living selling spare vehicle parts and his source of income comes from his business. He works from home, getting up very early to begin work with his customers, who are mainly car mechanics in the city.

Gustavo Adolfo is requesting the support of a loan to buy automobile products such as oil, lubricants, reflectors, general spare parts, etc. He dreams of having a business where he can give more work and be able to cover the demand from customers and in this way, boost his and his family's income.

One of Gustavo Adolfo's dreams is to improve and grow his business, so it becomes one of the most well known in his community.

Tegucigalpa,  Honduras - July 2015

loans.use: to buy oil, lubricants, reflectors, general spare parts, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is greatly thankful for her first Kiva loan. She is also greatly hopeful for this second loan as the reason for it this time is more urgent and important. She lives with her children in Artashat City in the Ararat region and as previously she works at the food market as a saleswoman. Her daughter is still a student and her son in now in the army.

Since being a widow and facing all the hardships of the life alone Susanna mentions that the Kiva program became the only way of solving her problems quickly, and for this she is so pleased of Kiva lenders’ kindness and humanism.

Susanna is very worried since her son in the army now has serious health problems and he needs to pass an urgent medical examination. This loan of 600,000 Armenian drams she needs for solving her son’s health problem, for which she thanks beforehand all the Kiva lenders who will decide to help her.

loans.use: to solve a health problem for her son, who is in the army now.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 38 years old with two children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, junk foods, home care products and other groceries.

Virginia has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, junk foods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Jelian

texts.en:
Jelian is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jelian is 28 years old and has one child in school.

Jelian has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock of rice to sell.

Jelian has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of rice to sell

loans.name: Marie Christine

texts.fr:
66 ans, sans mari ni enfant, Marie Christine est une femme travailleuse et combattive. Elle élève un  de ses neveux qui est orphelin. Il a 12 ans et est scolarisé.
La raison de sa persistance et son obsession à travailler dur et encore malgré son âge est pour la sécurité de sa vieillesse et pour le bien-être de son neveu adopté. Elle exerce une activité de vente ambulante des vêtements fripes et livraison des produits de premières nécessités comme savons, bougies,huiles de tables, sucre, sels, etc...  chez des petits commerçants.
Son souhait est d'ouvrir un petit magasin fixe à la campagne parce que la vente ambulante exige de l’énergie, et à son âge, elle ne supportera plus long temps le rythme.
texts.en:
Marie Christine is a sixty-six years old single woman without children; she is hard-working and determined. She raises one of her orphaned nephew. He is twelve years old and goes to school.

The reason for her persistence and determination to work hard despite her age is to ensure safety for her old days and for her adopted nephew’s well-being. She works retailing second-hand clothes door to door, and delivering essential supplies (such as soap, candles, edible oils, sugar, salt etc) to independent retailers.

Her desire is to open a small permanent retail store out of the city, because door-to-door retailing requires energy and that, given her age, she will not be able to deal with the rhythm for much longer.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes and essential supplies (such as soap, sugar, salt etc)

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a 42-year-old lady. She is married and has five children. She operates a chips cafe, as well as green grocery selling potatoes and tomatoes. She has been in the business for the last year and the business is doing well.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use the loan to purchase potatoes, tomato sauce, cooking oil, for the cafe and fruits and vegetables for the green grocery stall.

She will use the profit from her business to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to grow and stabilize her business.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, cooking oil, tomato sauce, etc.

loans.name: Ndambao's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe composé de huit femmes a été crée depuis l'inauguration de ce banc villageois et ils sont unis par de bonnes relations de cohabitations et professionnelle.
Madame Marie en est la responsable ,elle est veuve âgée de 40 ans et mère de sept enfants tous scolarisés.
Elle s'active dans le commerce par la vente de produis de mer .Avec son nouveau crédit de quatre cent mille francs cfa elle va se payer des paniers de poissons frais et secs qu'elle va revendre.Elle va également acheter
de bidons d'huile de palme qu'elle va revendre au détails au niveau du banc villageois et du quartier.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires de sa familles et de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group is made up of eight women and was created since the banc villageois was established. They are united through living near each other and having good professional relationships.

Marie is the one responsible for the loan, she is 40 years old and the mother of seven school children.

Her business concerns itself with selling seafood products. With her new loan of 400 000 cfa she is going to buy some cases of fresh and dry fish that she will resell. She will also buy bottles of palm oil to resell in the banc villageois and the neighbourhood.

The profits she will earn will allow her to manage the family's nutritious needs and to strengthen her savings at the banc villageois level.

loans.use: to buy fish products that she will resell in her neighbourhood

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena tiene 36 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con sus 04 hijos en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Las actividades principales que se realizan en este distrito son la agricultura y la ganadería.

Magdalena tiene una tienda de abarrotes que funciona desde hace 05 años, y funciona en su mismo domicilio, cuenta con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de animales de corral como patos, pavos, cuyes, entre otros. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, para incrementar el stock de su negocio. Con esto Magdalena espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir aumentar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 36 years old, in a common-law marriage, and lives with her 4 children in Puycará district, which is located in Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. The primary activities which are done in this district are agriculture and animal husbandry.

Magdalena has a grocery store that has been running for 5 years, and is in her own home. She has loyal customers who offer very good personal and work references for her. In addition, she works selling small animals such as ducks, turkeys, guinea pigs and more. The loan will be used to purchase a greater quantity of products such as rice, sugar, oil, and sweets to increase the stock in her business. With this, Magdalena expects to offer a greater variety of products to her customers which will allow her to increase her income and, in the end, improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of products to expand the stock in her business.

loans.name: Rosary

texts.en: Rosary operates his motorcycle transport business while his wife runs a general store to make a living. He has been doing this for more than two years and he earns well and is able to repay his previous loan because of this activity. Recently, Rosary took a new loan to buy tires in order to replace his old, used tires. Rosary finds ways to save money to improve the general store of his wife in order to give his children a better education. He wants to improve the living situation of the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase motor parts to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Raj Bibi

texts.en:
Raj Bibi is a mother of two daughters and two sons; she lives in the small of town of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a businessman. His business is selling spare parts for tractors; his business is going well because of his humble nature. He has a big pool of customers who really trust him and buy most of the parts from his shop. But from the past months his inventory fallen to zero and he does not have not enough money to buy new stock for selling.

So Raj Bibi applied for the loan so that her husband is able to buy the inventory and can ease the tight budget of the family.

Raj Bibi appreciates the efforts of this program, and is also thankful to Kiva and its' field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy spare tractor parts for her husband to sell at his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron sheets for her husband's iron drum-manufacturing business.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is the age of 48 and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children; three of them sit idle at home.

Her son has been running a restaurant for many years and handling the financial condition of his house. This restaurant has been supporting his whole family for many years. Nowadays, he wants to offer more menu items to his valuable customers so that he can grow his income.

Razia is requesting a loan for the restaurant establishment. In fact, her son wants to buy chicken, beef, pulses, bread, butter, yogurt, etc. Razia is hopeful that this loan would be the cause to generate more profit, and savings as well.

Razia thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy food items for her son's restaurant so he can increase his menu.

loans.name: Kisarawe One Group

texts.en:
Moshi, who is in her late 50s, is married with four children who are still in school. She has been running a poultry business for 30 years now. She works from 06 am to 07 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Moshi’s seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy broiler chicks and chicken feed, and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is so grateful with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a land, made loan repayments and covered household expenses.

She will use this loan to increase her business.

She dreams of selling water at wholesale prices.

Moshi will share this loan with her loan group, KISARAWE ONE, which consist of seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to improve her business by buying  broiler chicks to raise and sell as chicken.

loans.name: Valor Y Sacrificio Group

texts.es: La Sra. Teofila tiene 55 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 2 hijos  que ya son independientes. Es la presidenta de la alcancía comunal “Valor y Sacrificio” que está integrada por 6 personas muy dedicadas y responsables en cumplir con sus objetivos. Como fuente de trabajo tiene una pequeña tienda en casa donde ofrece todo tipo de bebidas y alimentos. El préstamo lo utilizara para invertirlo en su tienda como comprar al por mayor diferentes tipos de bebidas y alimentos como arroz, papas, golosinas, etc es así como Ella se esfuerza para generar sus propios ingresos y cubrir con sus gastos, adicional del apoyo que sus hijos le brindan. Tiene pensado seguir construyendo su casa para poder alquilar cuartos al público y así obtener ingresos. En la foto grupal Teofila se encuentra de pie en medio de sus demás compañeros sentados.
texts.en:
Sra. Teofila is 55 years old, widowed, and has two children who are independent. She is the president of the Communal Bank “Valor Y Sacrificio” (Courage and Sacrifice), which consists of six members who are dedicated and responsible in meeting their objectives.

As a way of making a livelihood, Teofila has a small store in her home where she offers all types of beverages and food products. Her loan will be invested in her store in order to buy different types of beverages and food products in bulk such as rice, potatoes, snacks, and other items. Teofila strives to generate her own income in order to cover her expenses. Her children provide additional support. Going forward, she plans to build additional rooms in her house that she can rent out to the public as a way of generating income.

In the group photo, Teofila is the woman standing in the middle of the other group members who are seated.

loans.use: to buy beverages and food products for her store.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Crée le 14 Janvier 1998, le groupe compte des femmes qui en majorité ont acquis de solides expériences dans le petit commerce qui se trouvent être leur activité principale.  Elles habitent toutes le même village, et partagent des valeurs de solidarité et d’entre aide. 

Madame Fatou (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 56 ans, mariée et  mère de 05 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente le petit commerce vente de poissons, patte d’arachide et oignons.

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter un frigo d’un montant de 300 000, des poissons d’un montant de 100000 de la patte d’arachide et des oignons d’un montant de 30000f pour le revendre en détails.

 Les bénéfices lui permettront d’aider son mari dans la dépense quotidienne et de s’occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Established January 14, 1998, the majority of this group is made up of women who have gained substantial experience in small business, which is their primary activity. They all live in the same village and share the values of solidarity and mutual assistance.

Mrs. Fatou (standing at far right [in the photo] with one hand raised) is the group's featured borrower. She is 56 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  She runs a small business selling fish, ground nut paste, and onions.

This new loan will allow Mrs. Fatou to purchase a refrigerator for 300,000 [CFA francs], fish for 100,000 [CFA francs], and ground nut paste and onions for 30,000 [CFA francs] to resell at retail prices.

The profits will allow Mrs. Fatou to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses and to care for her children.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator for 300,000 [CFA francs], fish for 100,000 [CFA francs], and ground nut paste and onions for 30,000 [CFA francs] to resell at retail prices.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 73 years old, married and supports a family of three children. 

He has been practicing farming as well as running a retail shop for the last eight years, earning KES 35,000 per month. 

John has applied for KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production as well as additional stock of sugar, milk, washing powder and cereals for his shop.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production as well as additional stock of sugar, milk, washing powder and cereals for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her cake-making business.

loans.name: Corina

texts.es:
La señora Corina  nació el 7 de noviembre de 1984 en la provincia Zudañez del departamento de Cochabamba. tubo su pareja y desde muy joven llegaron al trópico del departamento de Cochabamba donde trabajaron de jornalero en diferentes actividades, gracias al esfuerzo de ambos llegaron a obtener un lote donde actualmente viven.
La señora Corina es madre de familia de cuatro niños que estaba concubinado con el señor Emilio, su esposo falleció hace un año atrás en un accidente, pero sin embargo la señora Corina se esfuerza día a día para darle mejores condiciones de vida, alimentación, salud y educación a sus hijos. la señora emprendió diferentes actividades buscando obtener ingresos para que sea sostenible su negocio y la de su familia. desde hace 2 años viene trabajando en el comercio dedicándose a la venta de prendas de vestir, negocio que le brinda ingresos económicos favorables para la sostenibilidad de su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida familiar. la señora adquirió habilidades en la actividad del comercio y en vista a la rentabilidad del negocio decide ampliar su mercadería para seguir mejorando su economía y tener una estabilidad económica, para darle mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Corina was born on 7 November 1984 in Zudañez province in Cochabamba department. She met her partner and from a very young age they went to the tropical region of Cochabamba department, where they worked as day labourers in a variety of activities. Thanks to both their hard work, they managed to get a plot of land where they currently live.

Señora Corina is a mother to four children with Emilio. Her husband died one year ago in an accident, however, Corina works hard every day to offer the best possible living conditions, food, healthcare and education to her children, She embarked on different activities seeking to make an income to sustain her business and her family.

She has been working in trade for two years now, selling clothing. This business provides her with an income to sustain her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She learned skills in selling and with the profitability of her business in mind, she has decided to expand her stock to continue improving her finances and achieve economic stability, so that she can offer better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to buy goods to expand her business and generate more income to give her children a more comfortable life.

loans.name: Dayim Group

texts.fr:
Mr MADI D. est responsable du groupe DAYIM. Marié, il est père de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 27 ans et le moins âgé a 09 ans car des jumeaux. 02 vont à l'école. Il a 06personnes en charge.
Mr vend du bétail depuis 10 ans. Il s'approvisionne dans son village.
Mr veut s'acheter 03 moutons.
Il veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Mr ambitionne bien s’occuper de ses enfants en les scolarisant.
texts.en:
Mr Madi D. is responsible for the DAYIM group. He is married and has five children: the oldest is 27 and the youngest, twins, are 9 years old. Two are going to school. He supports six people. He has been selling livestock for ten years and gets his supplies in his village. 

He would like to buy three sheep. He wants to use the profits to strengthen his business. His goal is to take good care of his children by sending them to school.

loans.use: to buy three sheep.

loans.name: Grupo Chuachinup Sector Campo Ll Group

texts.es:
Antonia es una mujer de 28 años de edad, con una linda familia de dos hijos una mujer y hombre, esta querida familia vive en una comunidad de Santo Tomas.
Antonia (la primera del lado izquierdo de la foto de blusa celeste)  para brindarle su apoyo a su amado esposo, desde hace cuatro años se propuso a dedicarse a alguna actividad que le permitiera a ella generar algo de ingresos, desde ese entonces se dedica a la compra  y venta de ropa típica, le gusta esta actividad, por ser muy rentable, Antonia gracias a su carisma con los clientes ahora su producto ya no se abasto por lo que ella ha considerado necesario un préstamo a raíz de esta necesidad ella solicita un préstamo para comprar productos de ropa como; güipiles, cortes fajas y todo lo relacionado con la línea de ropa.

Antonia tiene el anhelo de ver su negocio crecer y contar con una casa mucho más grande para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Antonia is a 28-year-old woman with a beautiful family made up of two children, a woman, and a man. This family lives in the community of Santo Tomas.

In order to support her beloved husband, Antonia (first on the left in the photo, wearing a light blue shirt), decided four years ago to begin working in something that would allow her to generate some income. Since then, she has been working in the business of buying and selling of traditional clothing. She enjoys this work because it is quite profitable. Thanks to Antonia's charisma with her customers, her product has already run out.

For this reason, she has deemed it necessary to take out a loan. Due to this need, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase clothing products like: huipils [a traditional Guatemalan garment], skirts, belts, and everything related to clothing. Antonia hopes to see her business grow and to have a much bigger house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Alewè Group

texts.fr:
Florence est âgée de 39 ans mariée mère de 3 enfants dont 2 scolarisés. Gérante de kiosque depuis 20 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c’est son expérience, son accueil, elle fait de bon repas et  es à l’écoute de sa clientèle. Elle veut le prêt pour s’acheter  75 000 de riz, 100 000 pour le lait, nescafé.
75 000 pour ingrédients  pour la cuisine. L’utilité du prêt c’est d’approvisionner en quantité suffisante pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 11 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Florence is 39 years old, married, and the mother of three children, of whom two are in school. She has worked running a kiosk for 20 years. What makes her business work is her experience and her know-how, along with her good food. Plus, she listens to her customers. 

She wants this loan to buy 75,000 francs CFA worth of rice and 100,000 francs CFA worth of Nescafe milk. She also will use 75,000 francs CFA for cooking ingredients. 

This loan will help her procure goods at a sufficient bulk to satisfy her customers.

Florence has already received 11 loans and has reimbursed all of them on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, Nescafe, and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Dove Group

texts.en:
Musa, who is in his 40s, is married with two kids who are still in school.  He has been selling fish for  six years now. He works from 7am to 6pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Musa's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase his fish stock and has managed to pay back his loan successfully. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to increase his fish stock and sell to more customers.

Musa will share this loan with his loan group Dove, which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his fish stock and sell to more customers

loans.name: Los Kioneros Group

texts.es:
Este grupo “Los Kioneros” está emprendiendo su segundo ciclo. La mayoría de los socios se conocen entre sí y son responsables. Este es el segundo crédito que tiene Nelly de 46 años, soltera con una hija que aun cursa el colegio, hace diez años ella se dedica a la venta de utensilios para el hogar de manera ambulatoria. Con los ingresos de sus ventas solventa los gastos de su hogar y estudios de su hija. Una de los sueños de Nelly es construir su casa para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su hija. El préstamo adquirido lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería de utensilios para el hogar (platos, tazas, vasos, ollas,etc). Nelly es la segunda persona que esta parada a lado derecho de la foto.
Ella esta agradecida con los inversionistas Kiva por haberle brindado el apoyo.
texts.en:
The "Los Kioneros" lending group is entering it's second cycle. The majority of its members know each other well and are responsible.

This will be Nelly's second loan. She is 46 years old, single and has a daughter who is in college. Ten years ago, she began selling household supplies. With her sales, she is able to cover her household expenses and her daughter's education. One of Nelly's dreams is to build a home so that she can provide her daughter with a better quality of life.
